 21222                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21223                                  
 21224                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 21225                                  ;***	Version - display DOS version
 21226                                  ;
 21227                                  ;	SYNTAX	ver [/debug]
 21228                                  ;
 21229                                  ;		/debug - display additional DOS configuration info
 21230                                  ;
 21231                                  ;	ENTRY	command-line tail is in PSP
 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ;	EXIT	if successful, nothing
 21234                                  ;		if parse fails,
 21235                                  ;		  parse error message is set up (for Std_EPrintf)
 21236                                  ;		    AX = system parser error code
 21237                                  ;		    DX = ptr to message block
 21238                                  ;		  we jump to CError
 21239                                  ;
 21240                                  ;	EFFECTS
 21241                                  ;	  If parse fails, a parse error message is displayed.
 21242                                  ;	  Otherwise, version message is displayed.
 21243                                  ;	  If /debug is specified, additional DOS info is displayed.
 21244                                  
 21245                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 21246                                  	; 08/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 21247                                  	; 20/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21248                                  VERSION:
 21249                                  	;assume	ds:TRANGROUP,es:TRANGROUP
 21250                                  
 21251                                  ;	Parse command line for /debug switch.
 21252                                  
 21253 00002060 BE8100                  	mov	si,81h			; DS:SI = ptr to command tail
 21254 00002063 BF[1B96]                	mov	di,PARSE_VER		; ES:DI = ptr to parse block
 21255 00002066 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; CX = # positional param's found
 21256 00002068 E8B704                  	call	Parse_With_Msg
 21257                                  
 21258 0000206B B301                    	mov	bl,1			; BL = flag = /debug present
 21259                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR
 21260                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 21261                                  	;je	short verPrintVer	; something parsed - must be /debug
 21262 0000206D 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 21263 0000206F 740A                    	jz	short verPrintVer 
 21264 00002071 FECB                    	dec	bl			; BL = flag = no /debug present
 21265                                  	;cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE ; -1
 21266 00002073 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 21267                                  
 21268                                  ; 20/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21269                                  %if 0
 21270                                  	je	short verPrintVer	; reached end of line - ok
 21271                                  %else
 21272 00002076 7414                    	je	short not_truever_sw
 21273                                  %endif
 21274                                  
 21275                                  ;	The parse failed. Error message has been set up.
 21276                                  
 21277 00002078 E95E0C                  	jmp	cerror
 21278                                  
 21279                                  verPrintVer:
 21280                                  
 21281                                  ; 20/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21282                                  %if 1
 21283                                  check_t_switch:
 21284 0000207B 813E[3DA5][3B96]        	cmp	word [PARSE1_SYN],SLASH_T_SYN ; "/T" ; /t switch
 21285 00002081 7509                    	jne	short not_truever_sw
 21286 00002083 BA[5F96]                	mov	dx,RD5CMD_VER_MSG
 21287 00002086 B409                    	mov	ah,STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT ; 9 ; print the message
 21288 00002088 CD21                    	int	21h
 21289 0000208A EB47                    	jmp	short verDone
 21290                                  not_truever_sw:
 21291                                  %endif
 21292 0000208C 53                      	push	bx			; save /debug flag
 21293 0000208D E8AA08                  	call	CRLF2
 21294 00002090 E84300                  	call	PRINT_VERSION
 21295 00002093 E8A408                  	call	CRLF2
 21296 00002096 5B                      	pop	bx   			; BL = /debug flag
 21297 00002097 08DB                    	or	bl,bl
 21298 00002099 7438                    	jz	short verDone		; /debug is false - we're done
 21299                                  
 21300                                  ;*	For /debug, display DOS internal revision and DOS location
 21301                                  ;	(low memory, HMA, or ROM).
 21302                                  
 21303                                  ;	Bugbug:	use symbols for bitmasks below.
 21304                                  
 21305                                  	;mov	ax,(Set_CTRL_C_Trapping shl 8) + 6 ; M013
 21306 0000209B B80633                  	mov	ax,3306h
 21307 0000209E CD21                    	int	21h
 21308                                  		; DOS - 5+ Get TRUE Version Number
 21309                                  		; (BL major, BH minor, DL revision, DH flags)
 21310 000020A0 88D0                    	mov	al,dl			;revision number in dl; M013
 21311 000020A2 88F7                    	mov	bh,dh			;flags in dh now; M013
 21312                                  ;M032	and	al,7			; AL = DOS internal revision
 21313 000020A4 3C19                    	cmp	al,'Z'-'A' ; 25	 ;M032	; revision in A-to-Z range?
 21314                                  	;jbe	short @f	 ;M032	; A-to-Z revision ok
 21315 000020A6 7602                    	jbe	short ver1
 21316                                  	;mov	al,0E9h
 21317 000020A8 B0E9                    	mov	al,'*'-'A' ; -23 ;M032	; beyond Z, just say revision *
 21318                                  ;@@:
 21319                                  ver1:
 21320                                  
 21321                                  ; 26/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21322                                  %if 0
 21323                                  	add	al,'A' ; 41h		; AL = DOS internal rev letter
 21324                                  %else
 21325                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 21326 000020AA 0430                    	add	al,'0'  ; 30h
 21327                                  %endif
 21328                                  
 21329 000020AC A2[FF9C]                	mov	[One_Char_Val],al
 21330 000020AF BA[8691]                	mov	dx,dosrev_ptr		; MSG_1090
 21331 000020B2 E8B832                  	call	std_printf		; print DOS internal revision
 21332                                  
 21333                                  ; 26/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21334                                  %if 1
 21335 000020B5 08D2                    	or	dl,dl
 21336 000020B7 741A                    	jz	short verDone		; Revision 0
 21337                                  %endif
 21338                                  
 21339 000020B9 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21340 000020BB D2EF                    	shr	bh,cl			; CY = DOS in ROM
 21341 000020BD 7209                    	jc	short verRom
 21342 000020BF D0EF                    	shr	bh,1			; CY = DOS in HMA
 21343 000020C1 720A                    	jc	short verHma
 21344                                  
 21345                                  ;	DOS isn't in ROM or HMA, so it must be in lower memory.
 21346                                  
 21347                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:DosLow_Ptr
 21348 000020C3 BA[9A91]                	mov	dx,DosLow_Ptr		; MSG_1093
 21349 000020C6 EB08                    	jmp	short verPrintLoc
 21350                                  verRom: 
 21351                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:DosRom_Ptr
 21352 000020C8 BA[9491]                	mov	dx,DosRom_Ptr		; MSG_1091
 21353 000020CB EB03                    	jmp	short verPrintLoc
 21354                                  verHma: 
 21355                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:DosHma_Ptr
 21356 000020CD BA[9791]                	mov	dx,DosHma_Ptr		; MSG_1092
 21357                                  verPrintLoc:
 21358 000020D0 E89A32                  	call	std_printf
 21359                                  verDone:
 21360 000020D3 E96408                  	jmp	CRLF2
 21361

 21369                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 21370                                  
 21371                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21372                                  PRINT_VERSION:
 21373                                  	;mov	ah,GET_VERSION ; 30h
 21374 000020D6 B430                    	mov	ah,30h
 21375 000020D8 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	GET DOS	VERSION
 21376                                  			; Return: AL = major version number (00h for DOS 1.x)
 21377 000020DA 50                      	push	ax
 21378 000020DB 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 21379 000020DD A3[FB9C]                	mov	[Major_Ver_Num],ax
 21380 000020E0 58                      	pop	ax
 21381 000020E1 86E0                    	xchg	ah,al
 21382 000020E3 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 21383 000020E5 A3[FD9C]                	mov	[Minor_Ver_Num],ax
 21384 000020E8 BA[D18F]                	mov	dx,VerMes_Ptr	; MSG_1040
 21385 000020EB E97F32                  	jmp	std_printf

 21388                                  
 21389                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21390                                  	; 08/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 21391                                  	; 03/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21392                                  
 21393                                  PRINT_PROMPT:
 21394                                  
 21395                                  ; 03/08/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 21396                                  %if 0
 21397                                  	push	ds
 21398                                  	push	cs
 21399                                  	pop	ds		; Make sure DS is in TRANGROUP
 21400                                  	push	es
 21401                                  	call	find_prompt	; Look for prompt string
 21402                                  	jc	short PP0	; Can't find one
 21403                                  	cmp	byte [es:di],0
 21404                                  	jnz	short PP1
 21405                                  PP0:				; Use default prompt
 21406                                  	call	PRINT_DRIVE
 21407                                  	mov	al,'>'
 21408                                  	;mov	al,SYM
 21409                                  	call	PRINT_CHAR
 21410                                  	jmp	short PP5
 21411                                  ;PP1:
 21412                                  ;	mov	al,[es:di]	; Get a char
 21413                                  ;	inc	di
 21414                                  ;	or	al,al
 21415                                  ;	jz	short PP5	; Nul terminated
 21416                                  ;	; 21/02/2023
 21417                                  ;	cmp	al,'$' ; 24h
 21418                                  ;	;cmp	al,[DOLLAR]	; Meta character
 21419                                  ;	jz	short PP2	; Nope
 21420                                  ;	call	PRINT_CHAR
 21421                                  ;	jmp	short PP1
 21422                                  PP2:
 21423                                  	mov	al,[es:di]
 21424                                  	inc	di
 21425                                  	;mov	bx,CLSSTRING+2	; "[2J"
 21426                                  	mov	bx,PROMPT_TABLE-3
 21427                                  	or	al,al
 21428                                  	jz	short PP5
 21429                                  PP3:
 21430                                  	add	bx,3
 21431                                  	; 21/02/2023
 21432                                  	call	UPCONV		; MSDOS 5.0 (& 6.0)
 21433                                  	;call	UPCONV_MAPCALL  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21434                                  	cmp	al,[bx]
 21435                                  	jz	short PP4
 21436                                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 21437                                  	jnz	short PP3

 21837                                  
 21838                                  ; ****************************************************************
 21839                                  ; *
 21840                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 CLS
 21841                                  ; *
 21842                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Clear the screen using INT 10h. If ANSI.SYS is
 21843                                  ; *		 installed, send a control string to clear the
 21844                                  ; *		 screen.
 21845                                  ; *
 21846                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 21847                                  ; *
 21848                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 none
 21849                                  ; *
 21850                                  ; ****************************************************************
 21851                                  
 21852                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21853                                  
 21854                                  ANSI_installed	equ 0FFh
 21855                                  
 21856                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 21857                                  	; 08/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 21858                                  	; 03/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 21859                                  CLS:
 21860                                  	;;mov	ah,Mult_ANSI		;AN000; see if ANSI.SYS installed
 21861                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 21862                                  	;mov	al,0			;AN000;
 21863 00002298 B8001A                  	mov	ax,1A00h
 21864 0000229B CD2F                    	int	2Fh			;AN000;
 21865                                  		; - Multiplex - DOS 4+ ANSI.SYS internal - INSTALLATION CHECK
 21866                                  		; Return: AL = FFh if installed
 21867 0000229D 3CFF                    	cmp	al,ANSI_installed	;AN000;
 21868 0000229F 7429                    	je	short ansicls 		;AN000; installed - go do ANSI CLS
 21869                                  
 21870                                  check_lines:
 21871                                  	;mov	ax,(IOCTL SHL 8) + generic_ioctl_handle ; 440Ch
 21872 000022A1 B80C44                  	mov	ax,440Ch		;AN000; get lines per page on display
 21873                                  	;mov	bx,stdout		;AN000; lines for stdout
 21874 000022A4 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1   ; handle
 21875                                  	;;mov	ch,ioc_sc		;AN000; type is display
 21876                                  	;mov	ch,3   ; CON device	
 21877                                  	;;mov	cl,get_generic		;AN000; get information
 21878                                  	;mov	cl,7Fh ; minor function, get display info
 21879                                  	; 25/04/2023
 21880 000022A7 B97F03                  	mov	cx,037Fh
 21881 000022AA BA[559E]                	mov	dx,Display_Ioctl	;AN000;
 21882 000022AD CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 21883 000022AF 720A                    	jc	short no_variable	;AN000; function had error, use default
 21884                                  		; 21/02/2023
 21885                                  		; ds:dx = parameter block
 21886                                  		; --- https://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-44-c.html ---
 21887                                  		; offset 00h  byte  level (0 for DOS 4.0)
 21888                                  		;   	 01h  byte  reserved
 21889                                  		;   	 02h  word  length of following data
 21890                                  		;   	 04h  word  control flags
 21891                                  		;	       bit 0 set for blink, clear for intensity
 21892                                  		;	       bits 1 to 15 reserved
 21893                                  		;   	 06h  byte  mode type (1=text, 2=graphics)
 21894                                  		;   	 07h  byte  reserved
 21895                                  		;   	 08h  word  colors; 0=monochrome, n=bits per pixel
 21896                                  		;   	 0Ah  word  pixel columns
 21897                                  		;   	 0Ch  word  pixel rows
 21898                                  		;   	 0Eh  word  character columns
 21899                                  		;   	 10h  word  character rows
 21900                                  	
 21901                                  	;mov	ax,[LinPerPag] ; [Display_Ioctl+10h]
 21902                                  	;				;AN000; get number of rows returned
 21903                                  	;mov	dh,al			;AN000; set number of rows
 21904                                  	;mov	ax,[display_width] ; [Display_Ioctl+0Eh]
 21905                                  	;				;AN000; get number of columns returned

 21909 000022B5 8A36[659E]              	mov	dh,[LinPerPag]

 21912                                  no_variable:

 21933                                  	;mov	ah,get_video_state	;AC000; set up to get video state

 21945                                  ; be just as bogus and set the mode that we just got. This will blank the

 21955                                  
 21956                                  ; Get video mode and number of columns to scroll
 21957                                  
 21958                                  ;M01 - INT 10 Function 0F doesn't reliably return the number of rows on some
 21959                                  ;M01   adaptors. We circumvent this by reaching directly into the BIOS data
 21960                                  ;M01   area
 21961                                  ;M01   Commented out code here is the original
 21962                                  ;M01	mov	ah,get_video_state	;AC000; set up to get current video state

 21968

 21970                                  	;mov	ax,ROMBIOS_DATA 	; GET ROM Data segment	M01

 21978 000022EF 1F                      	pop	ds			;			M01
 21979

 21981 000022F2 7502                    	jnz	short regcls		;  *JMP IF NO		M01

 21986                                  regcls:

 21996                                  ; ****************************************************************
 21997                                  ; *
 21998                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 REG_CLS
 21999                                  ; *
 22000                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Clear the screen using INT 10H.
 22001                                  ; *
 22002                                  ; * INPUT:	 DL = NUMBER OF COLUMNS
 22003                                  ; *		 DH = NUMBER OF ROWS
 22004                                  ; *
 22005                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 none
 22006                                  ; *
 22007                                  ; ****************************************************************
 22008                                  
 22009                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 22010                                  reg_cls:
 22011                                  ; Set overscan to black.
 22012                                  
 22013 000022FC FECE                    	dec	dh			; decrement rows and columns
 22014 000022FE FECA                    	dec	dl			;  to zero base
 22015 00002300 52                      	push	dx			; save rows,columns
 22016                                  	;mov	ah,set_color_palette	; set up to set the color to blank
 22017 00002301 B40B                    	mov	ah,0Bh
 22018 00002303 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 22019                                  	;int	video_io_int		; do int 10h - BIOS video IO
 22020 00002305 CD10                    	int	10h
 22021 00002307 5A                      	pop	dx			;  restore rows,colums
 22022                                  
 22023 00002308 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; zero out ax
 22024 0000230A 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			;  and cx
 22025                                  
 22026                                  ; Scroll active page
 22027                                  
 22028                                  	;mov	ah,scroll_video_page	; set up to scroll page up
 22029 0000230C B406                    	mov	ah,6
 22030                                  	;mov	bh,video_attribute	; attribute for blank line
 22031 0000230E B707                    	mov	bh,7
 22032 00002310 30DB                    	xor	bl,bl			; set BL to 0
 22033                                  	;int	video_io_int		; do int 10h - BIOS video IO
 22034 00002312 CD10                    	int	10h
 22035                                  
 22036                                  ; Seek to cursor to 0,0
 22037                                  
 22038                                  ;M022 following two lines added
 22039                                  	;mov	ah,get_video_state	; get current video page in BH
 22040 00002314 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh
 22041                                  	;int	video_io_int
 22042 00002316 CD10                    	int	10h
 22043                                  	;mov	ah,set_cursor_position	; set up to set cursor position
 22044 00002318 B402                    	mov	ah,2
 22045 0000231A 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; row and column 0
 22046                                  ;M022	mov	bh,0
 22047                                  	;int	video_io_int		; do into 10h - BIOS video IO
 22048 0000231C CD10                    	int	10h
 22049                                  
 22050 0000231E C3                      	retn

 22179                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filename

 22275                                  ;****************************************************************
 22276                                  ;*
 22277                                  ;* ROUTINE:	CHCP - Change code page internal command
 22278                                  ;*		(added DOS 3.30 07/21/86)
 22279                                  ;*
 22280                                  ;* SYNTAX:	CHCP [xxx]
 22281                                  ;*		where xxx is a valid code page
 22282                                  ;*
 22283                                  ;* FUNCTION:	If xxx is specified, CHCP will use INT 21H function
 22284                                  ;*		6402H to set the code page to xxxx. If no parameters
 22285                                  ;*		are specified, CHCP will use INT 21H function 6401H
 22286                                  ;*		to get global code page and display it to the user.
 22287                                  ;*
 22288                                  ;* INPUT:	command line at offset 81H
 22289                                  ;*
 22290                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 22291                                  ;*
 22292                                  ;****************************************************************
 22293                                  
 22294                                  NLSFUNC_installed equ  0FFh
 22295                                  set_global_cp	  equ  2
 22296                                  get_global_cp	  equ  1
 22297                                  
 22298                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22299                                  	; 09/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 22300                                  	; 10/06/2023
 22301                                  	; 03/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1) COMMAND.COM
 22302                                  CHCP:
 22303                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 22307 000023D4 BF[1595]                	mov	di,PARSE_CHCP
 22308                                  				;AN000; Get address of PARSE_CHCP
 22309 000023D7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		;AC000; clear cx,dx
 22310 000023D9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AC000;
 22311 000023DB E84401                  	call    Parse_With_Msg	;AC018; call parser
 22312                                  
 22313                                  	;cmp	ax,-1
 22314                                  	;;cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE	;AN000; are we at end of line?
 22315                                  	;;jne	short setcp	;AC000; no go get number & set code page
 22316                                  	;je	short getcp	;AC000; yes - no parm - get code page
 22317                                  ;setcp:
 22318                                  	;;cmp	ax,0
 22319                                  	;;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR
 22320                                  	;			;AN000; did we have an error?
 22321                                  	;;jne	short cp_error	;AC018; yes - go issue message
 22322                                  	;and	ax,ax ; ax > 0 ?
 22323                                  	;jnz	short cp_error	
 22324                                  	; 10/06/2023
 22325 000023DE 40                      	inc	ax  ; cmp ax,-1	
 22326 000023DF 745C                    	jz	short getcp ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22327 000023E1 48                      	dec	ax  ; cmp ax,0

 22329                                  	; ax = 0

 22339                                  	;mov	[system_cpage],di

 22345 000023EF E81A01                  	call	parse_check_eol ;AN000; are we at end of line?
 22346 000023F2 7546                    	jnz	short cp_error	;AC000; no - exit
 22347                                  okset:

 22447                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 TRUENAME

 22451                                  ; *		 SRCXNAME to path. If only a drive letter is found,
 22452                                  ; *		 set SRCXNAME to the drive letter. If no path

 22455                                  ; *		 call to get the real name and  then display the

 22672                                  ; *
 22673                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 PARSE_CHECK_EOL
 22674                                  ; *
 22675                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Calls parser to see if end of line occurred.
 22676                                  ; *		 If not end of line, set up to print parse
 22677                                  ; *		 error message. ASSUMES NO MORE PARAMETERS ARE
 22678                                  ; *		 EXPECTED!
 22679                                  ; *
 22680                                  ; * INPUT:	 DS:SI	  last output from parser
 22681                                  ; *		 ES:DI	  points to parse block
 22682                                  ; *		 CX	  last output from parser
 22683                                  ; *
 22684                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AX	  parser return code
 22685                                  ; *
 22686                                  ; *		 if end of line found
 22687                                  ; *		     zero flag set
 22688                                  ; *		 else
 22689                                  ; *		     MSG_DISPLAY_CLASS set to parse error
 22690                                  ; *
 22691                                  ; ****************************************************************
 22692                                  
 22693                                  	; 23/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 22694                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2270h
 22695                                  
 22696                                  	; 04/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 22697                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2648h
 22698                                  parse_check_eol:
 22699 0000250C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000;

 22701 00002512 E88723                  	call	cmd_parse		;AN000; call parser
 22702 00002515 3CFF                    	cmp	al,-1 ; 0FFh
 22703                                  	;cmp	al,END_OF_LINE	; 0FFh	;AN000; Are we at end of line?
 22704 00002517 7408                    	je	short parse_good_eol	;AN000; yes - no problem
 22705                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 22706                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR	;AN018; was any error found?

 22708 0000251B 7501                    	jnz	short ok_to_setup_pmsg	;AN018; yes - continue

 22710                                  ok_to_setup_pmsg:
 22711 0000251E E81000                  	call	setup_parse_error_msg	;AN018; go set up error message
 22712                                  parse_good_eol:

 23023                                  	; 23/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 23024                                  delete_name_in_environment:
 23025                                  
 23026                                  ; Input: DS:SI points to a "=" terminated string
 23027                                  ; Output: carry flag is set if name not found
 23028                                  ;	  otherwise name is deleted
 23029                                  
 23030 00002655 56                      	push	si
 23031 00002656 1E                      	push	ds
 23032 00002657 E82C00                  	call	FIND		; ES:DI points to name
 23033 0000265A 7217                    	jc	short del1
 23034 0000265C 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; Save it
 23035 0000265E E8BF00                  	call	SCASB2		; Scan for the nul
 23036 00002661 87F7                    	xchg	si,di
 23037                                  ;SR;
 23038                                  ; If we have only one env string, then the double null is lost when the last
 23039                                  ;string is deleted and we have an invalid empty environment with only a
 23040                                  ;single null. To avoid this, we will look for the double null case and then
 23041                                  ;move an extra null char.
 23042                                  ; Bugbug: The only possible problem is that the last pathstring
 23043                                  ;will be followed by a triple null. Is this really a problem?
 23044                                  
 23045                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23046 00002663 26803C00                	cmp	byte [es:si],0	;null char?
 23047 00002667 7501                    	jnz	short not_dnull	;no, we are at a double null
 23048 00002669 4E                      	dec	si		;point at the double null
 23049                                  not_dnull:
 23050                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 23051 0000266A E86901                  	call	GETENVSIZ
 23052 0000266D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si

 23057                                  del1:
 23058 00002673 1F                      	pop	ds
 23059 00002674 5E                      	pop	si
 23060                                  find_retn:
 23061 00002675 C3                      	retn

 23109 00002696 56                      	push	si
 23110 00002697 57                      	push	di

 23116 0000269C 740F                    	jz	short notkanj3

 23120 000026A1 47                      	inc	di

 23292                                  ; ****************************************************************
 23293                                  ; *
 23294                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 23295                                  ; *
 23296                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 23297                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 23298                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 23299                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 23300                                  ; *
 23301                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 23302                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 23303                                  ; *
 23304                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 23305                                  ; *
 23306                                  ; ****************************************************************
 23307                                  
 23308                                  	; 24/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 23309                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:24C4h
 23310                                  
 23311                                  	; 10/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 23312                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2A6Eh
 23313                                  
 23314                                  	; 04/08/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 23315                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:289Ch
 23316                                  UPCONV:
 23317 00002752 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 23318 00002754 7213                    	jb	short oth_fucase	;AN000;  no - upper case math
 23319 00002756 2C80                    	sub	al,80h			;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 23320 00002758 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 23321 00002759 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 23322 0000275A 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]		;AN000;  get resident data segment
 23323                                  	;lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1
 23324 0000275E C51E[B602]              	lds	bx,[FUCase_Addr+1]	;AN000;  get table address
 23325 00002762 83C302                  	add	bx,2			;AN000;  skip over first word
 23326                                  	;xlat	ds:byte ptr [bx]	;AN000;  convert to upper case
 23327 00002765 D7                      	xlat
 23328 00002766 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 23329 00002767 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 23330                                  	;jmp	short upconv_end	;AN000;  we finished - exit
 23331                                  	; 10/06/2023
 23332                                  upconv_end:
 23333                                  	; 24/02/2023
 23334 00002768 C3                      	retn
 23335                                  oth_fucase:				;AN000;
 23336 00002769 3C61                    	cmp	al,'a' ; small_a	;AC000; if between "a" and "z",
 23337 0000276B 72FB                    	jb	short upconv_end	;AC000;    subtract 20h to get
 23338 0000276D 3C7A                    	cmp	al,'z' ; small_z	;AC000;    upper case equivalent.
 23339 0000276F 77F7                    	ja	short upconv_end	;AC000;
 23340 00002771 2C20                    	sub	al,20h			;AC000; Change lower-case to upper
 23341                                  ;upconv_end:	; 10/06/2023		;AN000;
 23342 00002773 C3                      	retn

 23507                                  ; ****************************************************************
 23508                                  ; *
 23509                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 $CHDIR
 23510                                  ; *
 23511                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Entry point for CHDIR command. Parse the command
 23512                                  ; *		 line. If path is found, CHDIR to path. If a drive
 23513                                  ; *		 letter is found, get and display the current dir
 23514                                  ; *		 of the specified drive. If nothing is found, get
 23515                                  ; *		 and display the current dir of the default drive.
 23516                                  ; *
 23517                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 23518                                  ; *
 23519                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 none
 23520                                  ; *
 23521                                  ; ****************************************************************

 23523                                  	; 24/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 23524

 23527

 23542                                  	;je	short bwdj	; No args

 23546                                  	;or	ax,ax ; ax = 0 ?

 23548

 23808                                  ;* ROUTINE:	SETRMMK
 23809                                  ;*
 23810                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Parse routine for the internal MKDIR and RMDIR
 23811                                  ;*		commands. Parses the command line for a required
 23812                                  ;*		filespec.

 23815                                  ;*
 23816                                  ;* OUTPUT:	carry clear
 23817                                  ;*		    DS:DX points to ASCIIZ argument
 23818                                  ;*		carry set

 23820                                  ;*

 23823                                  	; 24/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)

 23938                                  ; SavUDir - move the user's current directory on a drive into UserDir1
 23939                                  ; SavUDir1 - move the user's current directory on a drive into a specified
 23940                                  ;   buffer
 23941                                  ;

 23943                                  ;		ES:DI has destination buffer (SavUDir1 only)
 23944                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear
 23945                                  ;		    DS = TranGroup
 23946                                  ;		Carry Set
 23947                                  ;		    AX has error code
 23948                                  ;   Registers Modified: AX, SI

 23972                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 23973                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area

 24149                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24150                                  
 24151                                  ; PATHCRUNCH -
 24152                                  ;
 24153                                  ; ENTRY FCB (in PSP) contains drive # to crunch on
 24154                                  ;       PathPos = ptr to string with pathname in it
 24155                                  ;       PathCnt = length of string
 24156                                  ;
 24157                                  ; EXIT  PathPos = ptr after pathname (w/ NULL) in string
 24158                                  ;       PathCnt = length left in string
 24159                                  ;       DestIsDir = nonzero if pathname delimiter char's found in pathname
 24160                                  ;       DestInfo<bit1> = set if wildcard char's found in pathname
 24161                                  ;       If path crunched successfully,
 24162                                  ;         CY = clear
 24163                                  ;         Current directory is changed to directory in pathname
 24164                                  ;         UserDir1 contains previous directory for use by RestUDir
 24165                                  ;         RestDir = nonzero to flag later restoration of user's dir
 24166                                  ;         DestTail = ptr to beginning of filename
 24167                                  ;         If filename found in pathname,
 24168                                  ;           ZR = clear
 24169                                  ;           FCB filename fields contain filename
 24170                                  ;         If filename not found (pure directory path),
 24171                                  ;           ZR = set
 24172                                  ;           FCB filename fields are wildcarded with ?'s
 24173                                  ;       If pathcrunch failed (no ChDir's worked),
 24174                                  ;         CY = set
 24175                                  ;         Msg_Numb = extended error code
 24176                                  ;
 24177                                  ; NOTE  DIR asks PathCrunch to forego parsing the filename into the
 24178                                  ;       FCB by setting DirFlag. In this case, the FCB is returned
 24179                                  ;       with the filename wildcarded.
 24180                                  
 24181                                  	; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 24182                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2767h
 24183                                  
 24184                                  	; 11/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 24185                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2D11h
 24186                                  PathCrunch:
 24187                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24188 000029E3 C706[829E]0000          	mov     word [Msg_Numb],0
 24189                                  				;AN022; Set up message flag
 24190                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 24191                                  	;mov	dl,[5Ch]
 24192 000029E9 8A165C00                	mov	dl,[FCB]	; DL = drive # (1 = A)
 24193 000029ED E824FF                  	call	SAVUDIR		; save current directory in UserDir1
 24194                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24195 000029F0 7233                     	jc	short pcrunch_cderrj
 24196                                  				;AN022; if error on current dir - report
 24197 000029F2 E87E04                  	call	SETPATH		; scan past switches, whitespace
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;       DX = ptr to pathname, NULL-terminated
 24200                                  ;       PathPos = ptr to byte after NULL at end of pathname
 24201                                  
 24202                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 24203 000029F5 F606[0B9D]02            	test	byte [DestInfo],2 ; test if wildcards (? or *) seen
 24204 000029FA 752C                    	jnz	short trypeel	; wildcard seen, peel filename
 24205                                  
 24206                                  	;mov	ah,CHDir ; 3Bh
 24207 000029FC B43B                    	mov	ah,3Bh
 24208 000029FE CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - CHANGE THE	CURRENT	DIRECTORY (CHDIR)
 24209                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ directory name	(may include drive)
 24210                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24211 00002A00 7313                    	jnc	short chdir_worked	;AN022; no error - continue
 24212                                  	
 24213 00002A02 E844F6                  	call	get_ext_error_number    ;AN022; get the extended error
 24214 00002A05 83F803                  	cmp	ax,ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND ;AN022; if path not found
 24215 00002A08 741E                    	je	short trypeel		;AC022;    keep trying
 24216 00002A0A 83F805                  	cmp	ax,ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED  ;AN022; if access denied
 24217 00002A0D 7419                    	je	short trypeel		;AC022;    keep trying

 24405                                  %if 1
 24406                                  ;ifdef DBCS
 24407                                  ;
 24408                                  ;	Check if the character position is at Tail Byte of DBCS
 24409                                  ;
 24410                                  ;	input:	ds:si = start address of the string
 24411                                  ;		ds:di = character position to check
 24412                                  ;	output:	ZF = 1 if at Tail Byte
 24413                                  ;
 24414                                  ;CheckDBCSTailByte proc near
 24415                                  CheckDBCSTailByte:
 24416 00002AE3 50                      	push	ax
 24417 00002AE4 51                      	push	cx
 24418 00002AE5 57                      	push	di
 24419 00002AE6 89F9                    	mov	cx,di			; save character position
 24420                                  cdtb_check:
 24421 00002AE8 39F7                    	cmp	di,si
 24422 00002AEA 7409                    	jz	short cdtb_next		; if at the top
 24423 00002AEC 4F                      	dec	di			; go back
 24424 00002AED 8A05                    	mov	al,[di]			; get character
 24425                                  	;invoke	testkanj
 24426 00002AEF E836FC                  	call	testkanj
 24427 00002AF2 75F4                    	jnz	short cdtb_check	; if DBCS lead byte do next
 24428 00002AF4 47                      	inc	di			; adjust
 24429                                  cdtb_next:
 24430 00002AF5 29F9                    	sub	cx,di			; if the length is odd then
 24431 00002AF7 80F101                  	xor	cl,1			; the character position is
 24432 00002AFA F6C101                  	test	cl,1			; at the tail byte
 24433 00002AFD 5F                      	pop	di
 24434 00002AFE 59                      	pop	cx
 24435 00002AFF 58                      	pop	ax
 24436 00002B00 C3                      	retn
 24437                                  ;CheckDBCSTailByte endp
 24438                                  ;endif
 24439                                  %endif

 24448                                  ;	More misc routines
 24449                                  
 24450                                  ;---------------------------
 24451                                  ; We can get rid of this switch processing code if we can take
 24452                                  ; care of the remaining two calls to switch, later in the file.
 24453                                  ; However, I have not checked whether or not any other files use
 24454                                  ; switch -- after all, it IS public!
 24455                                  ;---------------------------
 24456                                  
 24457                                  ; 14/06/2023
 24458                                  SWCOUNT	EQU 8	; MSDOS 6.22		; Length of switch_list
 24459                                  ; 28/03/2023
 24460                                  ;SWCOUNT  EQU  6  ; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 5.0)
 24461                                  ;;SWCOUNT EQU  5  ; MSDOS 3.3	
 24462                                  
 24463                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 1AC2h
 24464                                  
 24465                                  ; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 24466                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2869h
 24467                                  
 24468                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24469                                  
 24470                                  	; 25/02/2023
 24471                                  RETSW:
 24472 00002B01 93                      	xchg	ax,bx		; Put switches in AX
 24473 00002B02 C3                      	retn
 24474                                  
 24475                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24476                                  
 24477                                  	; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24478                                  	; 11/06/2023 - Retro DOS 4.2 COMMAND.COM
 24479                                  SWITCH:
 24480 00002B03 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; Initialize - no switches set
 24481                                  SWLOOP:
 24482 00002B05 E83FFE                  	call	scanoff		; Skip any delimiters
 24483 00002B08 3A06[469B]              	cmp	al,[SWITCHAR]	; Is it a switch specifier?
 24484 00002B0C 75F3                    	jnz	short RETSW	; No -- we're finished
 24485 00002B0E 81CB0080                	or	bx,8000h
 24486                                  	;or	bx,FSWITCH	; Indicate there is a switch specified
 24487 00002B12 46                      	inc	si		; Skip over the switch character
 24488 00002B13 E831FE                  	call	scanoff
 24489 00002B16 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh
 24490 00002B18 74E7                    	je	short RETSW	; Oops
 24491 00002B1A 46                      	inc	si
 24492                                  
 24493                                  	; Convert lower case input to upper case
 24494                                  
 24495 00002B1B E834FC                  	call	UPCONV
 24496                                  	;call	UPCONV_MAPCALL	; MSDOS 3.3
 24497                                  
 24498 00002B1E BF[B194]                	mov	di,switch_list	; "-Y?VBAPW" (for MSDOS 6.22) ; 11/06/2023
 24499                                  				; "?VBAPW" (for MSDOS 6.0)
 24500                                  				; ("VBAPW" (for MSDOS 3.3))
 24501                                  	; 11/06/2023
 24502                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2E33h
 24503 00002B21 B90800                  	mov	cx,8  ; MSDOS 6.22	   	
 24504                                  	;mov	cx,6  ; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 5.0)
 24505                                  	;;mov	cx,5  ; MSDOS 3.3
 24506                                  	;;mov	cx,SWCOUNT ; 5 (for MSDOS 3.3), (6 (for MSDOS 6.0))
 24507                                  		
 24508                                  	;nop
 24509                                  		
 24510 00002B24 F2AE                    	repne	scasb		; Look for matching switch
 24511 00002B26 7507                    	jnz	short BADSW
 24512 00002B28 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 24513 00002B2B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; Set a bit for the switch
 24514 00002B2D 09C3                    	or	bx,ax
 24515                                  BADSW: 				; Retro DOS v3.0 COMMAND.COM modificiation
 24516 00002B2F EBD4                    	jmp	short SWLOOP
 24517                                  ;BADSW:
 24518                                  	;jmp	short SWLOOP
 24519                                  ;DRVBAD:
 24520                                  ;	mov	dx,baddrv_ptr
 24521                                  ;	jmp	cerror
 24522                                  EXTERNALJ:
 24523 00002B31 E90501                  	jmp	EXTERNAL
 24524                                  FNDCOM:				; search the internal command table
 24525 00002B34 08C0                    	or	al,al		; Get real length of first arg
 24526 00002B36 74F9                    	jz	short EXTERNALJ	; If 0, it must begin with "\" so has
 24527                                  				;  to be external.
 24528                                  ; barryf code starts here
 24529                                  
 24530 00002B38 E82703                  	call	test_append	; see if APPEND installed
 24531 00002B3B 7429                    	jz	short CONTCOM	; not loaded
 24532                                  
 24533                                  APPEND_INTERNAL:
 24534 00002B3D 8A0E[0A9C]              	mov	cl,[IDLEN]
 24535 00002B41 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 24536 00002B43 890E[DF9C]              	mov	[PathPos],cx
 24537                                  	
 24538                                  	; 25/02/2023	
 24539                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24540 00002B47 FE06[849E]              	inc 	byte [append_exec]
 24541                                  				;AN041; set APPEND to ON
 24542 00002B4B E8B603                  	call	IOSET		; re-direct the o'l io
 24543                                  
 24544 00002B4E BE[0A9C]                	mov	si,IDLEN	; address command name, DS already set	
 24545 00002B51 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; set invoke function
 24546                                  		
 24547                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24548 00002B54 BF[5753]                	mov	di,append_parse
 24549                                  				;AN010; Get the entry point for PARSE for APPEND
 24550                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 24551 00002B57 B801AE                  	mov	ax,0AE01h
 24552 00002B5A CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; - Multiplex -	DOS 3.3+ internal
 24553                                  			; - INSTALLABLE	COMMAND	- EXECUTE
 24554                                  			; DX = FFFFh, DS:SI -> buffer
 24555                                  			; Return: buffer at DS:SI filled with a	length byte
 24556                                  			; followed by the uppercase internal command
 24557                                  			; to execute (if length not 0)
 24558                                  	; 25/02/2023
 24559                                  	; INT 2Fh
 24560                                  	; 	AX = AE01h
 24561                                  	; entry:
 24562                                  	; 	DX = magic value FFFFh
 24563                                  	; 	CH = 00h
 24564                                  	; 	CL = length of command name
 24565                                  	; 	DS:BX -> command line buffer  -- (offset COMBUF)
 24566                                  	; 	DS:SI -> command name buffer  -- (offset IDLEN)
 24567                                  	; return:
 24568                                  	;	DS:SI buffer updated
 24569                                  	;	if length byte is nonzero, the following bytes contain
 24570                                  	;	the uppercase internal command to execute and the command line
 24571                                  	; 	buffer contains the command's parameters
 24572                                  	;	(the first DS:[SI] bytes are ignored)
 24573                                  	;
 24574                                  	; Format of COMMAND.COM command line buffer:
 24575                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 24576                                  	;	00h     BYTE    max length of command line, as in INT 21/AH=0Ah
 24577                                  	;	01h     BYTE    count of bytes to follow, excluding terminating 0Dh
 24578                                  	;	N BYTEs command line text, terminated by 0Dh
 24579                                  	;
 24580                                  	; Format of command name buffer:
 24581                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 24582                                  	;	00h     BYTE    length of command name
 24583                                  	;	01h    N BYTEs  uppercased command name (blank-padded to 11 chars)
 24584                                  
 24585 00002B5C 803E[0A9C]00            	cmp	byte [IDLEN],0 ; execute requested
 24586 00002B61 7503                    	jne	short CONTCOM
 24587 00002B63 E9A300                  	jmp	CMD_DONE
 24588                                  
 24589                                  	;nop
 24590                                  CONTCOM:			; continue with internal scan
 24591 00002B66 BF[3093]                	mov	di,COMTAB
 24592 00002B69 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 24593                                  FINDCOM:
 24594 00002B6B BE[0B9C]                	mov	si,ID		; pointer to command argument
 24595 00002B6E 8A0D                    	mov	cl,[di]		; load length of internal command
 24596 00002B70 47                      	inc	di		; advance past length
 24597 00002B71 E3BE                    	jcxz	EXTERNALJ 	; if it's zero, we're out of internals
 24598 00002B73 3A0E[0A9C]              	cmp	cl,[IDLEN]	; that of the command argument
 24599 00002B77 7506                    	jne	short ABCD	; lengths not equal ==> strings not eq
 24600 00002B79 890E[DF9C]              	mov	[PathPos],cx	; store length of command
 24601 00002B7D F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 24602                                  ABCD:					
 24603 00002B7F 9F                      	lahf			; save the good ol' flags
 24604 00002B80 01CF                    	add	di,cx		; skip over remaining internal, if any
 24605 00002B82 8A05                    	mov	al,[di]		; load drive-check indicator byte (DCIB)
 24606 00002B84 A2[549B]                	mov	[CHKDRV],al	; save command flag byte in chkdrv
 24607 00002B87 47                      	inc	di		; increment DI (OK, OK, I'll stop)
 24608 00002B88 8B1D                    	mov	bx,[di]		; load internal command address
 24609 00002B8A 47                      	inc	di		; skip over the puppy
 24610 00002B8B 47                      	inc	di
 24611                                  		
 24612                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24613 00002B8C 8B15                    	mov	dx,[di]		; load ptr to help msg #s
 24614 00002B8E 47                      	inc	di
 24615 00002B8F 47                      	inc	di
 24616 00002B90 9E                      	sahf			; remember those flags?
 24617 00002B91 75D8                    	jnz	short FINDCOM	; well, if all the cmps worked...
 24618                                  
 24619                                  ; All messages get redirected.
 24620                                  
 24621 00002B93 803E[849E]00            	cmp     byte [append_exec],0
 24622                                  				;AN041; APPEND just executed?
 24623 00002B98 7503                    	jnz 	short DONT_SET_IO
 24624                                  				;AN041; Yes - this junk is already set
 24625 00002B9A E86703                  	call	IOSET		; re-direct the ol' i/o
 24626                                  
 24627                                  DONT_SET_IO:			;AN041;
 24628                                  
 24629                                  ; Check for /?. Certain commands, flagged fLimitHelp,
 24630                                  ; respond to /? only if it is the only command-line argument.
 24631                                  
 24632 00002B9D A1[599B]                	mov	ax,[COMSW]	; AX = switches after command
 24633 00002BA0 0B06[5F9B]              	or	ax,[AllSwitch]	; AX = all switches
 24634                                  	;and	ax,SwitchQues	
 24635 00002BA4 83E020                  	and	ax,20h
 24636 00002BA7 7426                    	jz	short DRIVE_CHECK
 24637                                  				; /? not in command line
 24638 00002BA9 F606[549B]04            	test	byte [CHKDRV],4	
 24639                                  	;test	byte [CHKDRV],fLimitHelp
 24640 00002BAE 7407                    	jz	short DO_HELP	; /? allowed in combination
 24641                                  
 24642                                  ; Make sure /? is the only argument on the command line.
 24643                                  
 24644 00002BB0 833E[5EA1]02            	cmp	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],2
 24645 00002BB5 7518                    	jne	short DRIVE_CHECK
 24646                                  				; /? not only arg - ignore
 24647                                  
 24648                                  ; Note: this is all the check we need, even against things like /??.
 24649                                  ; Our argv parser breaks /?? into two args, /? and ?.
 24650                                  
 24651                                  DO_HELP:
 24652                                  ; DX = ptr to word list of msg #s, terminated by zero word
 24653                                  
 24654 00002BB7 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; SI = ptr to list of msg #s
 24655                                      	;mov	ax,no_subst	; AL = no subst's code
 24656 00002BB9 B80000                  	mov	ax,0

 24917                                  
 24918                                  ; Prescan converts the input buffer into a canonicalized form.
 24919                                  ; All redirections and pipes are removed.
 24920                                  
 24921                                  	; 26/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24922                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2A51h
 24923

 24927                                  PRESCAN:
 24928 00002CDF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 24929 00002CE1 8E06[429B]              	mov	es,[RESSEG]
 24930 00002CE5 BE[A399]                	mov	si,COMBUF+2
 24931 00002CE8 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 24932                                  COUNTQUOTES:
 24933 00002CEA AC                      	lodsb			; get a byte
 24934 00002CEB 3C22                    	cmp	al,22h	; '"'	; is it a quote?
 24935 00002CED 7504                    	jne	short COUNTEND	; no, try for end of road
 24936 00002CEF FEC5                    	inc	ch		; bump count

 24938                                  				; go get next char
 24939                                  COUNTEND:

 24941 00002CF5 75F3                    	jne	short COUNTQUOTES
 24942                                  				; no, go back for next char
 24943                                  	; 26/02/2023
 24944                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (& 6.0)

 24946 00002CF8 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; restore pointer to begining
 24947                                  KanjiScan:

 24951                                  				; no, check for quotes

 24953 00002D02 AC                      	lodsb			; get trailing byte
 24954 00002D03 3D2020                  	cmp	ax,2020h
 24955                                  	;cmp	ax,DB_SPACE	; is it Kanji space

 24980                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 25054                                  SETREOUTSTR:			; Get the output redirection name
 25055                                  				; MSKK06 07/14/89

 25175 00002DF4 1F                      	pop	ds
 25176 00002DF5 E99E02                  	jmp	PIPEERRSYN
 25177                                  
 25178                                  ; Trailing :s are allowed on devices. Check to be sure that there is more
 25179                                  ; than just a : in the redir string.
 25180                                  
 25181                                  GOTRESTR:
 25182 00002DF8 86E0                    	xchg	ah,al
 25183 00002DFA B03A                    	mov	al,':' ; 3Ah
 25184 00002DFC 29FB                    	sub	bx,di		; compute negative of number of chars
 25185 00002DFE 83FBFF                  	cmp	bx,-1		; is there just a :?
 25186 00002E01 7407                    	je	short NOTRAILCOL ; yep, don't change
 25187 00002E03 263845FF                	cmp	[es:di-1],al	; Trailing ':' OK on devices
 25188 00002E07 7501                    	jne	short NOTRAILCOL
 25189 00002E09 4F                      	dec	di		; Back up over trailing ':'
 25190                                  NOTRAILCOL:

 25259                                  	; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25260                                  test_append:
 25261 00002E62 BB[A199]                	mov	bx,COMBUF	; barry can address
 25262 00002E65 BE[0A9C]                	mov	si,IDLEN	; address command name, DS already set 	
 25263 00002E68 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,-1
 25264 00002E6B B800AE                  	mov	ax,0AE00h
 25265 00002E6E CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; - Multiplex -	DOS 3.3+ internal 
 25266                                  			; - INSTALLABLE	COMMAND	- INSTALL CHECK
 25267                                  			; DX = FFFFh,[BX -> command line
 25268                                  			; Return: AL = FFh if this command is a TSR extension 
 25269                                  			;		   to COMMAND.COM
 25270                                  			; AL = 00h if the command should be executed as	usual
 25271                                  	;cmp	al,0
 25272 00002E70 08C0                    	or	al,al ; 25/02/2023
 25273 00002E72 C3                      	retn
 25274                                  
 25275                                  	; 25/02/2023
 25276                                  	; INT 2Fh
 25277                                  	; 	AX = AE00h
 25278                                  	; entry:
 25279                                  	; 	DX = magic value FFFFh
 25280                                  	; 	CH = FFh
 25281                                  	; 	CL = length of command line tail
 25282                                  	; 	DS:BX -> command line buffer  -- (offset COMBUF)
 25283                                  	; 	DS:SI -> command name buffer  -- (offset IDLEN)
 25284                                  	; return:
 25285                                  	;	AL = FFh if this command is a TSR extension to COMMAND.COM
 25286                                  	;	AL = 00h if the command should be executed as usual
 25287                                  	;
 25288                                  	; Format of COMMAND.COM command line buffer:
 25289                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 25290                                  	;	00h     BYTE    max length of command line, as in INT 21/AH=0Ah
 25291                                  	;	01h     BYTE    count of bytes to follow, excluding terminating 0Dh
 25292                                  	;	N BYTEs command line text, terminated by 0Dh
 25293                                  	;
 25294                                  	; Format of command name buffer:
 25295                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 25296                                  	;	00h     BYTE    length of command name
 25297                                  	;	01h    N BYTEs  uppercased command name (blank-padded to 11 chars)
 25298                                  
 25299                                  ;============================================================================
 25300                                  ; TMISC2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 25301                                  ;============================================================================
 25302                                  ; 05/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 25303                                  
 25304                                  ;	More misc routines
 25305                                  
 25306                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 1D9Bh
 25307                                  
 25308                                  ; 26/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25309                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2BEFh
 25310                                  
 25311                                  ; 11/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 25312                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 3199h
 25313                                  
 25314                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25315                                  
 25316                                  SETPATH:
 25317                                  
 25318                                  ; ENTRY PathPos = ptr to string
 25319                                  ;       PathCnt = length of string
 25320                                  ;
 25321                                  ; EXIT  PathPos = ptr to string after pathname
 25322                                  ;       PathCnt = length of rest of string
 25323                                  ;       DX = ptr to pathname in string, made ASCIIZ
 25324                                  ;       DestIsDir = 1 if pathname delimiters appeared in pathname, 0 otherwise
 25325                                  ;       DestInfo = 2 if wildcards (?, *) appeared in pathname, 0 otherwise
 25326                                  ;
 25327                                  ;       A null character is dropped at the end of the pathname. If the
 25328                                  ;       character in that spot previously was CR, it is copied into the
 25329                                  ;       following byte. So there must be at least two two character 
 25330                                  ;       positions in the buffer following the pathname.
 25331                                  
 25332                                  	; 26/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25333                                  	
 25334                                  	; 11/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 25335                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25336                                  	;mov	ax,[PathCnt]	;AC000; get length of string
 25337                                  	;mov	si,[PathPos]	;AC000; get start of source buffer
 25338                                  
 25339                                  	; 26/02/2023
 25340                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 25341                                  	;mov	si,80h
 25342                                  	;lodsb
 25343                                  	;xor	ah,ah
 25344                                  	;mov	[PATCNT],ax
 25345                                  	;mov	[PATHPOS],si
 25346                                  GETPATH:
 25347                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25348 00002E73 C606[0B9D]00            	mov	byte [DestInfo],0
 25349 00002E78 C606[079D]00            	mov	byte [DestIsDir],0
 25350 00002E7D 8B36[DF9C]              	mov	si,[PathPos]	; SI = ptr to string
 25351 00002E81 8B0E[DD9C]              	mov	cx,[PathCnt]	; CX = string length
 25352 00002E85 89F2                    	mov	dx,si		; DX = ptr to string
 25353 00002E87 E34D                    	jcxz	PATHDONE	; string length is zero, we're done
 25354 00002E89 51                      	push	cx		; save string length
 25355 00002E8A 56                      	push	si		; save ptr to string
 25356 00002E8B E875FC                  	call	SWITCH
 25357                                  
 25358                                  ;       After Switch, SI has been scanned past any switches, and
 25359                                  ;       switches that COMMAND intrinsically recognizes are recorded in AX.
 25360                                  
 25361 00002E8E A3[E19C]                	mov	[PathSw],ax	; PathSw = switch occurrence mask
 25362 00002E91 5B                      	pop	bx		; BX = ptr to original string
 25363 00002E92 29F3                    	sub	bx,si		; BX = -(# chars scanned by Switch)
 25364 00002E94 59                      	pop	cx		; CX = string length
 25365 00002E95 01D9                    	add	cx,bx		; CX = string length from current SI
 25366 00002E97 89F2                    	mov	dx,si		; DX = ptr to current string
 25367                                  SKIPPATH:
 25368                                  	; 26/02/2023
 25369                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25370 00002E99 C606[9D9E]00            	mov	byte [KPARSE],0
 25371                                  SKIPPATH2:
 25372 00002E9E E336                    	jcxz	PATHDONE	; string length is zero, we're done
 25373 00002EA0 49                      	dec	cx		; CX = length left after next char
 25374 00002EA1 AC                      	lodsb			; AL = next char of string
 25375                                  				; SI = ptr to char after this one
 25376                                  	; 26/02/2023
 25377 00002EA2 E883F8                  	call	testkanj
 25378 00002EA5 7408                    	jz	short TESTPPSEP
 25379 00002EA7 49                      	dec	cx
 25380 00002EA8 46                      	inc	si
 25381 00002EA9 FE06[9D9E]              	inc	byte [KPARSE]
 25382 00002EAD EBEF                    	jmp	short SKIPPATH2
 25383                                  TESTPPSEP:
 25384 00002EAF E823FB                  	call	pathchrcmp	; compare AL to path delimiter char
 25385 00002EB2 7504                    	jnz	short TESTPMETA	; it's not a path delim
 25386 00002EB4 FE06[079D]              	inc	byte [DestIsDir]
 25387                                  				; DestIsDir = 1, signalling path char
 25388                                  TESTPMETA:
 25389 00002EB8 3C3F                    	cmp	al,'?'
 25390 00002EBA 7505                    	jne	short TESTPSTAR	; char is not '?'
 25391 00002EBC 800E[0B9D]02            	or	byte [DestInfo],2 ; DestInfo = 2, signalling wildcard
 25392                                  TESTPSTAR:
 25393 00002EC1 3C2A                    	cmp	al,'*'
 25394                                  	;cmp	al,[STAR] ; MSDOS 3.3	
 25395 00002EC3 7505                    	jne	short TESTPDELIM ; char is not '*'
 25396 00002EC5 800E[0B9D]02            	or	byte [DestInfo],2 ; DestInfo = 2, signalling wildcard
 25397                                  TESTPDELIM:
 25398 00002ECA E882FA                  	call	DELIM		; compare AL to all delimiters
 25399 00002ECD 7406                    	jz	short PATHDONEDEC ; delimiter found, back up & leave
 25400 00002ECF 3A06[469B]              	cmp	al,[SWITCHAR]
 25401 00002ED3 75C4                    	jne	short SKIPPATH	; char isn't switch, go get next char
 25402                                  PATHDONEDEC:
 25403 00002ED5 4E                      	dec	si		; SI = ptr to char after pathname
 25404                                  PATHDONE:
 25405 00002ED6 30C0                    	xor	al,al		; AL = NULL
 25406 00002ED8 8604                    	xchg	al,[si]		; place NULL after pathname
 25407 00002EDA 46                      	inc	si		; SI = ptr to byte after NULL
 25408 00002EDB 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh		; were we at end of line?
 25409 00002EDD 7502                    	jne	short NOPSTORE	; not EOL, finish up
 25410 00002EDF 8804                    	mov	[si],al		; save EOL after NULL
 25411                                  NOPSTORE:
 25412 00002EE1 8936[DF9C]              	mov	[PathPos],si	; PathPos = ptr to char after NULL
 25413 00002EE5 890E[DD9C]              	mov	[PathCnt],cx	; PathCnt = length of string left
 25414                                  SETPATH_RETN:
 25415 00002EE9 C3                      	retn
 25416                                  
 25417                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25418                                  
 25419                                  PGETARG:

 25422 00002EEE 08C0                    	or	al,al

 25475                                  REOUTEXISTS:

 25478

 25480                                  
 25481                                  	; 26/02/2023
 25482                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25483                                  	;mov	ax,(OPEN SHL 8) OR 2 ;AC011; Open for read/write
 25484 00002F3B B8023D                  	mov	ax,3D02h
 25485                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 25486                                  	;mov	ax,(OPEN<<8)|1  ; 3D01h ; Open for write
 25487                                  	
 25488                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25489 00002F3E 50                      	push	ax
 25490 00002F3F CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - OPEN DISK FILE WITH HANDLE
 25491                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filename
 25492                                  			; AL = access mode
 25493                                  			; 1 - write
 25494 00002F41 5B                      	pop	bx
 25495 00002F42 724B                    	jc	short OpenWriteError
 25496                                  
 25497                                  	; 26/02/2023
 25498                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25499 00002F44 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 25500                                  	;mov	ax,IOCTL<<8		;AN035; Get attributes of handle
 25501 00002F46 B80044                  	mov	ax,4400h
 25502 00002F49 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN035;
 25503                                  			; DOS - 2+ - IOCTL - GET DEVICE INFORMATION
 25504                                  			; BX = file or device handle
 25505 00002F4B F6C280                  	test	dl,80h
 25506                                  	;test	dl,devid_ISDEV		;AN035; Is it a device?
 25507 00002F4E 7554                    	jnz	short SET_REOUT		;AN035; Yes, don't read from it
 25508

 25510 00002F50 B80242                  	mov	ax,4202h
 25511 00002F53 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,-1			;AC011; MOVE TO EOF -1
 25512 00002F56 89CA                    	mov	dx,cx			;AC011;
 25513 00002F58 CD21                    	int	21h
 25514                                  			; DOS - 2+ - MOVE FILE READ/WRITE POINTER (LSEEK)
 25515                                  			; AL = method: offset from end of file
 25516 00002F5A 0E                      	push	cs			;AN011; Get transient seg to DS
 25517 00002F5B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN011;
 25518                                  	
 25519                                  	;mov	ax,(READ SHL 8) 	;AN011; Read one byte from the

 25522 00002F62 BA[FF9C]                	mov	dx,One_Char_Val		;AN011;
 25523 00002F65 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN011;
 25524                                  			; DOS - 2+ - READ FROM FILE WITH HANDLE
 25525                                  			; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to read

 25528 00002F69 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			;AN017; Did we read 1 byte?
 25529 00002F6B 7517                    	jnz	short reout_0_length	;AN017; No - file must be 0 length
