 25716                                  TriageError:  ; MSDOS 6.0
 25717                                  
 25718                                  ; TriageError will examine the return from a carry-set system call and
 25719                                  ; return the correct error if applicable.
 25720                                  ;
 25721                                  ;   Inputs:	outputs from a carry-settable system call
 25722                                  ;		No system calls may be done in the interrim
 25723                                  ;   Outputs:	If carry was set on input
 25724                                  ;		   carry set on output
 25725                                  ;		   DX contains trangroup offset to printf message
 25726                                  ;		else
 25727                                  ;		   No registers changed

 25790                                  ; ****************************************************************
 25791                                  ; *
 25792                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 MOVE_TO_SRCBUF
 25793                                  ; *
 25794                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Move ASCIIZ string from DS:SI to SRCBUF.  Change
 25795                                  ; *		 terminating 0 to 0dH.	Set PATHCNT to length of
 25796                                  ; *		 string.  Set PATHPOS to start of SRCBUF.
 25797                                  ; *
 25798                                  ; * INPUT:	 DS:SI points to ASCIIZ string
 25799                                  ; *		 ES    points to TRANGROUP
 25800                                  ; *
 25801                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 SRCBUF filled in with string terminated by 0dH
 25802                                  ; *		 PATHCNT set to length of string
 25803                                  ; *		 PATHPOS set to start of SRCBUF
 25804                                  ; *		 CX,AX	 changed
 25805                                  ; *
 25806                                  ; ****************************************************************
 25807                                  
 25808                                  	; 26/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25809                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2CABh
 25810                                  Move_To_SrcBuf:
 25811 0000302E 56                      	push	si			;AN000;  save si,di
 25812 0000302F 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25813 00003030 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25814 00003031 BF[6F9D]                	mov	di,SrcBuf		;AN000;  set ES:DI to srcbuf
 25815 00003034 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; clear cx for counint
 25816 00003036 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; clear ax
 25817 00003038 57                      	push	di			;AN000; save start of srcbuf
 25818 00003039 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; get a character from DS:SI
 25819                                  mts_get_chars:				;AN000;
 25820                                  	;cmp	al,0			;AN000; was it a null char?
 25821 0000303A 20C0                    	and 	al,al ; al = 0 ?
 25822 0000303C 7405                    	jz	short mts_end_string	;AN000; yes - exit
 25823 0000303E AA                      	stosb				;AN000; no - store it in srcbuf
 25824 0000303F 41                      	inc	cx			;AN000; increment length count
 25825 00003040 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; get a character from DS:SI
 25826 00003041 EBF7                    	jmp	short mts_get_chars	;AN000; go check it
 25827                                  mts_end_string: 			;AN000; we've reached the end of line
 25828                                  	;mov	al,END_OF_LINE_IN	;AN000; store 0Dh in srcbuf
 25829 00003043 B00D                    	mov	al,0Dh
 25830 00003045 AA                      	stosb				;AN000;
 25831 00003046 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000; restore start of srcbuf
 25832 00003047 0E                      	push	cs			;AN000; set DS to local segment
 25833 00003048 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25834 00003049 890E[DD9C]              	mov	[PathCnt],cx		;AN000; set patchcnt to length count
 25835 0000304D 893E[DF9C]              	mov	[PathPos],di		;AN000; set pathpos to start of srcbuf
 25836 00003051 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000; restore cx,di,si
 25837 00003052 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25838 00003053 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25839 00003054 C3                      	retn				;AN000; exit

 26709                                  ;Skip_white: Skips over the whitespace chars that could be present after
 26710                                  ;the '=' sign in the environment variable before the actual path.
 26711                                  ;
 26712                                  ;	ENTRY:	ds:si = arguments of the environment variable
 26713                                  ;
 26714                                  ;	EXIT:	ds:si = start of the path
 26715                                  ;
 26716                                  ;	REGISTERS AFFECTED: ax
 26717                                  
 26718                                  	; 28/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26719                                  skip_white:
 26720 0000338B FC                      	cld
 26721                                  skw_lp:
 26722 0000338C AC                      	lodsb
 26723 0000338D 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '			;blank char?
 26724 0000338F 74FB                    	jz	short skw_lp		;yes, skip it
 26725 00003391 3C09                    	cmp	al,9			;tab char?
 26726 00003393 74F7                    	jz	short skw_lp		;yes, skip it
 26727 00003395 4E                      	dec	si			;point at first non-white
 26728 00003396 C3                      	retn

 26733                                  
 26734                                  ;Copy_pipe_path: This routine copies the path from the TEMP environment
 26735                                  ;variable into the path buffers Pipe1 & Pipe2.
 26736                                  ;
 26737                                  ;	ENTRY:	ds:si = path to be copied
 26738                                  ;		es = RESGROUP
 26739                                  ;
 26740                                  ;	EXIT:	Path copied into Pipe1 and Pipe2.
 26741                                  ;
 26742                                  ;	REGISTERS AFFECTED: si, di, cx, ax
 26743                                  
 26744                                  	; 28/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26745                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3174h
 26746                                  
 26747                                  	; 11/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 26748                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:371Eh
 26749                                  copy_pipe_path:
 26750 00003397 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh ; 65535
 26751 0000339A 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 26752

 26754 0000339E 06                      	push	es			;save es
 26755 0000339F 1E                      	push	ds
 26756 000033A0 07                      	pop	es			;es:di = path to be copied
 26757                                  	
 26758 000033A1 FC                      	cld
 26759 000033A2 57                      	push	di
 26760 000033A3 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			;look for the null char
 26761 000033A5 5F                      	pop	di
 26762                                  
 26763 000033A6 07                      	pop	es			;es = RESGROUP again
 26764                                  
 26765 000033A7 F7D1                    	not	cx			;length including the null
 26766                                  
 26767                                  	;;;mov	di,320h ; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM ; (RESGROUP:EndInit)
 26768                                  	;;mov	di,3EAh ; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM ; 11/06/2023
 26769                                  	;mov	di,offset DATARES:Pipe1
 26770 000033A9 BF[1503]                	mov	di,Pipe1  ; (offset RESGROUP:EndInit)
 26771 000033AC 57                      	push	di
 26772 000033AD 51                      	push	cx			
 26773 000033AE F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;copy path into Pipe1
 26774 000033B0 59                      	pop	cx
 26775 000033B1 5F                      	pop	di
 26776

 26780 000033B5 89FE                    	mov	si,di

 26782                                  	;;mov	di,439h ; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM ; 11/06/2023
 26783                                  	;mov	di,offset DATARES:Pipe2	;es:di = Pipe2
 26784 000033B7 BF[6403]                	mov	di,Pipe2  ; (offset RESGROUP:EndInit+79)
 26785 000033BA F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;copy path into Pipe2
 26786 000033BC 1F                      	pop	ds

 26788                                  
 26789                                  ;============================================================================
 26790                                  ; PARSE2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 26791                                  ;============================================================================
 26792                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 26793                                  
 26794                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26795                                  ; PARSELINE takes an MSDOS command line and maps it into a UNIX-style
 26796                                  ; argv[argvcnt] array. The most important difference between this array and
 26797                                  ; the tradition UNIX format is the extra cparse information included with
 26798                                  ; each argument element.
 26799                                  ;---------------
 26800                                  ; ENTRY:
 26801                                  ;	BL	     special delimiter for cparse -- not implemented)
 26802                                  ;---------------
 26803                                  ; EXIT:
 26804                                  ;	CF	    set if error
 26805                                  ;	AL	    error code (carry set). Note AH clobbered in any event.
 26806                                  ;	argv[]	    array of cparse flags and pointers to arguments
 26807                                  ;	argvcnt     argument count
 26808                                  ;---------------
 26809                                  ; NOTE(S):
 26810                                  ;	*   BL (special delimiter) is ignored, for now (set to space).
 26811                                  ;	*   Parseflags record contains cparse flags, as follows:
 26812                                  ;		sw_flag 	--	was this arg a switch?
 26813                                  ;		wildcard	--	whether or not it contained a * or ?
 26814                                  ;		path_sep	--	maybe it was a pathname
 26815                                  ;		unused		--	for future expansion
 26816                                  ;		special_delim	--	was there an initial special delimiter?
 26817                                  ;	*   argv[] and argvcnt are undefined if CF/AL indicates an error.
 26818                                  ;	*   Relationship between input, cparse output, and comtail can be
 26819                                  ;	    found in the following chart. Despite the claim of the cparse
 26820                                  ;	    documentation that, "Token buffer always starts d: for non switch
 26821                                  ;	    tokens", such is not the case (see column two, row two).
 26822                                  ;	    Similarly, [STARTEL] is not null when the command line is one of
 26823                                  ;	    the forms, "d:", "d:\", or "d:/". In fact, *STARTEL (i.e., what
 26824                                  ;	    STARTEL addresses) will be null. This is clearly just a
 26825                                  ;	    documentation error.
 26826                                  ;	*   cparse also returns a switch code in BP for each switch it
 26827                                  ;	    recognizes on the command line.
 26828                                  ;	*   arglen for each token does NOT include the terminating null.
 26829                                  ;	*   Finally, note that interesting constructions like 'foodir/*.exe'
 26830                                  ;	    parse as three separate tokens, and the asterisk is NOT a wildcard.
 26831                                  ;	    For example, 'for %i in (foodir/*.exe) do echo %i' will first
 26832                                  ;	    echo 'foodir', then '*', then '.exe'. Using cparse for command-
 26833                                  ;	    line parsing may result in slightly different behavior than
 26834                                  ;	    previously observed with the old COMMAND.COM command-line parser.
 26835                                  ;
 26836                                  ;	    Input		    Cparse		Command Line (80H)
 26837                                  ;	\alan\foo.bat		c:\alan\foo.bat 	\alan\foo.bat
 26838                                  ;	alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat
 26839                                  ;	foo.bat 		foo.bat 		foo.bat
 26840                                  ;	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat
 26841                                  ;	c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat
 26842                                  ;	c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat
 26843                                  
 26844                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 26845                                  
 26846                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 23D0h
 26847                                  
 26848                                  ; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26849                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 319Bh
 26850                                  
 26851                                  ; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 26852                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 3745h
 26853                                  
 26854                                  ; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v4.0-v4.1-v4.2-v5.0 COMMAND.COM (PARSELINE)
 26855                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 35F5h
 26856                                  
 26857                                  PARSELINE:
 26858 000033BE 50                      	push	ax			; most of these are clobbered
 26859 000033BF 53                      	push	bx			; by cparse...
 26860 000033C0 51                      	push	cx
 26861 000033C1 52                      	push	dx
 26862 000033C2 57                      	push	di
 26863 000033C3 56                      	push	si
 26864 000033C4 9C                      	pushf
 26865                                  	;mov	byte [cpyflag],0  ; Turn "CPARSE called from COPY flag" off
 26866 000033C5 C706[64A3]FFFF          	mov	word [LASTARG],-1 ; last argument at which to accumulate
 26867 000033CB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 26868                                  	;;mov	cx,1348
 26869                                  	; 27/07/2024
 26870                                  	;mov	cx,1092  ; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 26871 000033CD B94404                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE ; 1092
 26872 000033D0 A2[F49C]                	mov	[cpyflag],al ; 0 ; 27/07/2024
 26873 000033D3 BF[9E9E]                	mov	di,ARG
 26874 000033D6 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 26875                                  	;mov	word [ARGBUF_PTR],ARG_ARGBUF

 26958                                  ; NEWARG adds the supplied argstring and cparse data to arg.argv[].
 26959                                  ;
 26960                                  ; ENTRY:
 26961                                  ;   BH			argflags
 26962                                  ;   CX			character count in argstring
 26963                                  ;   DI			pointer to argstring
 26964                                  ;   comptr		ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 26965                                  ;   [STARTEL]		cparse's answer to where the last element starts
 26966                                  ; EXIT:
 26967                                  ;   argbufptr		points to next free section of argbuffer
 26968                                  ;   arg.argbuf		contains null-terminated argument strings
 26969                                  ;   arg.argvcnt 	argument count
 26970                                  ;   arg.argv[]		array of flags and pointers
 26971                                  ;   arg.arg_ocomptr	ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 26972                                  ;   CF			set if error
 26973                                  ;   AL			carry set:  error code; otherwise, zero
 26974                                  
 26975                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26976                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM

 27019                                  	;mov	[BX].arg_ocomptr,si ; arg_ocomptr = ptr into original com line
 27020                                  	;mov	[bx+9],si

 27023 0000347C 8B3E[E2A2]              	mov	di,[ARGBUF_PTR]		; load the argbuf pointer and make
 27024                                  
 27025                                  ; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 27026                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 27027                                  %if 0

 27089                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27090                                  
 27091                                  ; ARG_SWITCH decides if an argument might really be a switch. In the
 27092                                  ; event that it is, and we can recognize
 27093                                  ;
 27094                                  ; ENTRY:
 27095                                  ;   As in <newarg>.
 27096                                  ; EXIT:
 27097                                  ;   CF	    --	    clear (wasn't a switch); set (was a switch)
 27098                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27099                                  ;   *	The mechanism mapping a switch into a bit-value depends entirely
 27100                                  ;	on the order of definition in the <switch_list> variable and the
 27101                                  ;	values chosen to define the bits in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM. Change either
 27102                                  ;	<switch_list> or the definitions in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM -- and rewrite
 27103                                  ;	this mechanism. This code taken from CMDT:TCODE.ASM.
 27104                                  ;   *	The <switch_list> declared below is redundant to one declared in
 27105                                  ;	TDATA.ASM, and used in TCODE.ASM.
 27106                                  ;   *	An ugly routine.
 27107                                  
 27108                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 27109                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27110                                  arg_switch:
 27111 000034A4 50                      	push	ax
 27112 000034A5 53                      	push	bx
 27113 000034A6 51                      	push	cx
 27114 000034A7 57                      	push	di
 27115 000034A8 9C                      	pushf
 27116 000034A9 F6C701                  	test	bh,1 ; sw_flag		; is it a switch? (preserve flag word)
 27117 000034AC 741C                    	jz	short arg_no_switch0
 27118 000034AE 833E[64A3]FF            	cmp	word [LASTARG],-1 	; have we encountered any REAL args yet?
 27119 000034B3 741B                    	je	short arg_no_switch1 	; no, so leading switches don't matter
 27120 000034B5 8B1E[64A3]              	mov	bx,[LASTARG]		; yes, add switch info to last REAL arg
 27121                                  	;mov	ax,offset TRANGROUP:arg.argv
 27122                                  	;mov	ax,ARG_ARGV
 27123 000034B9 B8[9E9E]                	mov	ax,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv  ; ARG+0
 27124 000034BC E81800                  	call	argv_calc
 27125                                  	;or	[BX].argsw_word,BP
 27126                                  	;or	[bx+7],bp
 27127 000034BF 096F07                  	or	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argsw_word],bp
 27128                                  	;or	arg.argswinfo,BP
 27129                                  	;or	[ARG_ARGSWINFO],bp
 27130 000034C2 092E[60A1]              	or	[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],bp
 27131                                  arg_yes_switch:
 27132 000034C6 9D                      	popf
 27133 000034C7 F9                      	stc
 27134 000034C8 EB08                    	jmp	short arg_switch_exit
 27135                                  
 27136                                  arg_no_switch0:
 27137                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 27138 000034CA A1[5EA1]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 27139 000034CD A3[64A3]                	mov	[LASTARG],ax
 27140                                  arg_no_switch1:
 27141 000034D0 9D                      	popf
 27142 000034D1 F8                      	clc
 27143                                  arg_switch_exit:
 27144 000034D2 5F                      	pop	di
 27145 000034D3 59                      	pop	cx
 27146 000034D4 5B                      	pop	bx
 27147 000034D5 58                      	pop	ax
 27148 000034D6 C3                      	retn
 27149                                  
 27150                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27151                                  
 27152                                  ; ARGV_CALC maps an array index into a byte-offset from the base of
 27153                                  ; the supplied array.  Method used for computing the address is:
 27154                                  ;	Array Index * Array Elt Size + Base Addr = Elt Addr
 27155                                  ; ENTRY:
 27156                                  ;   AX	    --	    base of array
 27157                                  ;   BX	    --	    array index
 27158                                  ; EXIT:
 27159                                  ;   BX	    --	    byte offset
 27160                                  
 27161                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 27162                                  argv_calc:
 27163 000034D7 50                      	push	ax		; Save base
 27164 000034D8 88D8                    	mov	al,bl		; al = array index
 27165                                  	;mov	bl,11
 27166 000034DA B30B                    	mov	bl,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; bl = size of an argv element
 27167 000034DC F6E3                    	mul	bl		; ax = base offset
 27168 000034DE 5B                      	pop	bx		; Get base
 27169 000034DF 01D8                    	add	ax,bx		; Add in base offset
 27170 000034E1 93                      	xchg	ax,bx		; Restore ax and put byte offset in bx
 27171 000034E2 C3                      	retn
 27172

 27174                                  	
 27175                                  	;db 0Ah dup(0)
 27176                                  	;times 10 db 0
 27177                                  
 27178 000034E3 90<rep Dh>              align 16

 27180                                  ;============================================================================
 27181                                  ; PATH1.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27182                                  ;============================================================================
 27183                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27184                                  
 27185                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27186                                  ;    PATH.ASM contains the routines to perform pathname incovation. Path and
 27187                                  ;    Parse share a temporary buffer and argv[] definitions. <Path_Search>,
 27188                                  ;    given a pathname, attempts to find a corresponding executable or batch
 27189                                  ;    file on disk. Directories specified in the user's search path will be
 27190                                  ;    searched for a matching file, if a match is not found in the current
 27191                                  ;    directory and if the pathname is actually only an MSDOS filename.
 27192                                  ;    <Path_Search> assumes that the parsed command name can be found in
 27193                                  ;    argv[0] -- in other words, <Parseline> should be executed prior to
 27194                                  ;    <Path_Search>. Alternatively, the command name and appropriate
 27195                                  ;    information could be placed in argv[0], or <Path_Search> could be
 27196                                  ;    (easily) modified to make no assumptions about where its input is found.
 27197                                  ;    Please find enclosed yet another important routine, <Save_Args>, which
 27198                                  ;    places the entire arg/argv[]/argbuf structure on a piece of newly
 27199                                  ;    allocated memory. This is handy for for-loop processing, and anything
 27200                                  ;    else that wants to save the whole shebang and then process other command
 27201                                  ;    lines.
 27202                                  ;
 27203                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    August 15, 1983
 27204                                  ;
 27205                                  ; ENTRY:
 27206                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    argv[0].
 27207                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    bytes to allocate in addition to arg structure
 27208                                  ; EXIT:
 27209                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    success flag, best pathname match in EXECPATH.
 27210                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    success flag, segment address of new memory
 27211                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27212                                  ;   *	<Argv_calc> handily turns an array index into an absolute pointer.
 27213                                  ;	The computation depends on the size of an argv[] element (arg_ele).
 27214                                  ;   *	<Parseline> calls <cparse> for chunks of the command line. <Cparse>
 27215                                  ;	does not function as specified; see <Parseline> for more details.
 27216                                  ;   *	<Parseline> now knows about the flags the internals of COMMAND.COM
 27217                                  ;	need to know about. This extra information is stored in a switch_flag
 27218                                  ;	word with each command-line argument; the switches themselves will not
 27219                                  ;	appear in the resulting arg structure.
 27220                                  ;   *	With the exception of CARRY, flags are generally preserved across calls.
 27221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27222                                  
 27223                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27224                                  
 27225                                  ; PATH_SEARCH tries to find the file it's given, somewhere. An initial value
 27226                                  ; of *argv[0].argstartel == 0 implies that there is no command (empty line
 27227                                  ; or 'd:' or 'd:/'). This check is done in strip; otherwise, strip formats
 27228                                  ; the filename/pathname into tpbuf. Search(tpbuf) is executed to see if we
 27229                                  ; have a match, either in the current working directory if we were handed
 27230                                  ; a filename, or in the specified directory, given a pathname. If this call
 27231                                  ; fails, and we were given a pathname, then Path_Search fails. Otherwise,
 27232                                  ; Path_Crunch is repeatedly invoked on tpbuf[STARTEL] (if there's a drive
 27233                                  ; prefix, we want to skip it) for each pathstring in userpath. Success on
 27234                                  ; either the first invocation of search or on one of the succeeding calls
 27235                                  ; sets up the appropriate information for copying the successful pathname
 27236                                  ; prefix (if any) into the result buffer, followed by the successful filename
 27237                                  ; match (from [search_best_buf]). The result is returned in in EXECPATH.
 27238                                  ;
 27239                                  ; ENTRY:
 27240                                  ;   argv[0]		--	command name and associated information
 27241                                  ; EXIT:
 27242                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero indicates type of file found
 27243                                  ;   EXECPATH		--	successful pathname (AX non-zero)
 27244                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27245                                  ;   1)	Uses the temporary buffer, tpbuf, from the parse routines.
 27246                                  ;   2)	Some files are more equal than others.	See search: for rankings.
 27247                                  ;   3)	Path_Search terminates as soon as a call to search succeeds, even
 27248                                  ;	if search returns an .exe or .bat.
 27249                                  ;   5)	Clobbers dma address.
 27250                                  
 27251                                  PBUFLEN 	EQU	128		; length of EXECPATH
 27252                                  PATH_SEP_CHAR	EQU	';'
 27253                                  
 27254                                  ;parseflags RECORD special_delim:1, unused:4, path_sep:1, wildcard:1, sw_flag:1
 27255                                  
 27256                                  	;special_delim equ 128
 27257                                  	;path_sep equ 4
 27258                                  	;wildcard equ 2
 27259                                  	;sw_flag  equ 1
 27260                                  
 27261                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27262                                  
 27263                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2510h
 27264                                  
 27265                                  ; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27266                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 32D1h
 27267                                  
 27268                                  ; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27269                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 387Bh
 27270                                  
 27271                                  path_search:
 27272 000034F0 53                      	push	bx
 27273 000034F1 51                      	push	cx
 27274 000034F2 52                      	push	dx		; could use a "stack 'em" instruction
 27275 000034F3 56                      	push	si
 27276 000034F4 57                      	push	di
 27277 000034F5 55                      	push	bp
 27278 000034F6 9C                      	pushf
 27279                                  
 27280                                  	;test	ds:arg.argv[0].argflags, (MASK wildcard) + (MASK sw_flag)
 27281                                  	;test	byte [ARGV0_ARG_FLAGS],3
 27282 000034F7 F606[A09E]03            	test	byte [ARG+ARGV_ELE.argflags],3 ; wildcard+sw_flag
 27283 000034FC 7403                    	jz	short path_search_ok
 27284                                  path_failure_jmp:
 27285 000034FE E9C100                  	jmp	path_failure	; ambiguous commands not allowed
 27286                                  
 27287                                  path_search_ok:
 27288 00003501 E85201                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out the pathname separator
 27289 00003504 BA[68A3]                	mov	dx,FBUF		; clobber old dma value with
 27290 00003507 B8001A                  	mov	ax,Set_DMA*256 ; 1A00h ; a pointer to our dma buffer
 27291 0000350A CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	SET DISK TRANSFER AREA ADDRESS
 27292                                  			; DS:DX	-> disk	transfer buffer
 27293 0000350C 06                      	push	es
 27294 0000350D E866F1                  	call	find_path	; get a handle (ES:DI) on user path
 27295 00003510 8C06[93A3]              	mov	[pathinfo+0],es	; and squirrel it away
 27296 00003514 893E[95A3]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],di	; "old" pathstring pointer
 27297 00003518 893E[97A3]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],di	; "new" pathstring pointer
 27298 0000351C 07                      	pop	es
 27299                                  	
 27300 0000351D BB8000                  	mov	bx,PBUFLEN ; 128 ; copy/format argv[0] into temp buffer
 27301 00003520 BE[6A9A]                	mov	si,EXECPATH
 27302 00003523 E88002                  	call	STRIP

 27320                                  
 27321                                  ; We have the number of bytes in the prefix (up to the final component).
 27322                                  ; We need to form the complete pathname including leading drive and current
 27323                                  ; directory.

 27354                                  ; Otherwise, get current dir for DL.

 27373                                  ;

 27489                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area

 27554                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27555                                  
 27556                                  ; STORE_PCHAR determines the pathname-element separator and squirrels
 27557                                  ; it away. In other words, must we say '/bin/ls' or '\bin\ls'?
 27558                                  ;
 27559                                  ; ENTRY:
 27560                                  ; EXIT:
 27561                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27562                                  ;   *	Uses <psep_char>, defined in <path_search>.
 27563                                  
 27564                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27565                                  STORE_PCHAR:
 27566 00003656 50                      	push	ax
 27567 00003657 B02F                    	mov	al,'/'		; is the pathname-element separator
 27568 00003659 E879F3                  	call	pathchrcmp	; a regular slash?
 27569 0000365C 7402                    	jz	short STORE_SLASH
 27570                                  				; if yes, remember slash
 27571 0000365E B05C                    	mov	al,'\'
 27572                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27573                                  	;mov	[psep_char],al	; otherwise, remember back-slash
 27574                                  	;pop	ax
 27575                                  	;retn
 27576                                  STORE_SLASH:
 27577 00003660 A2[99A3]                	mov	[psep_char],al
 27578 00003663 58                      	pop	ax
 27579 00003664 C3                      	retn

 27581                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27582                                  
 27583                                  ; PATH_CRUNCH takes a prefix from a prefix string, and a suffix from
 27584                                  ; EXECPATH, and smooshes them into tpbuf. The caller may supply an
 27585                                  ; additional separator to use for breaking up the path-string. Null is the
 27586                                  ; default. Once the user-string has been formed, search is invoked to see
 27587                                  ; what's out there.
 27588                                  ;
 27589                                  ; ENTRY:
 27590                                  ;   BH			--	additional terminator character
 27591                                  ;   SI			--	pointer into pathstring to be dissected
 27592                                  ;   DX			--	pointer to stripped filename
 27593                                  ; EXIT:
 27594                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero (file type), zero (nothing found)
 27595                                  ;   SI			--	moves along pathstring from call to call
 27596                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	--	name of best file (AX non-zero)
 27597                                  ;   [tpbuf]		--	clobbered
 27598                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27599                                  ;   *	Implicit in this code is the ability to specify when to search
 27600                                  ;	the current directory (if at all) through the PATH defined by
 27601                                  ;	the user, a la UNIX (e.g., PATH=;c:\bin;c:\etc searches the
 27602                                  ;	current directory before the bin and etc directories of drive c).
 27603                                  
 27604                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27605                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3454h
 27606                                  
 27607                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27608                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:39FEh
 27609                                  	
 27610                                  path_crunch:
 27611 00003665 53                      	push	bx
 27612 00003666 51                      	push	cx
 27613 00003667 52                      	push	dx
 27614 00003668 57                      	push	di
 27615 00003669 56                      	push	si
 27616                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 27617 0000366A E8E9FF                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out pathname separator
 27618 0000366D BF[E4A2]                	mov	di,TPBUF	; destination of concatenated string
 27619 00003670 8B36[97A3]              	mov	si,[pathinfo+4]	; "new" pointer to start with
 27620 00003674 8936[95A3]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],si	; becomes "old" pointer
 27621 00003678 1E                      	push	ds		; save old segment pointer
 27622 00003679 FF36[93A3]              	push	word [pathinfo+0]
 27623                                  				; replace with pointer to userpath's
 27624 0000367D 1F                      	pop	ds		; segment
 27625                                  	; 26/04/2023
 27626 0000367E 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl		;AN000; clear flag for later use 3/3/KK	
 27627                                  path_cr_copy:
 27628 00003680 AC                      	lodsb			; get a pathname byte
 27629 00003681 08C0                    	or	al,al		; check for terminator(s)
 27630 00003683 7414                    	jz	short path_seg	; null terminates segment & pathstring
 27631 00003685 38F8                    	cmp	al,bh
 27632 00003687 7410                    	je	short path_seg	; BH terminates a pathstring segment
 27633                                  	;
 27634                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27635                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& 5.0) COMMAND.COM
 27636 00003689 E89CF0                  	call	testkanj	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 27637 0000368C 7406                    	jz	short _notkanj2	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 27638 0000368E AA                      	stosb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 27639 0000368F A4                      	movsb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 27640 00003690 B101                    	mov	cl,1 ; *	;AN000; CL=1 means latest stored char is DBCS 3/3/KK	
 27641 00003692 EBEC                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 27642                                  _notkanj2:
 27643 00003694 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; CL=0 means latest stored char is SBCS 3/3/KK
 27644                                  	;
 27645 00003696 AA                      	stosb
 27646 00003697 EBE7                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 27647                                  
 27648                                  path_seg:
 27649 00003699 1F                      	pop	ds		; restore old data segment
 27650 0000369A 8936[97A3]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],si	; save "new" pointer for next time
 27651 0000369E 88C3                    	mov	bl,al		; remember if we saw null or not...
 27652                                  				;;; REMOVE NEXT 3 LINES FOR CURDIR SPEC
 27653 000036A0 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; in case nothing in pathstr...
 27654 000036A2 81FF[E4A2]              	cmp	di,TPBUF	; was there really anything in pathstr?		
 27655 000036A6 7421                    	je	short path_cr_leave
 27656                                  				; if nothing was copied, pathstr empty
 27657                                  path_cr_look:
 27658 000036A8 A0[99A3]                	mov	al,[psep_char]	; form complete pathname
 27659                                  	;
 27660                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27661                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27662 000036AB 08C9                    	or	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 27663 000036AD 7505                    	jnz	short path_cr_store
 27664                                  				;AN000; this is a trailing byte of ECS code 3/3/KK
 27665                                  	;
 27666 000036AF 3A45FF                  	cmp	al,[di-1]	; add pathname separator for suffix
 27667 000036B2 7401                    	je	short path_cr_l1
 27668                                  path_cr_store:
 27669 000036B4 AA                      	stosb
 27670                                  path_cr_l1:
 27671 000036B5 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 27672                                  path_cr_l2:
 27673 000036B7 AC                      	lodsb			; tack the stripped filename onto
 27674 000036B8 AA                      	stosb			; the end of the path, up to and
 27675 000036B9 08C0                    	or	al,al		; including the terminating null
 27676 000036BB 75FA                    	jnz	short path_cr_l2
 27677 000036BD BA[E4A2]                	mov	dx,TPBUF	; and look for an appropriate file...	
 27678 000036C0 C706[E8A3][3190]        	mov	word [search_error],BADPMES_PTR
 27679                                  	;invoke search
 27680 000036C6 E80900                  	call	PSEARCH		; results are in AX & search_best_buf
 27681                                  
 27682                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27683                                  ;path_cr_leave:
 27684                                  	;or	bl,bl		; did we finish off the pathstring?
 27685                                  	;jz	short path_cr_empty
 27686                                  	;			; null in BL means all gone...
 27687                                  	;popf	; **		; otherwise, plenty left
 27688                                  	;clc
 27689                                  	;jmp	short path_cr_exit
 27690                                  ;path_cr_empty:
 27691                                  	;popf	; **
 27692                                  	;stc
 27693                                  ;path_cr_exit:
 27694                                  
 27695                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27696                                  path_cr_leave:
 27697                                  	;popf ; ** ; 18/03/2023
 27698 000036C9 80FB01                  	cmp	bl,1	; if bl = 0 -> cf = 1 (path_cr_empty:)
 27699                                  	
 27700                                  path_cr_exit:
 27701 000036CC 5E                      	pop	si
 27702 000036CD 5F                      	pop	di
 27703 000036CE 5A                      	pop	dx
 27704 000036CF 59                      	pop	cx
 27705 000036D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 27706 000036D1 C3                      	retn
 27707                                  
 27708                                  ;============================================================================
 27709                                  ; PATH2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27710                                  ;============================================================================
 27711                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27712                                  
 27713                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27714                                  ;   SEARCH, when given a pathname, attempts to find a file with
 27715                                  ; one of the following extensions: .com, .exe, .bat (highest to
 27716                                  ; lowest priority). Where conflicts arise, the extension with
 27717                                  ; the highest priority is favored.
 27718                                  ; ENTRY:
 27719                                  ;   DX		--	pointer to null-terminated pathname
 27720                                  ;   fbuf	--	dma buffer for findfirst/next
 27721                                  ; EXIT:
 27722                                  ;   AX		--	8)  file found with .com extension
 27723                                  ;			4)  file found with .exe extension
 27724                                  ;			2)  file found with .bat extension
 27725                                  ;			0)  no such file to be found
 27726                                  ;   (if AX is non-zero:)
 27727                                  ;   [search_best]	identical to AX
 27728                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	null-terminated filename
 27729                                  ; NOTES:
 27730                                  ;   1) Requires caller to have allocated a dma buffer and executed a setdma.
 27731                                  ;---------------
 27732                                  ; CONSTANTS:
 27733                                  ;---------------
 27734                                  SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND	EQU	0
 27735                                  SEARCH_COM		EQU	8
 27736                                  SEARCH_EXE		EQU	4
 27737                                  SEARCH_BAT		EQU	2
 27738                                  FNAME_LEN		EQU	8
 27739                                  FNAME_MAX_LEN		EQU	13
 27740                                  DOT			EQU	'.'
 27741                                  WILDCHAR		EQU	'?'
 27742                                  
 27743                                  
 27744                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27745                                  
 27746                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 26D6h
 27747                                  
 27748                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27749                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:34C9h
 27750                                  
 27751                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27752                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3A73h
 27753                                  PSEARCH:
 27754 000036D2 51                      	push	cx
 27755 000036D3 52                      	push	dx
 27756 000036D4 57                      	push	di
 27757 000036D5 56                      	push	si
 27758                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 27759 000036D6 52                      	push	dx		; check drivespec (save pname ptr)
 27760 000036D7 89D7                    	mov	di,dx		; working copy of pathname
 27761 000036D9 BE[A8A3]                	mov	si,search_curdir_buf
 27762 000036DC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; zero means current drive
 27763 000036DE 807D013A                	cmp	byte [di+1],':'	; is there a drive spec?
 27764 000036E2 7508                    	jne	short SEARCH_DIR_CHECK
 27765 000036E4 8A15                    	mov	dl,[di]		; get the drive byte
 27766 000036E6 80E2DF                  	and	dl,0DFh ; ~20h	; uppercase the sucker
 27767 000036E9 80EA40                  	sub	dl,'@' ; 40h	; and convert to drive number
 27768                                  SEARCH_DIR_CHECK:
 27769 000036EC B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 27770 000036EF CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 27771                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 27772                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 27773 000036F1 5A                      	pop	dx		; directory? If we can't we'll		
 27774 000036F2 724C                    	jc	short SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE
 27775                                  				; assume it's a bad drive...
 27776 000036F4 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr	; 13h
 27777                                  				; filetypes to search for
 27778 000036F7 B8004E                  	mov	ax,Find_First*256 ; 4E00h ; request first match, if any
 27779 000036FA CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND FIRST	ASCIZ (FINDFIRST)
 27780                                  			; CX = search attributes
 27781                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filespec
 27782                                  			; (drive,path, and wildcards allowed)
 27783 000036FC 7249                    	jc	short SEARCH_NO_FILE
 27784 000036FE C606[9AA3]00            	mov	byte [search_best],SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 27785 00003703 C606[9BA3]00            	mov	byte [search_best_buf],ANULL
 27786                                  				; 0 ; nothing's been found, yet
 27787                                  SEARCH_LOOP:
 27788 00003708 E84300                  	call	SEARCH_FTYPE	; determine if .com, &c...
 27789 0000370B 3A06[9AA3]              	cmp	al,[search_best]
 27790                                  				; better than what we've found so far?
 27791 0000370F 7E13                    	jle	short SEARCH_NEXT
 27792                                  				; no, look for another	
 27793 00003711 A2[9AA3]                	mov	[search_best],al
 27794                                  				; found something... save its code	
 27795                                  	;mov	si,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 27796                                  	;mov	si,FBUF_PNAME
 27797 00003714 BE[86A3]                	mov	si,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+30
 27798 00003717 BF[9BA3]                	mov	di,search_best_buf
 27799 0000371A B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 27800 0000371D FC                      	cld
 27801 0000371E F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; save complete pathname representation
 27802 00003720 3C08                    	cmp	al,SEARCH_COM	; 8
 27803                                  				; have we found the best of all?	
 27804 00003722 740A                    	je	short SEARCH_DONE
 27805                                  SEARCH_NEXT:			; keep on looking
 27806 00003724 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr ; 13h
 27807 00003727 B8004F                  	mov	ax,Find_Next*256 ; 4F00h ; next match
 27808 0000372A CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND NEXT ASCIZ (FINDNEXT)
 27809                                  			; [DTA]	= data block from
 27810                                  			; last AH = 4Eh/4Fh call
 27811 0000372C 73DA                    	jnc	short SEARCH_LOOP
 27812                                  SEARCH_DONE:			; it's all over with...
 27813 0000372E A0[9AA3]                	mov	al,[search_best]
 27814                                  				; pick best to return with
 27815                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27816                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27817 00003731 803E[549E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 27818                                  				;AN005; Did user request a specific ext?
 27819 00003736 7411                    	je	short SEARCH_EXIT
 27820                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 27821 00003738 A0[549E]                	mov	al,[ext_entered]
 27822                                  				;AN005; yes - get the real file type back
 27823 0000373B A2[9AA3]                	mov	[search_best],al
 27824                                  				;AN005; save the real file type
 27825                                  	;
 27826 0000373E EB09                    	jmp	short SEARCH_EXIT
 27827                                  
 27828                                  SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE:		; Tell the user path/drive
 27829 00003740 8B16[E8A3]              	mov	dx,[search_error]
 27830                                  				; appropriate error message
 27831 00003744 E8261C                  	call	std_printf	; and pretend no file found
 27832                                  
 27833                                  SEARCH_NO_FILE:			; couldn't find a match
 27834                                  	;mov	ax,SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 27835                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27836 00003747 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27837                                  SEARCH_EXIT:

 27839 00003749 5E                      	pop	si
 27840 0000374A 5F                      	pop	di
 27841 0000374B 5A                      	pop	dx
 27842 0000374C 59                      	pop	cx

 27846                                  
 27847                                  ; SEARCH_FTYPE determines the type of a file by examining its extension.
 27848                                  ;
 27849                                  ; ENTRY:
 27850                                  ;   fbuf    --	dma buffer containing filename
 27851                                  ; EXIT:
 27852                                  ;   AX	    --	file code, as given in search header
 27853                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27854                                  ;   *	Implicit assumption that NULL == search_file_not_found
 27855                                  
 27856                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27857                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27858                                  SEARCH_FTYPE:
 27859 0000374E 57                      	push	di
 27860 0000374F 56                      	push	si
 27861                                  	;mov	ax,ANULL ; 0	; find the end of the filename
 27862                                  	; 18/02/2023
 27863 00003750 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; ax = 0		
 27864                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 27865                                  	;mov	di,FBUF_PNAME
 27866 00003752 BF[86A3]                	mov	di,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+1Eh
 27867 00003755 B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 27868 00003758 FC                      	cld
 27869 00003759 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; search for the terminating null
 27870 0000375B 7535                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXIT
 27871                                  				; weird... no null byte at end
 27872 0000375D 83EF05                  	sub	di,5		; . + E + X + T + NULL
 27873                                  
 27874                                  	; Compare .COM
 27875                                  
 27876 00003760 BE[A594]                	mov	si,comext ; ".COM"
 27877 00003763 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 27878 00003765 A7                      	cmpsw
 27879 00003766 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXE
 27880 00003768 A7                      	cmpsw
 27881 00003769 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXE
 27882                                  	;mov	ax,8
 27883 0000376B B80800                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_COM	; success!
 27884 0000376E EB22                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 27885                                  
 27886                                  	; Compare .EXE
 27887                                  FTYPE_EXE:			; still looking... now for '.exe'
 27888 00003770 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 27889 00003772 BE[A994]                	mov	si,exeext ; ".EXE"
 27890 00003775 A7                      	cmpsw
 27891 00003776 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_BAT
 27892 00003778 A7                      	cmpsw
 27893 00003779 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_BAT
 27894                                  	;mov	ax,4
 27895 0000377B B80400                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_EXE	; success!
 27896 0000377E EB12                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 27897                                  
 27898                                  	; Compare .BAT
 27899                                  FTYPE_BAT:			; still looking... now for '.bat'
 27900 00003780 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 27901 00003782 BE[AD94]                	mov	si,batext ; ".BAT"
 27902 00003785 A7                      	cmpsw
 27903 00003786 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_FAIL
 27904 00003788 A7                      	cmpsw
 27905 00003789 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_FAIL
 27906                                  	;mov	ax,2
 27907 0000378B B80200                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_BAT	; success!
 27908 0000378E EB02                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 27909                                  
 27910                                  FTYPE_FAIL:			; file doesn't match what we need
 27911                                  	;mov	ax,ANULL ; 0
 27912                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27913 00003790 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax  ; ax = 0
 27914                                  FTYPE_EXIT:
 27915                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27916                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27917 00003792 803E[549E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 27918                                  				;AN005; was an extension entered?
 27919 00003797 740A                    	jz	short FTYPE_DONE
 27920                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 27921                                  	;cmp	ax,ANULL	;AN005; was any match found
 27922 00003799 21C0                    	and	ax,ax  ; ax = 0 ?
 27923 0000379B 7406                    	jz	short FTYPE_DONE
 27924                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 27925 0000379D A2[549E]                	mov	[ext_entered],al
 27926                                  				;AN005; save the match type found
 27927 000037A0 B80800                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_COM	;AN005; send back best was found to stop search
 27928                                  FTYPE_DONE:

 27930 000037A4 5F                      	pop	di
 27931 000037A5 C3                      	retn

 27934                                  
 27935                                  ; STRIP copies the source string (argv[0]) into the destination buffer,
 27936                                  ; replacing any extension with wildcards.
 27937                                  ;
 27938                                  ; ENTRY:
 27939                                  ;	BX	--	maximum length of destination buffer
 27940                                  ;	DS:SI	--	address of destination buffer
 27941                                  ;	argv[0] --	command name to be stripped
 27942                                  ; EXIT:
 27943                                  ;	CF	--	set if failure, clear if successful
 27944                                  ; NOTE(S):
 27945                                  
 27946                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27947                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 27948                                  STRIP:
 27949 000037A6 50                      	push	ax
 27950 000037A7 53                      	push	bx
 27951 000037A8 51                      	push	cx
 27952 000037A9 52                      	push	dx
 27953 000037AA 57                      	push	di
 27954 000037AB 56                      	push	si
 27955                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 27956                                  		
 27957                                  	; 05/05/2023
 27958                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27959 000037AC C606[549E]01            	mov	byte [ext_entered],1
 27960                                  				;AN005; assume no extension on file name
 27961                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27962                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV]
 27963                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 27964                                  				; save pointer to beginning of argstring
 27965                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGPOINTER]
 27966 000037B1 8B16[9E9E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 27967                                  	;mov	di,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 27968                                  				; beginning of last pathname element
 27969                                  	;mov	di,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL] ; beginning of last pathname element
 27970 000037B5 8B3E[A19E]              	mov	di,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 27971 000037B9 803D00                  	cmp	byte [di],0	; *STARTEL == NULL means no command
 27972 000037BC 743D                    	je	short STRIP_ERROR
 27973 000037BE 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx		; compute where end of argstring lies
 27974                                  	;add	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].arglen
 27975                                  	;add	cx,[ARGV0_ARGLEN]
 27976 000037C0 030E[A39E]              	add	cx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.arglen]
 27977 000037C4 29F9                    	sub	cx,di		; and then find length of last element
 27978 000037C6 41                      	inc	cx		; include null as well
 27979 000037C7 B02E                    	mov	al,'.'
 27980                                  	;mov	al,DOT		; let's find the filetype extension
 27981 000037C9 FC                      	cld
 27982 000037CA F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; wind up pointing to either null or dot
 27983                                  
 27984                                  	; 18/03/2023
 27985                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27986 000037CC E307                    	jcxz	PROCESS_EXT	;AN005; if no extension found, just continue
 27987 000037CE B000                    	mov	al,0 ; 18/03/2023
 27988                                  	;mov	byte [ext_entered],0
 27989 000037D0 A2[549E]                	mov	[ext_entered],al
 27990                                  				;AN005; we found an extension
 27991                                  	;;mov	al,ANULL	;AN005; continue scanning until the
 27992                                  	;mov	al,0
 27993 000037D3 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		;AN005; end of line is reached.
 27994                                  PROCESS_EXT:
 27995                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27996 000037D5 89F9                    	mov	cx,di		; pointer to end of argstring yields
 27997 000037D7 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx		; number of bytes to be copied
 27998 000037D9 83EB04                  	sub	bx,4		; can argstring fit into dest. buffer?
 27999 000037DC 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx
 28000 000037DE 7F1B                    	jg	short STRIP_ERROR
 28001                                  				; if not, we must have a bad pathname
 28002 000037E0 89F7                    	mov	di,si		; destination buffer
 28003 000037E2 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; source is beginning of pathname
 28004 000037E4 FC                      	cld
 28005 000037E5 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; SI=arg,DI=buffer,CX=argend-argbeg
 28006                                  
 28007                                  	; 18/03/2023
 28008                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28009 000037E7 803E[549E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 28010                                  				;AN005; if an extension was entered
 28011 000037EC 750A                    	jne	short SKIP_WILDS ; cf = 1 ; 12/06/2023
 28012                                  				;AN005;    don't set up wildcard ext.
 28013                                  
 28014                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 28015 000037EE 4F                      	dec	di		; overwrite null or dot
 28016 000037EF AA                      	stosb			; with a dot
 28017 000037F0 B03F                    	mov	al,'?'
 28018                                  	;mov	al,WILDCHAR	; now add wildcards
 28019 000037F2 AA                      	stosb
 28020 000037F3 AA                      	stosb
 28021 000037F4 AA                      	stosb
 28022 000037F5 B000                    	mov	al,0
 28023                                  	;mov	al,ANULL	; and a terminating null	
 28024 000037F7 AA                      	stosb
 28025                                  SKIP_WILDS:
 28026                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 28027 000037F8 F8                      	clc
 28028 000037F9 EB01                    	jmp	short STRIP_EXIT ; chill out...
 28029                                  
 28030                                  STRIP_ERROR:
 28031                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 28032 000037FB F9                      	stc
 28033                                  STRIP_EXIT:
 28034 000037FC 5E                      	pop	si
 28035 000037FD 5F                      	pop	di
 28036 000037FE 5A                      	pop	dx
 28037 000037FF 59                      	pop	cx
 28038 00003800 5B                      	pop	bx
 28039 00003801 58                      	pop	ax
 28040 00003802 C3                      	retn

 28042                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28043                                  
 28044                                  ; SAVE_ARGS attempts to preserve the existing argv[]/argvcnt/argbuffer
 28045                                  ;
 28046                                  ; structure in newly allocated memory. The argv[] structure is found at the
 28047                                  ; beginning of this area. The caller indicates how much extra space is
 28048                                  ; needed in the resulting structure; Save_Args returns a segment number and
 28049                                  ; an offset into that area, indicating where the caller may preserve its own
 28050                                  ; data. Note that <argvcnt> can be found at <offset-2>.
 28051                                  ; ENTRY:
 28052                                  ;   BX	    --	size (in bytes) of extra area to allocate
 28053                                  ; EXIT:
 28054                                  ;   AX	    --	segment of new area.
 28055                                  ;   CF	    --	set if unable to save a copy.
 28056                                  ; NOTE(S):
 28057                                  ;   1)	The allocated area will be AT LEAST the size requested -- since
 28058                                  ;	the underlying MSDOS call, <alloc> returns an integral number of
 28059                                  ;	paragraphs.
 28060                                  ;   2)	It is an error if MSDOS can't allocate AT LEAST as much memory
 28061                                  ;	as the caller of Save_Args requests.
 28062                                  ;   3)	AX is undefined if CF indicates an error.
 28063                                  
 28064                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28065                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 28066                                  SAVE_ARGS:
 28067 00003803 53                      	push	bx
 28068 00003804 51                      	push	cx
 28069 00003805 52                      	push	dx
 28070 00003806 57                      	push	di
 28071 00003807 56                      	push	si
 28072 00003808 55                      	push	bp
 28073                                  	; 01/05/2023
 28074                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28075                                  	;pushf ; **
 28076                                  	;add	bx,1363		; space for arg structure, round up
 28077 00003809 81C35304                	add	bx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE+15 ; 1348+15
 28078 0000380D B104                    	mov	cl,4		; to paragraph size and convert
 28079 0000380F D3EB                    	shr	bx,cl		; size in bytes to size in paragraphs
 28080 00003811 B80048                  	mov	ax,ALLOC*256 ; 4800h
 28081 00003814 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 28082                                  			; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 28083 00003816 7242                    	jc	short SAVE_ERROR ; ***
 28084 00003818 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; save segment id
 28085 0000381A 06                      	push	es		; save TRANGROUP address
 28086 0000381B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; switch to new memory segment
 28087                                  	; assume es:nothing
 28088                                  	;mov	cx,1348		; get back structure size
 28089 0000381D B94404                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE
 28090 00003820 31FF                    	xor	di,di		; destination is new memory area
 28091                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 28092 00003822 BE[9E9E]                	mov	si,ARG		; source is arg structure
 28093 00003825 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move that sucker!
 28094                                  	;mov	cx,arg.argvcnt 	; adjust argv pointers
 28095                                  	;mov	cx,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 28096 00003827 8B0E[5EA1]              	mov	cx,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 28097 0000382B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; base address for argv_calc
 28098                                  
 28099                                  ;	Bugbug:	What did they mean by this?
 28100                                  ;	Note that the replacement line produces exactly the same code.
 28101                                  ;;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg.argbuf - OFFSET arg_unit.argbuf
 28102                                  ;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg
 28103                                  
 28104                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 28105 0000382D BE[9E9E]                	mov	si,ARG	
 28106                                  SAVE_PTR_LOOP:
 28107 00003830 49                      	dec	cx		; exhausted all args?
 28108 00003831 7C24                    	jl	short SAVE_DONE
 28109 00003833 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx		; get arg index and
 28110 00003835 E89FFC                  	call	argv_calc	; convert to a pointer
 28111                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].argpointer
 28112                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV+bx]
 28113 00003838 8B97[9E9E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer+bx]
 28114 0000383C 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; adjust argpointer
 28115                                  	;mov	es:argv[BX].argpointer,dx
 28116                                  	;mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.argpointer],dx ; mov [es:bx+0],dx
 28117 0000383E 268917                  	mov	[es:bx],dx
 28118                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].argstartel
 28119                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL+bx]
 28120 00003841 8B97[A19E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel+bx]
 28121 00003845 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; and adjust argstartel
 28122                                  	;mov	es:argv[bx].argstartel,dx
 28123                                  	;mov	[es:bx+3],dx
 28124 00003847 26895703                	mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.argstartel],dx
 28125                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].arg_ocomptr
 28126                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_OCOMPTR+bx]
 28127 0000384B 8B97[A79E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr+bx]
 28128 0000384F 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; and adjust arg_ocomptr
 28129                                  	;mov	es:argv[bx].arg_ocomptr,dx
 28130                                  	;mov	[es:bx+9],dx
 28131 00003851 26895709                	mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr],dx
 28132 00003855 EBD9                    	jmp	short SAVE_PTR_LOOP
 28133                                  SAVE_DONE:
 28134 00003857 07                      	pop	es		; back we go to TRANGROUP
 28135                                  	; assume es:nothing
 28136 00003858 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp		; restore segment id
 28137                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28138                                  	; cf = 0 ; *
 28139                                  	;jmp	short SAVE_OK
 28140                                  
 28141                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28142                                  ;SAVE_ERROR:
 28143                                  ;	; 26/04/2023
 28144                                  ;	;popf ; **
 28145                                  ;	stc
 28146                                  ;	jmp	short SAVE_EXIT
 28147                                  
 28148                                  SAVE_OK:
 28149                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28150                                  	;popf ; **
 28151                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28152                                  	; cf = 0 ; *
 28153                                  	;clc
 28154                                  SAVE_EXIT:
 28155                                  SAVE_ERROR:	; 26/04/2023 (cf=1) ; ***
 28156 0000385A 5D                      	pop	bp
 28157 0000385B 5E                      	pop	si
 28158 0000385C 5F                      	pop	di
 28159 0000385D 5A                      	pop	dx
 28160 0000385E 59                      	pop	cx
 28161 0000385F 5B                      	pop	bx
 28162                                  answ_no:	; 26/04/2023
 28163 00003860 C3                      	retn

 28166                                  ; TUCODE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991 (1)
 28167                                  ;============================================================================
 28168                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28169                                  
 28170                                  ; Title	COMMAND Language midifiable Code Transient
 28171                                  
 28172                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2843h
 28173                                  
 28174                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28175                                  
 28176                                  ; ****************************************************************
 28177                                  ; *
 28178                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 NOTEST2 - execution of DEL/ERASE command
 28179                                  ; *
 28180                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Delete files based on user parsed input. Prompt
 28181                                  ; *		 user for Y/N if necessary. If an error occurs,
 28182                                  ; *		 set up an error message and go to CERROR.
