 28705                                  ; ****************************************************************
 28706                                  ; *
 28707                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 ON_OFF
 28708                                  ; *
 28709                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Parse the command line for an optional ON or
 28710                                  ; *		 OFF string for the BREAK, VERIFY, and ECHO
 28711                                  ; *		 routines.
 28712                                  ; *
 28713                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 28714                                  ; *		 PARSE_BREAK control block
 28715                                  ; *
 28716                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 If carry is clear
 28717                                  ; *		    If ON is found
 28718                                  ; *		       Zero flag set
 28719                                  ; *		    If OFF is found
 28720                                  ; *		       Zero flag clear
 28721                                  ; *		 If carry set
 28722                                  ; *		    If nothing on command line
 28723                                  ; *		       CL set to zero
 28724                                  ; *		    If error
 28725                                  ; *		       CL contains error value from parse
 28726                                  ; *
 28727                                  ; ****************************************************************
 28728                                  
 28729                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28730                                  ON_OFF:
 28731 00003A07 BE8100                  	mov	si,81h
 28732                                  
 28733                                  	; 19/03/2023
 28734                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28735                                  	;call	SCANOFF		; scan off leading blanks & equal
 28736                                  	;cmp	al,0Dh		; are we at end of line?
 28737                                  	;je	short BAD_ONF	; yes, return error
 28738                                  	;lodsw
 28739                                  	;or	ax,2020h	; convert to lowercase
 28740                                  	;cmp	ax,6E6Fh ;'on'
 28741                                  	;je	short ON_CHECK
 28742                                  	;cmp	ax,666Fh ;'of'
 28743                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF
 28744                                  	;lodsb
 28745                                  	;or	al,20h		; convert to lowercase		
 28746                                  	;cmp	al,66h	 ; 'f'
 28747                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF	
 28748                                  	;or	al,66h ; or al,'f'
 28749                                  	;jmp	short OFF_CHECK
 28750                                  ;ON_CHECK:
 28751                                  	;xor	al,al
 28752                                  ;OFF_CHECK:
 28753                                  	;lahf
 28754                                  	;mov	bx,ax
 28755                                  	;call	SCANOFF		; scan off leading blanks & equal
 28756                                  	;cmp	al,0Dh		; are we at end of line?	
 28757                                  	;jne	short BAD_ONF	; no, return error
 28758                                  	;mov	ax,bx
 28759                                  	;sahf
 28760                                  	;clc
 28761                                  	;retn
 28762                                  
 28763                                  	; 19/03/2023
 28764                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28765                                  scan_on_off:			;AN032; scan off leading blanks & equal
 28766 00003A0A AC                      	lodsb			;AN032; get a char
 28767                                  	;cmp	al,blank	;AN032; if whitespace

 28769 00003A0D 74FB                    	je	short scan_on_off
 28770                                  				;AN032;    keep scanning
 28771 00003A0F 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab_chr	;AN032; if tab
 28772                                  	;cmp	al,09h
 28773 00003A11 74F7                    	je	short scan_on_off
 28774                                  				;AN032;    keep scanning
 28775                                  	;cmp	al,equal_chr	;AN032; if equal char
 28776 00003A13 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'=' ; 3Dh
 28777 00003A15 7401                    	je	short parse_on_off
 28778                                  				;AN032;    start parsing
 28779 00003A17 4E                      	dec	si		;AN032; if none of above - back up
 28780                                  
 28781                                  parse_on_off:			;AN032;    and start parsing
 28782 00003A18 BF[F294]                	mov	di,PARSE_BREAK	;AN000; Get address of PARSE_BREAK
 28783 00003A1B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		;AN000; clear cx,dx
 28784 00003A1D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AN000;
 28785 00003A1F E87A0E                  	call	cmd_parse	;AC000; call parser
 28786                                  	;cmp	ax,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 28787 00003A22 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE	;AC000; are we at end of line?
 28788 00003A25 742E                    	je	short BADONF	;AC000; yes, return error

 28790                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 28791 00003A27 21C0                    	and	ax,ax ; ax = 0 ?
 28792 00003A29 7404                    	jz	short on_off_there
 28793                                  				;AN000; no - continue
 28794 00003A2B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax		;AN000; yes - set cl to error code
 28795 00003A2D EB26                    	jmp	short BADONF	;AN000; return error
 28796                                  
 28797                                  on_off_there:
 28798 00003A2F 803E[3CA5]FF            	cmp	byte [PARSE1_CODE],-1 ; 0FFh
 28799                                  				;AN014; was a valid positional present?

 28809                                  				;AC000;    ON or OFF in AX
 28810 00003A41 9C                      	pushf			;AN000; save flags
 28811 00003A42 BF[F294]                	mov	di,PARSE_BREAK	;AN000; Get address of PARSE_BREAK

 28820                                  	;jmp	short on_off_end
 28821                                  				;AN000; return to caller
 28822                                  	; 26/04/2023
 28823 00003A51 C3                      	retn
 28824

 28924 00003A7B 98                      	cbw				;AC000;

 28926 00003A7D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;  CX:DX
 28927 00003A7E 89C6                    	mov	si,ax

 28929 00003A82 01C6                    	add	si,ax			; SI=AX*3
 28930 00003A84 89F1                    	mov	cx,si			;AN000; save si
 28931 00003A86 A1[A68F]                	mov	ax,[WeekTab]		;AN000; get message number of weektab
 28932 00003A89 B6FF                    	mov	dh,util_msg_class ;0FFh	;AN000; this is a utility message
 28933 00003A8B 57                      	push	di			;AN000; save argument buffer
 28934 00003A8C E8C319                  	call	TSYSGETMSG		;AN000; get the address of the message
 28935 00003A8F 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000; retrieve argument buffer
 28936 00003A90 01CE                    	add	si,cx			;AC000; get day of week
 28937 00003A92 B90300                  	mov	cx,3

 28940 00003A99 AA                      	stosb

 28942 00003A9B 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;

 28976                                  ; ****************************************************************
 28977                                  ; *
 28978                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 28979                                  ; *
 28980                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 28981                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 28982                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 28983                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 28984                                  ; *
 28985                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 28986                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 28987                                  ; *
 28988                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 28989                                  ; *
 28990                                  ; ****************************************************************
 28991                                  ;
 28992                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 28993                                  ;
 28994                                  ;upconv	proc	near				;AN000;
 28995                                  ;
 28996                                  ;	cmp	al,80h				;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 28997                                  ;	jb	oth_fucase			;AN000;  no - upper case math
 28998                                  ;	sub	al,80h				;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 28999                                  ;	push	ds				;AN000;
 29000                                  ;	push	bx				;AN000;
 29001                                  ;	mov	ds,[resseg]			;AN000;  get resident data segment
 29002                                  ;assume	ds:resgroup				;AN000;
 29003                                  ;	lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1	;AN000;  get table address
 29004                                  ;	add	bx,2				;AN000;  skip over first word
 29005                                  ;	xlat	ds:byte ptr [bx]		;AN000;  convert to upper case
 29006                                  ;	pop	bx				;AN000;
 29007                                  ;	pop	ds				;AN000;
 29008                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 29009                                  ;	jmp	short upconv_end		;AN000;  we finished - exit
 29010                                  ;
 29011                                  ;oth_fucase:					;AN000;
 29012                                  ;	cmp	al,small_a			;AC000; if between "a" and "z",
 29013                                  ;	jb	upconv_end			;AC000;     subtract 20h to get
 29014                                  ;	cmp	al,small_z			;AC000;    upper case equivalent.
 29015                                  ;	ja	upconv_end			;AC000;
 29016                                  ;	sub	al,20h				;AC000; Change lower-case to upper
 29017                                  ;
 29018                                  ;upconv_end:					;AN000;
 29019                                  ;	ret
 29020                                  ;
 29021                                  ;upconv	endp					;AN000;

 29041                                  ;***	MODIFICATION HISTORY
 29042                                  
 29043                                  ;11/01/83 EE  Added a few lines at the end of SCANSRC2 to get multiple
 29044                                  ;	     file concatenations (eg copy a.*+b.*+c.*) to work properly.
 29045                                  ;11/02/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE which added drive designators
 29046                                  ;	     to tokens which begin with path characters so that PARSELINE
 29047                                  ;	     will work correctly.
 29048                                  ;11/04/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE that considered paren's to be
 29049                                  ;	     individual tokens. That distinction is no longer needed for
 29050                                  ;	     FOR loop processing.
 29051                                  ;11/17/83 EE  CPARSE upper case conversion is now flag dependent. Flag is
 29052                                  ;	     1 when Cparse is called from COPY.
 29053                                  ;11/17/83 EE  Took out the comment chars around code described in 11/04/83
 29054                                  ;	     mod. It now is conditional on flag like previous mod.
 29055                                  ;11/21/83 NP  Added printf
 29056                                  ;12/09/83 EE  CPARSE changed to use CPYFLAG to determine when a colon should
 29057                                  ;	     be added to a token.
 29058                                  ;05/30/84 MZ  Initialize all copy variables. Fix confusion with destclosed
 29059                                  ;	     NOTE: DestHand is the destination handle. There are two
 29060                                  ;	     special values: -1 meaning destination was never opened and
 29061                                  ;	     0 which means that the destination has been openned and
 29062                                  ;	     closed.
 29063                                  ;06/01/84 MZ  Above reasoning totally specious. Returned things to normal
 29064                                  ;06/06/86 EG  Change to fix problem of source switches /a and /b getting
 29065                                  ;	     lost on large and multiple file (wildcard) copies.
 29066                                  ;06/09/86 EG  Change to use xnametrans call to verify that source and
 29067                                  ;	     destination are not equal.
 29068                                  ;
 29069                                  ;06/24/90 DO  If the destination of a file concatenation is the same as
 29070                                  ;	     first source file AND we run out of disk space before
 29071                                  ;	     completing the concatenation, restore the first source
 29072                                  ;	     file as best we can. See SeekEnd and CopErr. Bug #859.
 29073                                  ;
 29074                                  ;M031 SR 10/11/90  Bug #3069. Use deny write sharing mode to open files
 29075                                  ;		instead of compatibility mode. This gives lesser sharing
 29076                                  ;		violations when files are opened for read on a copy.
 29077

 29079                                  ;***	COPY CODE

 29081                                  
 29082                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2A15h
 29083                                  
 29084                                  ; 23/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 29085                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 38C3h
 29086                                  
 29087                                  ; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 29088                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 3E6Dh
 29089                                  
 29090                                  COPY:
 29091                                  	; 	Initialize internal variables.
 29092                                  
 29093 00003AA7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; AX = 0
 29094 00003AA9 A3[F29C]                	mov	[Copy_num],ax	; # files copied (destinations) = 0
 29095 00003AAC A3[209E]                	mov	[SRCPT],ax	; cmd line ptr for source scan = 0
 29096 00003AAF A3[6C9D]                	mov	[SrcTail],ax	; ptr to last element of source pathname = 0
 29097 00003AB2 A2[619B]                	mov	[CFLAG],al	; 'destination file created' = false
 29098 00003AB5 A3[679B]                	mov	[NXTADD],ax	; ptr into TPA buffer = 0
 29099 00003AB8 A3[5D9B]                	mov	[DestSwitch],ax	; destination switches = none
 29100 00003ABB A3[449E]                	mov	[STARTEL],ax	; CParse ptr to last pathname element = 0
 29101 00003ABE A3[099D]                	mov	[DestTail],ax	; ptr to last element of dest pathname = 0

 30112                                  	;	We are called to close the destination.
 30113                                  	;	We need to note whether or not there is any internal data left
 30114                                  	;	to be flushed out.

 30121 00004068 8B1E[679B]              	mov	bx,[NXTADD]
 30122                                  ;
 30123                                  ;M048 -- TryFlush changes the state of ConCat flag. So, before we append a
 30124                                  ;^Z, let's always flush out. This way if the ConCat flag changes, we will
 30125                                  ;just return without appending a ^Z incorrectly for the first file (since we
 30126                                  ;are concatenating now). Also, in case it is a single file copy, we will
 30127                                  ;anyway write the ^Z out separately. The only drawback is that there is a
 30128                                  ;performance overhead on single ASCII file copies which now always involve
 30129                                  ;2 writes instead of 1 before. Is this really that important?
 30130                                  ;
 30131                                  ;M048;	cmp	bx,[BYTCNT]		; is memory full?
 30132                                  ;M048;	jne	short PutZ
 30133                                  
 30134                                  	; 26/03/2023
 30135                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30136                                  	;cmp	bx,[BYTCNT]		; is memory full?
 30137                                  	;jne	short PUTZ

 30978                                  ;***	SetAsc - set Ascii, Binary, Inexact flags based on switches
 30979                                  ;
 30980                                  ;	Given switch vector in AX,
 30981                                  ;	  Set Ascii flag if /a is set
 30982                                  ;	  Clear Ascii flag if /b is set
 30983                                  ;	  Binary set if /b specified
 30984                                  ;	  Leave Ascii unchanged if neither or both are set
 30985                                  ; 	Also sets Inexact if Ascii is ever set. 
 30986                                  ;	AL = Ascii on exit, flags set
 30987                                  
 30988                                  	; 26/03/2023
 30989                                  SETASC:

 31504                                  
 31505                                  ;============================================================================
 31506                                  ; CPARSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 31507                                  ;============================================================================
 31508                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31509                                  ; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31510                                  ; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 31511                                  
 31512                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 31513                                  ; ENTRY:								;
 31514                                  ;	DS:SI	Points input buffer					;
 31515                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 31516                                  ;	BL	Special delimiter for this call 			;
 31517                                  ;		    Always checked last 				;
 31518                                  ;		    set it to space if there is no special delimiter	;
 31519                                  ; EXIT: 								;
 31520                                  ;	DS:SI	Points to next char in the input buffer 		;
 31521                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 31522                                  ;	[STARTEL] Points to start of last element of path in token	;
 31523                                  ;		points to a NUL for no element strings 'd:' 'd:/'       ;
 31524                                  ;	CX	Character count 					;
 31525                                  ;	BH	Condition Code						;
 31526                                  ;			Bit 1H of BH set if switch character		;
 31527                                  ;				Token buffer contains char after	;
 31528                                  ;				switch character			;
 31529                                  ;				BP has switch bits set (ORing only)	;
 31530                                  ;			Bit 2H of BH set if ? or * in token		;
 31531                                  ;				if * found element ? filled		;
 31532                                  ;			Bit 4H of BH set if path sep in token		;
 31533                                  ;			Bit 80H of BH set if the special delimiter	;
 31534                                  ;			   was skipped at the start of this token	;
 31535                                  ;		Token buffer always starts d: for non switch tokens	;
 31536                                  ;	CARRY SET							;
 31537                                  ;	    if CR on input						;
 31538                                  ;		token buffer not altered				;
 31539                                  ;									;
 31540                                  ;	DOES NOT RETURN ON BAD PATH, OR TRAILING SWITCH CHAR ERROR	;
 31541                                  ; MODIFIES:								;
 31542                                  ;	CX, SI, AX, BH, DX and the Carry Flag				;
 31543                                  ;									;
 31544                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 31545                                  
 31546                                  ; Modifications to cparse: recognition of right and left parentheses
 31547                                  ; as integral tokens, and removal of automatic upper-case conversion code.
 31548                                  ;
 31549                                  ; Both modifications were installed in the course of adding a coherent
 31550                                  ; command-line parser to COMMAND.COM which builds a UNIX-style argv[]/argc
 31551                                  ; structure for command-line arguments. This parser relies on cparse to
 31552                                  ; recognize individual tokens.
 31553                                  ;
 31554                                  ; To process for-loops correctly, parentheses must therefore be
 31555                                  ; recognized as tokens. The upper-case conversion code was removed so
 31556                                  ; that commands (such as for and echo) would be able to use the "original"
 31557                                  ; text of the command line.
 31558                                  ;
 31559                                  ; Note also the modification to prevent the automatic conversion of colons
 31560                                  ; into spaces WITHIN THE SOURCE TEXT!
 31561                                  ;
 31562                                  ; Also note that BP is also clobbered if cparse recognizes any switches
 31563                                  ; on the command line.
 31564                                  ;
 31565                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    14 August 1983
 31566                                  
 31567                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31568                                  
 31569                                  ; COMEQU.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 31570                                  
 31571                                  ;FSWITCH	EQU	8000h
 31572                                  ;FBADSWITCH	EQU	4000h
 31573                                  
 31574                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3334h
 31575                                  
 31576                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31577                                  		
 31578                                  	; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31579                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM (1991) Transient portion offset 431Fh
 31580                                  
 31581                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 31582                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM (1994) Transient portion offset 4AE3h
 31583                                  cparse:
 31584 000046D7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31585 000046D9 893E[449E]              	mov	[STARTEL],di		; No path element (Is DI correct?)
 31586 000046DD A2[479E]                	mov	[ELPOS],al		; Start in 8 char prefix
 31587                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31588                                  	;mov	[SOURCE],al		
 31589                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31590 000046E0 A2[489E]                	mov	[SKPDEL], al		; No skip delimiter yet
 31591 000046E3 88C7                    	mov	bh,al			; Init nothing
 31592 000046E5 9C                      	pushf				; save flags
 31593 000046E6 57                      	push	di			; save the token buffer addrss
 31594 000046E7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; no chars in token buffer
 31595 000046E9 880E[E59C]              	mov	[comma],cl		; reset comma flag
 31596                                  moredelim:
 31597 000046ED AC                      	lodsb
 31598 000046EE E85EE2                  	call	DELIM
 31599 000046F1 751D                    	jnz	short SCANCDONE
 31600 000046F3 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '
 31601 000046F5 74F6                    	jz	short moredelim
 31602 000046F7 3C09                    	cmp	al,9
 31603 000046F9 74F2                    	jz	short moredelim
 31604                                  	;xchg	al,[SOURCE]
 31605                                  	; 28/03/2023
 31606 000046FB 8606[489E]              	xchg	al,[SKPDEL]
 31607 000046FF 08C0                    	or	al,al
 31608 00004701 74EA                    	jz	short moredelim		; One non space/tab delimiter allowed
 31609 00004703 F6C780                  	test	bh,80h			; has a special char been found?
 31610 00004706 7405                    	jz	short no_comma		; no - just exit
 31611 00004708 C606[E59C]01            	mov	byte [comma],1		; set comma flag
 31612                                  no_comma:
 31613 0000470D E92A01                  	jmp	x_done			; Nul argument
 31614                                  
 31615                                  SCANCDONE:
 31616                                  	; 28/03/2023
 31617                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31618                                  	; -----------------------------------
 31619                                  	; Mod to avoid upper-case conversion.
 31620                                  	; -----------------------------------
 31621                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31622                                  	;cmp	byte [CPYFLAG],1	; 3/3/KK
 31623                                  	;jnz	short cpcont1		; 3/3/KK

 31923                                  ;**** Equation field
 31924                                  ;-------- Character code definition
 31925                                  
 31926                                  $P_DBSP1	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_HI	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS blank
 31927                                  $P_DBSP2	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_LO	;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS blank
 31928                                  $P_Period	   equ	"."             ;AN020;
 31929                                  $P_Slash	   equ	"/"             ;AN020;
 31930                                  $P_Space	   equ	" "             ;AN000; SBCS blank
 31931                                  $P_Comma	   equ	","             ;AN000;
 31932                                  $P_Switch	   equ	"/"             ;AN000;
 31933                                  $P_Keyword	   equ	"="             ;AN000;
 31934                                  $P_Colon	   equ	":"             ;AN000;
 31935                                  $P_Plus 	   equ	"+"             ;AN000;
 31936                                  $P_Minus	   equ	"-"             ;AN000;
 31937                                  $P_Rparen	   equ	")"             ;AN000;
 31938                                  $P_Lparen	   equ	"("             ;AN000;
 31939                                  ;(deleted ;AN025;) $P_SQuote equ  "'"
 31940                                  $P_DQuote	   equ	'"'             ;AN000;
 31941                                  $P_NULL 	   equ	0		;AN000;
 31942                                  $P_TAB		   equ	9		;AN000;
 31943                                  $P_CR		   equ	0Dh		;AN000;
 31944                                  $P_LF		   equ	0Ah		;AN000;
 31945                                  $P_ASCII80	   equ	80h		;AN000; ASCII 80h character code
 31946                                  
 31947                                  $P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table
 31948                                  $P_DOSTBL_Char	   equ	2		;AN000; get character uppercase table
 31949                                  
 31950                                  $P_error_filespec  equ  1
 31951                                  
 31952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31953                                  ; PARMS LABEL	BYTE
 31954                                  ;	DW	PARMSX
 31955                                  ;	DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 31956                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 31957                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 31958                                  ;				; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 31959                                  ;				; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 31960                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 31961                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 31962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31963                                  
 31964                                  struc $P_PARMS_BLK			;AN000;
 31965 00000000 ????                    .$P_PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 31966 00000002 ??                      .$P_Num_Extra:	     resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 31967 00000003 ??                      .$P_Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 31968                                  endstruc 				;AN000;
 31969                                  
 31970                                  $P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 31971                                  $P_I_Use_Default   equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 31972                                  $P_I_Have_Delim    equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 31973                                  $P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 31974                                  
 31975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31976                                  ; PARMSX LABEL	BYTE
 31977                                  ;	DB	minp,maxp		; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 31978                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 31979                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 31980                                  ;	DB	maxs			; # OF SWITCHES
 31981                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 31982                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 31983                                  ;	DB	maxk			; # OF KEYWORD
 31984                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 31985                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 31986                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31987                                  
 31988                                  struc $P_PARMSX_BLK			;AN000;
 31989 00000000 ??                      .$P_MinP: 	 resb 1	 ; 27/04/2023	;AN000; Minimum positional number
 31990 00000001 ??                      .$P_MaxP: 	 resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 31991 00000002 ??                      .$P_1st_Control: resb 1			;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 31992                                  endstruc				;AN000;
 31993                                  
 31994                                  ; 31/03/2023
 31995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31996                                  ; << Control field definition >>
 31997                                  ;
 31998                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 31999                                  ;	   DW MATCH_FLAGS	; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 32000                                  ;				; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32001                                  ;				; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32002                                  ;				; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 32003                                  ;				; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32004                                  ;				; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32005                                  ;				; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32006                                  ;				; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32007                                  ;				; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32008                                  ;				; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 32009                                  ;				; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 32010                                  ;				; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 32011                                  ;				; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 32012                                  ;	   DW FUNCTION_FLAGS
 32013                                  ;				; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 32014                                  ;				; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 32015                                  ;				; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 32016                                  ; (tm10)			; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 32017                                  ;
 32018                                  ;	   DW RESULT		; RESULT BUFFER
 32019                                  ;	   DW VALUES		; VALUE LISTS
 32020                                  ;	   DB nid		; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 32021                                  ;	   DB "...",0		; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 32022                                  ;	   :
 32023                                  ;
 32024                                  ;Note:
 32025                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 32026                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 32027                                  ;
 32028                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 32029                                  ;
 32030                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 32031                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 32032                                  ;
 32033                                  ;
 32034                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 32035                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 32036                                  ;
 32037                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 32038                                  ;
 32039                                  ;
 32040                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 32041                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 32042                                  ;
 32043                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 32044                                  ;		DB   '/A',0
 32045                                  ;
 32046                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 32047                                  ;
 32048                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 32049                                  ;		DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 32050                                  ;
 32051                                  ;
 32052                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 32053                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 32054                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 32055                                  ;
 32056                                  ;
 32057                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 32058                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 32059                                  ;
 32060                                  ;		DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 32061                                  ;		DB    '/A',0
 32062                                  ;		DB    '/B',0
 32063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32064                                  
 32065                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 32066                                  
 32067                                  $P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 32068                                  $P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 32069                                  $P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 32070                                  $P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 32071                                  $P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 32072                                  $P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 32073                                  $P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec

 32097                                  ; 31/03/2023
 32098                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32099                                  ;
 32100                                  ;VALUES LABEL	BYTE
 32101                                  ;	DB	nval		; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 32102                                  ;	+-
 32103                                  ;	| DB	nrng		; NUMBER OF RANGES
 32104                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 32105                                  ;	| +DD	X,Y		; RANGE OF VALUES
 32106                                  ;	|	:
 32107                                  ;	| DB	nnval		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 32108                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 32109                                  ;	| +DD	VALUE		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 32110                                  ;	|	:
 32111                                  ;	| DB	nstrval 	; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 32112                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 32113                                  ;	| +DW	STRING		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 32114                                  ;	+-	:
 32115                                  ;
 32116                                  ;STRING DB	"...",0		; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 32117                                  ;
 32118                                  ;Note:
 32119                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 32120                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 32121                                  ;
 32122                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 32123                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 32124                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 32125                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32126                                  
 32127                                  $P_nval_None	equ 0		;AN000; no value list ID
 32128                                  $P_nval_Range	equ 1		;AN000; range list ID
 32129                                  $P_nval_Value	equ 2		;AN000; value list ID
 32130                                  $P_nval_String	equ 3		;AN000; string list ID
 32131                                  $P_Len_Range	equ 9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 32132                                  $P_Len_Value	equ 5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 32133                                  $P_Len_String	equ 3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 32134                                  $P_No_nrng	equ 0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 32135                                  
 32136                                  struc $P_VAL_LIST
 32137 00000000 ??                      .$P_NumofList:	resb 1		;AN000; number of following choice
 32138 00000001 ????                    .$P_Val_XL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of value
 32139 00000003 ????                    .$P_Val_XH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of value
 32140 00000005 ????                    .$P_Val_YL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of another value
 32141 00000007 ????                    .$P_Val_YH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of another value
 32142                                  endstruc
 32143                                  
 32144                                  ; 31/03/2023
 32145                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32146                                  ;
 32147                                  ;RESULT LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 32148                                  ;	DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 32149                                  ;					;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 32150                                  ;					;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 32151                                  ;					;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 32152                                  ;					;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 32153                                  ;					;	9=QUOTED STRING
 32154                                  ;	DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 32155                                  ;
 32156                                  ;	dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 32157                                  ;
 32158                                  ;       +-
 32159                                  ;       | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 32160                                  ;       | or
 32161                                  ;       |	DW i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 32162                                  ;       |				; (ES presents Segment address)
 32163                                  ;       | or
 32164                                  ;       |	DD STRING		; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 32165                                  ;       | or
 32166                                  ;       |	DB drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 32167                                  ;       | or
 32168                                  ;       |	DW YEAR	   		;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 32169                                  ;       |	DB MONTH   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 32170                                  ;       |	DB DATE	   ;(1-31)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 32171                                  ;       | or
 32172                                  ;       |	DB HOUR	   ;(0-23)	 IN CASE OF TIME
 32173                                  ;       |	DB MINUTES    ;(0-59)	 Note: Range check is not performed .
 32174                                  ;       |	DB SECONDS    ;(0-59)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 32175                                  ;       |	DB HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 32176                                  ;       +-
 32177                                  ;
 32178                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 32179                                  ;      list.
 32180                                  ;
 32181                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 32182                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it. For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 32183                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 32184                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32185

 32190 00000002 ????                    .$P_SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 32191 00000004 ????????                .$P_Picked_Val:	 resb 4		;AN000; value
 32192                                  endstruc
 32193

 32195

 32198                                  $P_List_Idx	 equ 2		;AN000; List Index
 32199                                  $P_String	 equ 3		;AN000; String
 32200                                  $P_Complex	 equ 4		;AN000; Complex
 32201                                  $P_File_Spec	 equ 5		;AN000; File Spec
 32202                                  $P_Drive	 equ 6		;AN000; Drive
 32203                                  $P_Date_F	 equ 7		;AN000; Date
 32204                                  $P_Time_F	 equ 8		;AN000; Time
 32205                                  $P_Quoted_String equ 9		;AN000; Quoted String
 32206

 32208

 32210                                  ;
 32211                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 32212

 32215                                  $P_Op_Missing	 equ 2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 32216                                  $P_Not_In_SW	 equ 3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 32217                                  $P_Not_In_Key	 equ 4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 32218                                  $P_Out_Of_Range  equ 6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 32219                                  $P_Not_In_Val	 equ 7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 32220                                  $P_Not_In_Str	 equ 8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 32221                                  $P_Syntax	 equ 9		;AN000; Syntax error
 32222                                  $P_RC_EOL	 equ -1		;AN000; End of command line
 32223                                  
 32224                                  ;in second byte of $P_Flags, referenced as $P_Flags2:
 32225                                  $P_equ		 equ 01h	;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 32226                                  $P_Neg		 equ 02h	;AN000; Negative value
 32227                                  $P_Time12	 equ 04h	;AN000; set when PM is specified
 32228                                  $P_Key_Cmp	 equ 08h	;AN000; set when keyword compare
 32229                                  $P_SW_Cmp	 equ 10h	;AN000; set when switch compare
 32230                                  $P_Extra	 equ 20h	;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 32231                                  $P_SW		 equ 40h	;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 32232                                  $P_Signed	 equ 80h	;AN000; signed numeric specified
 32233

 32235                                  $P_Make_Lower	 equ 20h	;AN000; make lower case character

 32283                                  
 32284                                  ;***********************************************************************
 32285                                  ; SysParse;
 32286                                  ;
 32287                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 32288                                  ;
 32289                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 32290                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 32291                                  ;	  psdata_seg -> psdata.inc
 32292                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 32293                                  ;
 32294                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 32295                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 32296                                  ;		 is in DS.
 32297                                  ;
 32298                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 32299                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 32300                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 32301                                  ;
 32302                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 32303                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 32304                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 32305                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 32306                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 32307                                  ;
 32308                                  ; Use:	$P_Skip_Delim, $P_Chk_EOL, $P_Chk_Delim, $P_Chk_DBCS
 32309                                  ;	$P_Chk_Swtch, $P_Chk_Pos_Control, $P_Chk_Key_Control
 32310                                  ;	$P_Chk_Sw_Control, $P_Fill_Result
 32311                                  ;
 32312                                  ; Vars: $P_Ordinal(RW), $P_RC(RW), $P_SI_Save(RW), $P_DX(R), $P_Terminator(R)
 32313                                  ;	$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), $P_Flags(RW), $P_Found_SYNONYM(R), $P_Save_EOB(W)
 32314                                  ;
 32315                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 32316                                  ;
 32317                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 32318                                  ;  4/28/87 : $P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 32319                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 32320                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 32321                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 32322                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 32323                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 32324                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 32325                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_FileSp_Char and $P_FileSP_Len are missing
 32326                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 32327                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 32328                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 32329                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add $P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 32330                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 32331                                  ;	     (tm08)
 32332                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 32333                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 32334                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag $P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 32335                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 32336                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 32337                                  ;	     in user's routines. $P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 32338                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 32339                                  ;					  (tm12)
 32340                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 32341                                  ;					  (tm13)
 32342                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 32343                                  ;					  (tm14)
 32344                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 32345                                  ;					  (tm15)
 32346                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 32347                                  ;
 32348                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 32349                                  ;
 32350                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 32351                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 32352                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 32353                                  ;	     affected: $P_Chk_SW_Control.
 32354                                  ;
 32355                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 32356                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 32357                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 32358                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 32359                                  ;
 32360                                  ;
 32361                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 32362                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC $P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 32363                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 32364                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 32365                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change $P_Chk_Switch to allow
 32366                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 32367                                  ;
 32368                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 32369                                  ;	     In PROC $P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 32370                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 32371                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 32372                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 32373                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 32374                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 32375                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 32376                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 32377                                  ;
 32378                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 32379                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 32380                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 32381                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 32382                                  ;	     segment.
 32383                                  ;
 32384                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 32385                                  ;	     in $p_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 32386                                  ;	     into PUSH PSDATA_SEG.  In $P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 32387                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 32388                                  ;	     Created FLag, in $P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 32389                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 32390                                  ;
 32391                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 32392                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 32393                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 32394                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 32395                                  ;
 32396                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 32397                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 32398                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 32399                                  ;
 32400                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 32401                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 32402                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 32403                                  ;	     (apostrophe) $P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 32404                                  ;	     $P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 32405                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 32406                                  ;
 32407                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 32408                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 32409                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 32410                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC $P_Quoted_Str.
 32411                                  ;
 32412                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 32413                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 32414                                  ;

 32416                                  ;

 32479                                  sysparse:
 32480 0000489C 2EC706[9D96]0000        	mov	word [cs:$P_Flags],0	;AC034; Clear all internal flags
 32481 000048A3 2E890E[2797]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORIG_ORD],cx	;AN039; ORIGINAL ORDINAL FROM CX
 32482 000048A8 2E8926[2997]            	mov	[cs:$P_ORIG_STACK],sp	;AN039; ORIGINAL VALUE OF STACK FROM SP

 32948                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 32949                                  ;
 32950                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag

 32953                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list

 32955                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 32956                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has secondsn,
 32957                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 34656                                  	;retn				;AN000;

 34658                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34659                                  ; $P_Chk_EOL;
 34660                                  ;
 34661                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 34662                                  ;
 34663                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 34664                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 34665                                  ;
 34666                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 34667                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34668                                  
 34669                                  	; 05/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 34701                                  
 34702                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34703                                  ; $P_Chk_Delim;
 34704                                  ;
 34705                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 34706                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 34707                                  ;	    blanks.
 34708                                  ;
 34709                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 34710                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 34711                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 34712                                  ;
 34713                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 34714                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 34715                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W), $P_Flags(W)
 34716                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34717                                  
 34718                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 34719                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 34720                                  $P_Chk_Delim:
 34721 00005276 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 34722 00005277 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 34723 00005278 2EC606[9896]20          	mov	byte [cs:$P_Terminator],$P_Space ; 20h
 34724                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 34725 0000527E 2E8026[9E96]DF          	and	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],0FFh-$P_Extra ; 0DFh
 34726                                  					;AC034;
 34727 00005284 3C20                    	cmp	al,$P_Space ; 20h ; ' '	;AN000; Space ?
 34728 00005286 7436                    	je	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit	;AN000;
 34729

 34735                                  					;AN000;

 34738 00005292 750C                    	jne	short $P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;

 34740                                  					;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 34741 00005297 7507                    	jne	short $P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 34742 00005299 B020                    	mov	al,$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000;

 34744 0000529C 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 34745 0000529E EB1E                    	jmp	short $P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 34746

 34752                                  
 34753 000052A7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 34754 000052A9 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+$P_PARMS_BLK.$P_Len_Extra_Delim]
 34755                                  	;mov	cl,[esi:di+3]		;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 34756 000052AD 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 34757 000052AF 740B                    	jz	short $P_Chk_Delim_NZ	;AN000;
 34758                                  
 34759 000052B1 BB0300                  	mov	bx,$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 34760                                  $P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 34761 000052B4 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 34762 000052B5 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character

 34764                                  					;AN000;

 34786                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34787                                  ; $P_Chk_Switch;
 34788                                  ;
 34789                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 34790                                  ;	    $P_STRING_BUF
 34791                                  ;
 34792                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 34793                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within $P_String_Buf
 34794                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 34795                                  ;
 34796                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 34797                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 34798                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 34799                                  ;
 34800                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 34801                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 34802                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 34803                                  ;
 34804                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W)
 34805                                  ;
 34806                                  ; Use:	 $P_0099
 34807                                  ;***********************************************************************
 34808                                  
 34809                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 34810                                  	; 14/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 34811                                  $P_Chk_Switch:
 34812                                  	; 18/04/2023
 34813 000052D7 8D2E[A796]              	lea	bp,$P_STRING_BUF	;AN020;AC034; BP=OFFSET of $P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 34814                                  
 34815 000052DB 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 34816 000052DD 7418                    	je	short $P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 34817                                  
 34818 000052DF 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 34819 000052E1 7512                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5	;AN000;
 34820                                  
 34821 000052E3 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash, now see if might be in date string
 34822 000052E4 50                      	push	ax			;AN020;save input char
 34823 000052E5 2E8A47FF                	mov	al,[cs:bx-1]		;AN026;AL=char before the current char
 34824 000052E9 E804FB                  	call	$P_0099 		;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 34825 000052EC 7205                    	jc	short $P_STRUC_L7	;AN000;
 34826                                  
 34827 000052EE 8A04                    	mov	al,[si]			;AN020;AL=char after the current char
 34828 000052F0 E8FDFA                  	call	$P_0099			;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 34829                                  $P_STRUC_L7:				;AN000;
 34830 000052F3 58                      	pop	ax			;AN020;restore AL to input char
 34831                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 34832                                  	; 18/04/2023
 34833 000052F4 C3                      	retn
 34834                                  
 34835                                  $P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 34836 000052F5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;not a slash
 34837                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 34838                                  	 ;18/04/2023
 34839 000052F6 C3                      	retn
 34840                                  
 34841                                  $P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 34842 000052F7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 34843                                  	;jne	short $P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 34844                                  	; 18/04/2023
 34845 000052F9 75FA                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5
 34846                                  
 34847 000052FB 2E800E[9E96]40          	or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],$P_SW
 34848                                  	;or	byte [cs:$P_Flags2],40h	;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 34849                                  	; 18/04/2023
 34850                                  ;$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 34851                                  	;clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 34852                                  $P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 34853 00005301 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 34855                                  ;**************************************************************************
 34856                                  ; $P_Chk_DBCS:
 34857                                  ;
 34858                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 34859                                  ;
 34860                                  ;  Input:
 34861                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 34862                                  ;
 34863                                  ;  Output:
 34864                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 34865                                  ;
 34866                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 34867                                  ;
 34868                                  ; Vars:  $P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), $P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 34869                                  ;***************************************************************************

 34882 0000530F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 34883 00005310 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 34884 00005311 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 34885 00005312 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;

 34888 00005316 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;

 34890 00005318 B80063                  	mov	ax,6300h
 34891 0000531B CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 34892 0000531D 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 34893 0000531F 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 34894 00005321 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 34895 00005322 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 34896 00005323 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 34897 00005324 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 34898 00005325 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 34899 00005326 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 34900 00005327 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 34901 00005328 7429                    	jz	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 34902                                  $P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 34903 0000532A 2E8936[9996]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 34904 0000532F 2E891E[9B96]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 34905                                  $P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 34906 00005334 2E8B36[9996]            	mov	si,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 34907 00005339 2E8E1E[9B96]            	mov	ds,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 34908                                  $P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 34909 0000533E 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0 		;AN000; zero vector ?
 34910 00005341 7410                    	je	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 34911 00005343 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 34912 00005345 7208                    	jb	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000; Check if AL is in
 34913 00005347 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 34914 0000534A 7703                    	ja	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000;      the vector
 34915 0000534C F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 34916 0000534D EB04                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 34917                                  $P_DBCS01:				;AN000;

 34919 00005350 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 34920                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 34921 00005351 EBEB                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 34922

 35008                                  ;****************************************************************
 35009                                  ;*
 35010                                  ;* ROUTINE:	STD_PRINTF/STD_EPRINTF
 35011                                  ;*
 35012                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Set up to print out a message using SYSDISPMSG.
 35013                                  ;*		Set up substitutions if utility message.  Make
 35014                                  ;*		sure any changes to message variables in TDATA
 35015                                  ;*		are reset to avoid reloading the transient.
 35016                                  ;*
 35017                                  ;* INPUT:	Msg_Disp_Class	-  set to message class
 35018                                  ;*		Msg_Cont_Flag	-  set to control flags
 35019                                  ;*		DS	points to transient segment
 35020                                  ;*
 35021                                  ;*		if utility message:
 35022                                  ;*		DX	points to a block with message number
 35023                                  ;*			(word), number of substitutions (byte),
 35024                                  ;*			followed by substitution list if there
 35025                                  ;*			are substitutions.  If substitutions
 35026                                  ;*			are not in transient segment they must
 35027                                  ;*			be set.
 35028                                  ;*		else
 35029                                  ;*		AX	set to message number
 35030                                  ;*
 35031                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 35032                                  ;*
 35033                                  ;****************************************************************
 35034                                  
 35035                                  std_eprintf:
 35036 00005365 C706[6E98]0200          	mov	word [PRINTF_HANDLE],2 		;AC000;Print to STDERR
 35037 0000536B EB06                    	jmp	short new_printf		;AC000;
 35038                                  
 35039                                  	; 07/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35040                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM (1991) Transient portion offset 5012h
 35041                                  
 35042                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35043                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM (1994) Transient portion offset 57D6h
