 35264                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35265                                  ; MODULE NAME: MSGSERV.SAL
 35266                                  ;
 35267                                  ; DESCRIPTIVE NAME: Message Services SALUT file
 35268                                  ;
 35269                                  ; FUNCTION: This module incorporates all the messages services and
 35270                                  ;	    is called upon at build time to INCLUDE the code requested
 35271                                  ;	    by a utility. Code is requested using the macro MSG_SERVICES.
 35272                                  ;
 35273                                  ; ENTRY POINT: Since this a collection of subroutines, entry point is at
 35274                                  ;	    requested procedure.
 35275                                  ;
 35276                                  ; INPUT: Since this a collection of subroutines, input is dependent on
 35277                                  ;	    function requested.
 35278                                  ;
 35279                                  ; EXIT-NORMAL: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 0
 35280                                  ;
 35281                                  ; EXIT-ERROR: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 1
 35282                                  ;
 35283                                  ; INTERNAL REFERENCES: (list of included subroutines)
 35284                                  ;
 35285                                  ;	- SYSLOADMSG
 35286                                  ;	- SYSDISPMSG
 35287                                  ;	- SYSGETMSG
 35288                                  ;
 35289                                  ; EXTERNAL REFERENCES: None
 35290                                  ;
 35291                                  ; NOTES: At build time, some modules must be included. These are only included
 35292                                  ;	 once using assembler switches. Other logic is included at the request
 35293                                  ;	 of the utility.
 35294                                  ;
 35295                                  ;	 COMR and COMT are assembler switches to conditionally assemble code
 35296                                  ;	 for RESIDENT COMMAND.COM and TRANSIENT COMMAND.COM to reduce resident
 35297                                  ;	 storage and multiple EQUates.
 35298                                  ;
 35299                                  ; REVISION HISTORY: Created MAY 1987
 35300                                  ;
 35301                                  ;     Label: DOS - - Message Retriever
 35302                                  ;	     (c) Copyright 1988 Microsoft
 35303                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35304                                  
 35305                                  ;	Revision History
 35306                                  ;	================
 35307                                  ;
 35308                                  ;	M007	SR	08/24/90	Fixed bug #1818 -- changed
 35309                                  ;				$M_DISPLAY_H_STRING to properly
 35310                                  ;				handle Ctrl-Z being passed
 35311                                  ;
 35312                                  ;	M013	SR	9/12/90	Make SETSTDIO flag false so that all
 35313                                  ;				these routines are no longer assembled.
 35314                                  ;
 35315                                  ;	M016	SR	10/14/90	Bug #3380. Changed SYSLOADMSG so that
 35316                                  ;				CR-LF string also gets reinitialized
 35317                                  ;				on every cycle.
 35318                                  ;

 35421                                  ;;	PROC NAME: SYSLOADMSG

 35424                                  ;;	INPUTS:
 35425                                  ;;
 35426                                  ;;	OUTPUTS:

 35428                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 35429                                  
 35430                                  	; 07/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35431                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5107h
 35432                                  
 35433                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 35434                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:58CBh
 35435                                  
 35436                                  SYSLOADMSG:
 35437 00005458 50                      	push	ax				;;AN000;
 35438 00005459 53                      	push	bx				;;AN000;
 35439 0000545A 52                      	push	dx				;;AN000;
 35440 0000545B 06                      	push	es				;;AN000;
 35441 0000545C 57                      	push	di				;;AN000;
 35442 0000545D 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx				;;AN000;  Reset to zero
 35443 0000545F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx				;;AN000;
 35444 00005461 31FF                    	xor	di,di				;;AN000;
 35445 00005463 B82E12                  	mov	ax,122Eh ; DOS_GET_EXT_PARSE_ADD ;;AN000;; 2FH Interface
 35446 00005466 B200                    	mov	dl,0 ; DOS_GET_EXTENDED		;;AN000;; Where are the Extended errors in COMMAND.COM
 35447 00005468 CD2F                    	int	2Fh				;;AN000;; Private interface
 35448                                  		; Multiplex - DOS 3+ internal - GET OR SET ERROR TABLE ADDRESSES
 35449                                  		; DL = subfunction - get standard DOS error table (errors 00h-12h,50h-5Bh)
 35450                                  		; Return: ES:DI -> error table
 35451                                  	
 35452 0000546A 8C06[7697]              	mov	[$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_EXT_COMMAND+2],es
 35453                                  	;mov	[$M_RT+10],es			;;AN000;; Move into first avaliable table location
 35454 0000546E 893E[7497]              	mov	[$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_EXT_COMMAND],di
 35455                                  	;mov	[$M_RT+8],di			;;AN000;;
 35456                                  
 35457 00005472 B82E12                  	mov	ax,122Eh ; DOS_GET_EXT_PARSE_ADD ;;AN000;; 2FH Interface
 35458 00005475 B202                    	mov	dl,2 ; DOS_GET_PARSE		;;AN000;; Where are the Parse errors in COMMAND.COM
 35459 00005477 CD2F                    	int	2Fh				;;AN000;; Private interface
 35460                                  		; Multiplex - DOS 3+ internal - GET OR SET ERROR TABLE ADDRESSES
 35461                                  		; DL = subfunction - get critical/SHARE error table (errors 13h-2Bh)
 35462                                  		; ES:DI -> error table
 35463

 36002                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36003                                  ;;
 36004                                  ;;  Proc Name:	SYSDISPMSG
 36005                                  ;;
 36006                                  ;;  Function:	The DISPLAY service will output a defined message to a handle
 36007                                  ;;		requested by the caller. It also provides function to display
 36008                                  ;;		messages when handles are not applicable (ie. DOS function calls
 36009                                  ;;		00h to 0Ah) Replaceable parameters are allowed and are
 36010                                  ;;		defined previous to entry.
 36011                                  ;;
 36012                                  ;;		It is assumes that a PRELOAD function has already determined
 36013                                  ;;		the addressibilty internally to the message retriever services.
 36014                                  ;;  Inputs:
 36015                                  ;;
 36016                                  ;;  Outputs:
 36017                                  ;;
 36018                                  ;;  Psuedocode:
 36019                                  ;;		Save registers needed later
 36020                                  ;;		Get address of the message requested
 36021                                  ;;		IF Message number exists THEN
 36022                                  ;;		  IF replacable parameters were specified THEN
 36023                                  ;;		     Display message with replacable parms
 36024                                  ;;		  ELSE
 36025                                  ;;		     Display string without replacable parms
 36026                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 36027                                  ;;		  IF character input was requested THEN
 36028                                  ;;		     Wait for character input
 36029                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 36030                                  ;;		  Clear CARRY FLAG
 36031                                  ;;		ELSE
 36032                                  ;;		   Set CARRY FLAG
 36033                                  ;;		ENDIF
 36034                                  ;;		Return
 36035                                  ;;
 36036                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36037                                  
 36038                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 36039                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5307h
 36040                                  	;
 36041                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 36042                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5ACBh
 36043                                  SYSDISPMSG:
 36044                                  	;; Save registers and values needed later
 36045 0000563A 50                      	push	ax				;;AN000;; Save changed REGs
 36046 0000563B 53                      	push	bx				;;AN000;;
 36047 0000563C 51                      	push	cx				;;AN000;;
 36048 0000563D 55                      	push	bp				;;AN000;;
 36049 0000563E 57                      	push	di				;;AN000;; Save pointer to input buffer (offset)
 36050 0000563F 06                      	push	es				;;AN000;; Save pointer to input buffer (segment)
 36051 00005640 52                      	push	dx				;;AN000;; Save Input/Class request
 36052                                  
 36053 00005641 89CD                    	mov	bp,cx				;;AN000;; Use BP to hold replace count

 36066                                  	;; Test if replacable parameters were specified

 36291 000056E6 1F                      	pop	ds				;;AN000;;
 36292 000056E7 C3                      	retn
 36293                                  
 36294                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36295                                  ;;
 36296                                  ;; Scan_ctrlZ: This routine looks through the string to be printed and 
 36297                                  ;; truncates it at the Ctrl-Z if any present.
 36298                                  ;;
 36299                                  ;;	ENTRY:	ds:dx = String to be displayed
 36300                                  ;;		cx = number of chars to be displayed
 36301                                  ;;
 36302                                  ;;	EXIT:	cx = number of chars to be displayed
 36303                                  ;;
 36304                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36305                                  
 36306                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 36307                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 36308                                  scan_ctrlz:
 36309 000056E8 57                      	push	di
 36310 000056E9 50                      	push	ax
 36311 000056EA 06                      	push	es
 36312 000056EB 53                      	push	bx
 36313                                  
 36314 000056EC 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 36315 000056EE 1E                      	push	ds
 36316 000056EF 07                      	pop	es   			;es:di points at string
 36317                                  
 36318 000056F0 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx			;save current count
 36319                                  
 36320 000056F2 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah	; Ctrl-Z
 36321 000056F4 FC                      	cld
 36322 000056F5 F2AE                    	repne	scasb			;find first Ctrl-Z
 36323 000056F7 7503                    	jnz	short noCtrlZ		;no CtrlZ found in string
 36324                                  
 36325 000056F9 29CB                    	sub	bx,cx
 36326 000056FB 4B                      	dec	bx			;bx = new count to display
 36327                                  noCtrlZ:
 36328 000056FC 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			;cx = actual display count
 36329                                  
 36330 000056FE 5B                      	pop	bx
 36331 000056FF 07                      	pop	es
 36332 00005700 58                      	pop	ax
 36333 00005701 5F                      	pop	di
 36334                                  $MIF127:	; 08/04/2023
 36335 00005702 C3                      	retn
 36336                                  
 36337                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36338                                  ;;
 36339                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING
 36340                                  ;;
 36341                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will display a string to a specified handle
 36342                                  ;;	INPUTS:    ES:DI points to beginning of message
 36343                                  ;;		   CX contains the number of bytes to write
 36344                                  ;;		   BX contains the handle to write to
 36345                                  ;;	OUPUTS:    None
 36346                                  ;;	REGS USED: AX,DX
 36347                                  ;;
 36348                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 36349                                  
 36350                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 36351                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 36352                                  $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING:
 36353 00005703 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;;AN002;; Set number of bytes written to 0
 36354 00005705 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;;AN002;; For performance, don't write if not necessary
 36355 00005707 74F9                    	jz	short $MIF127
 36356                                  	
 36357 00005709 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 36358 0000570A 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 36359 0000570B 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36360                                  	
 36361 0000570C B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 36362 0000570E 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			;;AN000;; Pointer to data to write
 36363                                  
 36364 00005710 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1 ; $M_SINGLE_CHAR	;;AN000;; Is this a single character?
 36365 00005713 7528                    	jne	short $MIF128		;;AN000;; No
 36366                                  
 36367 00005715 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 36368                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 36369                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to writ
 36370                                  
 36371 00005717 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36372 00005718 50                      	push	ax			;;AN000;;
 36373 00005719 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di] 		;;AN000;; Get the character
 36374 0000571C E85800                  	CALL    $M_IS_IT_DBCS		;;AN000;; Is this the first byte of a DB character
 36375 0000571F 58                      	pop	ax			;;AN000;;
 36376 00005720 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 36377 00005721 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 36378 00005722 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 36379 00005723 7306                    	jnc	short $MIF129
 36380                                  	
 36381 00005725 F8                      	clc				;;AN000;; Clear the DBCS indicator
 36382 00005726 B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 36383 00005728 42                      	inc	dx			;;AN000;; Point to next character
 36384 00005729 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 36385                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 36386                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to write, 
 36387                                  $MIF129:
 36388                                  ;SR;
 36389                                  ; If the single char happened to be a Ctrl-Z, the dos write would return
 36390                                  ;0 chars written making the caller think there was an error writing. To 
 36391                                  ;avoid this, we check if the single char was a Ctrl-Z and if so, return that
 36392                                  ;the char was written, thus fooling the caller.
 36393                                  
 36394 0000572B 9C                      	pushf				;save flags
 36395 0000572C 26803D1A                	cmp	byte [es:di],1Ah	;is char a Ctrl-Z?
 36396 00005730 7502                    	jne	short m_popf_j		;no, continue
 36397                                  
 36398 00005732 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;yes, fake as if it was written
 36399                                  m_popf_j:
 36400                                  	; 08/04/2023
 36401                                  	;$M_POPF  ; macro in 'sysmsg.inc' (MSDOS 6.0)
 36402 00005734 EB01                    	jmp	short m_popf		;restore flags
 36403                                  
 36404                                  ; 07/04/2023
 36405                                  ; ---------------------------
 36406                                  ; MSDOS 6.0, SYSMSG.INC, 1991
 36407                                  ; ---------------------------
 36408                                  	; $M_POPF macro
 36409                                  	;jmp	short $+3
 36410                                  intret:
 36411 00005736 CF                      	iret
 36412                                  m_popf:
 36413 00005737 0E                      	push	cs
 36414 00005738 E8FBFF                  	call	intret
 36415                                  	;;; end macro	
 36416                                  ; ---------------------------
 36417                                  
 36418 0000573B EB18                    	jmp	short $MEN128
 36419                                  
 36420                                  $MIF128:
 36421                                  ;SR;
 36422                                  ; Prescan the string looking for Ctrl-Z. We terminate the message the moment 
 36423                                  ;we hit a Ctrl-Z. cx will contain the number of characters to be printed.
 36424                                  
 36425 0000573D 55                      	push	bp			; M007
 36426 0000573E 51                      	push	cx
 36427 0000573F E8A6FF                  	call	scan_ctrlz		;cx = count without Ctrl-Z
 36428 00005742 89CD                    	mov	bp,cx			;store no ^Z count in bp ;M007
 36429 00005744 59                      	pop	cx			;get old count back ;M007
 36430                                  	
 36431 00005745 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write String at DS:SI to handle
 36432                                  	;jnc	short chk_count		;no error, adjust return count
 36433                                  	;jmp	short m_cnt_ok		;error, return with carry set;M007
 36434                                  	; 08/04/2023
 36435 00005747 720B                    	jc	short m_cnt_ok 
 36436                                  ;M007
 36437                                  ; If we are writing to con and there is a Ctrl-Z in the string, the
 36438                                  ;return count will be much less and if this returns to the caller we can get
 36439                                  ;spurious error messages. We check here if the count returned is same as
 36440                                  ;original count or same as the count if we stop at Ctrl-Z. In the second
 36441                                  ;case, we fake it as if all bytes have been written. If the return count
 36442                                  ;does not match either count, then we had some other disk error (such as
 36443                                  ;insufficient disk space) and we pass it through
 36444                                  
 36445                                  chk_count:
 36446 00005749 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			;have all bytes been written?;M007
 36447 0000574B 7407                    	je	short m_cnt_ok		;there was an error writing ;M007
 36448 0000574D 39C5                    	cmp	bp,ax			;count = Ctrl-Z count? ;M007
 36449 0000574F F8                      	clc				;no error either way ;M007
 36450 00005750 7502                    	jne	short m_cnt_ok		;no, pass it through ;M007
 36451 00005752 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;return old count ;M007
 36452                                  m_cnt_ok:				; M007
 36453 00005754 5D                      	pop	bp			; M007
 36454                                  $MEN128:
 36455 00005755 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;;
 36456                                  ;$MIF127: ; 08/04/2023
 36457 00005756 C3                      	retn

 36687                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_MESSAGE
 36688                                  ;;

 37060                                  ;;
 37061                                  ;;	FUNCTION: Display the contents of the temporary buffer

 37064                                  ;;

 37066                                  ;;
 37067                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37068                                  	
 37069                                  	; 11/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 37902                                  ;;
 37903                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_WAIT_FOR_INPUT
 37904                                  ;;
 37905                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  To accept keyed input and return extended key value
 37906                                  ;;		   in AX register
 37907                                  ;;	INPUTS:    DL contains the DOS function requested for input
 37908                                  ;;	OUTPUTS:   AX contains the extended key value that was read
 37909                                  ;;	REGS USED:
 37910                                  ;;
 37911                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 37912                                  
 37913                                  	; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37914                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6123h
 37915                                  $M_WAIT_FOR_INPUT:
 37916 00005BFB 51                      	push	cx				;;AN000;; Save CX
 37917 00005BFC 52                      	push	dx				;;AN000;; Save DX
 37918 00005BFD 1E                      	push	ds				;;AN000;; Save Data segment
 37919                                  
 37920 00005BFE 80FAC0                  	cmp	dl,0C0h ; DOS_CLR_KEYB_BUF_MASK	;;AN001;; Are we to clear the keyboard buffer?
 37921 00005C01 7608                    	jna	short $MIF388	; jbe		;;AN001;; No,
 37922                                  						;;AN001;; Yes,
 37923 00005C03 88D0                    	mov	al,dl				;;AN001;; Mov function into AL
 37924 00005C05 240F                    	and	al,0Fh	; LOW_NIB_MASK		;;AN001;; Mask out the C in high nibble
 37925 00005C07 B40C                    	mov	ah,0Ch	; DOS_CLR_KEYB_BUF 	;;AN001;; Set input function
 37926 00005C09 EB02                    	jmp	short $MEN388
 37927                                  $MIF388:
 37928 00005C0B 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl				;;AN000;; Put DOS function in AH
 37929                                  $MEN388:
 37930 00005C0D 06                      	push	es				;;AN000;; Get output buffer segment
 37931 00005C0E 1F                      	pop	ds				;;AN000;;
 37932 00005C0F 89FA                    	mov	dx,di				;;AN000;; Get output buffer offset in case needed
 37933 00005C11 CD21                    	int	21h				;;AN000;; Get keyboard input
 37934 00005C13 1F                      	pop	ds				;;AN000;;
 37935 00005C14 80FA0A                  	cmp	dl,0Ah	; DOS_BUF_KEYB_INP	;;AN000;;
 37936                                  	;clc					;;AN000;;
 37937 00005C17 7412                    	je	short $MIF391
 37938 00005C19 E85BFB                  	call	$M_IS_IT_DBCS			;;AN000;; Is this character DBCS?
 37939 00005C1C 730B                    	jnc	short $MIF392
 37940 00005C1E 88C1                    	mov	cl,al				;;AN000;; Save first character
 37941 00005C20 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl				;;AN001;; Get back function
 37942 00005C22 CD21                    	int	21h				;;AN000;; Get keyboard input
 37943 00005C24 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl				;;AN000;; Retreive first character  AX = xxxx
 37944 00005C26 F8                      	clc					;;AN000;; Clear carry condition
 37945 00005C27 EB02                    	jmp	short $MEN392
 37946                                  $MIF392:
 37947 00005C29 B400                    	mov	ah,0				;;AN000;; AX = 00xx where xx is SBCS
 37948                                  $MEN392:
 37949                                  $MIF391:

 37964                                  ; MSDOS 6.0, TPRINTF.ASM, 1991

 37968                                  
 37969                                  ;============================================================================
 37970                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 37971                                  ;============================================================================
 37972                                  ; 15/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 37973                                  
 37974                                  ;****************************************************************************
 37975                                  ;
 37976                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 37977                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 37978                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 37979                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 37980                                  ;
 37981                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 37982                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 37983                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 37984                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 37985                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 37986                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 37987                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 37988                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 37989                                  ; available during the load.
 37990                                  ;
 37991                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 37992                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 37993                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 37994                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 37995                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 37996                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 37997                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 37998                                  ;
 37999                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 38000                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 38001                                  ; the command-line.  The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 38002                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 38003                                  ; UMB.  Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 38004                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load.  Note
 38005                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 38006                                  ;
 38007                                  ;****************************************************************************
 38008                                  
 38009                                  ;___PROCEDURES_______________________________________________________________
 38010                                  ;
 38011                                  ;   AddrToUmb   - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB #
 38012                                  ;   BigFree     - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 38013                                  ;   FixMem      - scans the UM chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 38014                                  ;   FreezeUM    - Marks FROZEN all UM elements now FREE, save those in load UMB
 38015                                  ;   GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 38016                                  ;   GetLoadUMB  - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 38017                                  ;   GetSize     - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 38018                                  ;   GetXNum     - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 38019                                  ;   HideUMBs    - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 38020                                  ;   InitVar     - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 38021                                  ;   NextMCB     - moves an MCB pointer forward to the next MCB
 38022                                  ;   ParseVar    - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 38023                                  ;   PrTable     - produces a printout of the variables in highvar.inc
 38024                                  ;   StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 38025                                  ;   StoLoadUMB  - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 38026                                  ;   UmbHead     - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 38027                                  ;   UnFreeze    - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE
 38028                                  ;
 38029                                  ;___VARIABLES________________________________________________________________
 38030                                  ;
 38031                                  ;   gnradix     - After a call to GetXNum, is 16 or 10, depending on the # read
 38032                                  ;
 38033                                  ;   Internal:
 38034                                  ;___PROCEDURES_______________________________________________________________
 38035                                  ;
 38036                                  ;   convUMB     - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 38037                                  ;   findUMB     - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 38038                                  ;   fm_link     - links UMBs not already linked in
 38039                                  ;   fm_unlink   - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 38040                                  ;   frezMCB     - marks as 8+FROZEN the MCB at ES:0
 38041                                  ;   hideMCB     - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 38042                                  ;   hideUMB     - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 38043                                  ;   hideUMB?    - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 38044                                  ;   hl_unlink   - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0; restores strategy too
 38045                                  ;   incArgc     - increments fm_argc, for use with LH command-line parsing
 38046                                  ;   isEOL       - returns with ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 38047                                  ;   isFreeMCB   - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 38048                                  ;   isFrozMCB   - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FROZEN
 38049                                  ;   isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 38050                                  ;   isSysMCB    - sets ZF iff ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 38051                                  ;   isTiny      - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 38052                                  ;   isWhite     - returns with ZF set iff AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 38053                                  ;   loadLow     - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 38054                                  ;   mul32       - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 38055                                  ;   parseL      - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 38056                                  ;   setUMBs     - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 38057                                  ;   shrinkMCB   - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 38058                                  ;   stowSiz     - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 38059                                  ;   stowUMB     - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 38060                                  ;   toDigit     - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 38061                                  ;   toPara      - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only
 38062                                  ;   toUpper     - accepts one argument (probly a register), and upper-cases it.
 38063                                  ;   unHideMCB   - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 38064                                  ;   unMarkUMB   - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 38065                                  ;
 38066                                  ;****************************************************************************
 38067                                  
 38068                                  ;DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY equ 5800h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 38069                                  ;DOS_SET_STRATEGY   equ 5801h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 38070                                  ;DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK  equ 5802h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 38071                                  ;DOS_SET_UMBLINK    equ 5803h ; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 38072                                  ;DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS  equ   52h ; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 38073                                  ;DOS_UMB_HEAD       equ   8Ch ; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 38074                                  
 38075                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38076                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 38077                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38078                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 38079                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 38080                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 38081                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38082                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38083                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 38084                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 38085                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38086                                  
 38087                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38088                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:615Fh
 38089                                  InitVar:	; proc	near
 38090                                  	;push	ax
 38091                                  	;push	cx
 38092                                  	;push	di
 38093 00005C2E 06                      	push	es ; * es = ds
 38094 00005C2F 8E06[429B]              	mov	es,[RESSEG]		;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 38095 00005C33 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 38096                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 38097                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 38098 00005C35 26A3[3005]              	mov	[es:fInHigh],ax ; 16/06/2023
 38099 00005C39 26A3[3205]              	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 38100 00005C3D 26C606[3405]FF          	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],0FFh ;UNSPECIFIED
 38101                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 38102 00005C43 26A2[3705]              	mov	[es:fm_argc],al		;Start with zero args having been read
 38103                                  
 38104 00005C47 FC                      	cld
 38105                                  
 38106 00005C48 B91000                  	mov	cx,16 ; MAXUMB		;For each entry
 38107 00005C4B BF[5E04]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 38108 00005C4E F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 38109                                  
 38110                                  	;mov	cx,16 ; MAXUMB		;Okay... for each entry
 38111 00005C50 B110                    	mov	cl,16
 38112 00005C52 BF[6E04]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 38113 00005C55 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 38114                                  
 38115 00005C57 07                      	pop	es ; * es = ds
 38116                                  	;pop	di
 38117                                  	;pop	cx
 38118                                  	;pop	ax
 38119 00005C58 C3                       	retn
 38120                                  
 38121                                  ;InitVar endp
 38122                                  
 38123                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38124                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 38125                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38126                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 38127                                  ; EXIT    : None
 38128                                  ; ERROR   : None
 38129                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 38130                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38131                                  
 38132                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38133                                  FixMem:
 38134                                  	;push	ax
 38135                                  	;push	bx
 38136                                  	;push	cx
 38137                                  	;push	dx
 38138 00005C59 06                      	push	es
 38139                                  
 38140 00005C5A E84900                  	call	fm_link			; Link in UMBs
 38141                                  
 38142 00005C5D E82302                  	call	UmbHead			; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 38143 00005C60 723F                    	jc	short fmX		; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 38144                                  
 38145 00005C62 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 38146                                  
 38147                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 38148                                  
 38149 00005C64 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 38150 00005C66 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx			; in CX... and the last owner
 38151 00005C68 42                      	inc	dx			; in dx as we go through the loop:
 38152                                  
 38153                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38154                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 38155                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 38156                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38157                                  
 38158                                  fm10:	
 38159 00005C69 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]	; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 38160                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 38161 00005C6D 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:arena_owner]	; if not zero, do nothing
 38162                                  	;mov	bx,[es:1]
 38163 00005C72 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 38164 00005C74 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 38165                                  
 38166                                  ; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 ---------------------------------
 38167                                  
 38168                                  fm20:	
 38169 00005C76 268B1E0300              	mov	bx,[es:arena_size]	; Grab this block's Size,
 38170                                  	;mov	bx,[es:3]
 38171 00005C7B 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 38172 00005C7D 26A20000                	mov	[es:arena_signature], al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 38173                                  	;mov	[es:0],al
 38174                                  
 38175 00005C81 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:arena_size]	; Size += first MCB's size
 38176                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 38177 00005C86 43                      	inc	bx
 38178 00005C87 26891E0300              	mov	[es:arena_size],bx	; Write the size
 38179                                  
 38180                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 38181                                  fm30:	
 38182 00005C8C 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 38183 00005C8E 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:arena_owner]	; And remember its owner
 38184                                  	;mov	dx,[es:1]
 38185                                  
 38186                                  	;NextMCB es,bx			; Move to the next MCB
 38187                                  	
 38188 00005C93 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 38189                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 38190 00005C95 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:arena_size]
 38191 00005C9A 43                      	inc	bx
 38192 00005C9B 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 38193                                  
 38194                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'	; cmp al,5Ah
 38195 00005C9D 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 38196 00005C9F 75C8                    	jnz	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 38197                                  fmX:	
 38198 00005CA1 E81900                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 38199                                  
 38200 00005CA4 07                      	pop	es
 38201                                  	;pop	dx
 38202                                  	;pop	cx
 38203                                  	;pop	bx
 38204                                  	;pop	ax
 38205 00005CA5 C3                      	retn
 38206                                  
 38207                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38208                                  ; 16/06/2023
 38209                                  
 38210                                  ;INT 21h - DOS 5+ - GET OR SET UMB LINK STATE
 38211                                  ; .......................................................
 38212                                  ;     AH = 58h
 38213                                  ;     AL = subfunction
 38214                                  ;	02h get UMB link state
 38215                                  ;	    Return:
 38216                                  ;		AL = current link state
 38217                                  ;		  00h - UMBs not part of DOS memory chain
 38218                                  ;		  01h - UMBs in DOS memory chain
 38219                                  ;	03h set UMB link state
 38220                                  ;	    BX = new link state
 38221                                  ;		0000h - remove UMBs from DOS memory chain
 38222                                  ;		0001h - add UMBs to DOS memory chain
 38223                                  ;
 38224                                  ;Return: CF clear if successful
 38225                                  ;	CF set on error
 38226                                  ;	AX = error code (01h) (see #01680)
 38227                                  ; .......................................................
 38228                                  
 38229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38230                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 38231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38232                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 38233                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 38234                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38235                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 38236                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38237                                  
 38238                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38239                                  fm_link:
 38240 00005CA6 B80258                  	mov	ax,5802h ; DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK
 38241 00005CA9 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 38242                                  
 38243                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 38244                                  
 38245                                  	;push	es
 38246                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38247                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 38248                                  	;pop	es
 38249 00005CAB 1E                      	push	ds
 38250 00005CAC 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38251 00005CB0 A2[3505]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 38252 00005CB3 1F                      	pop	ds
 38253                                  
 38254 00005CB4 B80358                  	mov	ax,5803h ; DOS_SET_UMBLINK
 38255 00005CB7 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 38256 00005CBA CD21                    	int	21h
 38257 00005CBC C3                      	retn
 38258                                  
 38259                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38260                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 38261                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38262                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 38263                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38264                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38265                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 38266                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38267                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38268                                  fm_unlink:
 38269 00005CBD 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 38270                                  	
 38271                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 38272                                  
 38273 00005CBF 1E                      	push    ds
 38274 00005CC0 8E1E[429B]              	mov     ds,[RESSEG]
 38275 00005CC4 8A1E[3505]              	mov     bl,[fm_umb]
 38276 00005CC8 1F                      	pop     ds
 38277                                  	
 38278 00005CC9 B80358                  	mov	ax,5803h ; DOS_SET_UMBLINK
 38279 00005CCC CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 38280 00005CCE C3                      	retn
 38281                                  
 38282                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38283                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 38284                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 38285                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38286                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 38287                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 38288                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 38289                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38290                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38291                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 38292                                  ;
 38293                                  
 38294                                  ;PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 38295                                  ;PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 38296                                  ;PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 38297                                  
 38298                                  ;
 38299                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 38300                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 38301                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 38302                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 38303                                  ;
 38304                                  
 38305                                  ;optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 38306                                  ;optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 38307                                  
 38308                                  ;
 38309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38310                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 38311                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 38312                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 38313                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 38314                                  ;     lh
 38315                                  ;     /l
 38316                                  ;     1
 38317                                  ;     1000
 38318                                  ;     2
 38319                                  ;     print
 38320                                  ;     /d
 38321                                  ;     :lpt2
 38322                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 38323                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 38324                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 38325                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 38326                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 38327                                  ; for:
 38328                                  ;    Each /L
 38329                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 38330                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 38331                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 38332                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 38333                                  ; "print". Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 38334                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38335                                  
 38336                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38337                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6216h
 38338                                  ParseVar:	; proc	near
 38339                                  	;push	di
 38340                                  	;push	ds ; *
 38341                                  	;push	es
 38342                                  	;
 38343                                  	; 16/06/2023
 38344                                  	; es = ds (from 'ParseLhCmd')
 38345                                  	;push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 38346                                  	;pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 38347                                  	
 38348 00005CCF FC                      	cld
 38349                                  
 38350                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 38351                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 38352                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 38353                                  
 38354                                  pv10:	
 38355 00005CD0 AC                      	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 38356 00005CD1 E8A800                  	call	isWhite
 38357 00005CD4 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 38358 00005CD6 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH
 38359 00005CD8 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 38360                                  
 38361 00005CDA 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 38362 00005CDB F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 38363 00005CDC EB2C                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 38364                                  pv20:
 38365 00005CDE AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 38366                                  
 38367                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 38368 00005CDF 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 38369                                  
 38370 00005CE1 3C53                    	cmp	al,'S' ; optS	; just read 'S'?
 38371 00005CE3 7510                    	jne	short pv30
 38372                                  
 38373 00005CE5 E87E00                  	call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 38374                                  
 38375                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 38376                                  
 38377                                  	;push	es
 38378                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38379                                  	;mov	byte [es:fUmbTiny],1
 38380                                  	;pop	es
 38381 00005CE8 1E                      	push	ds
 38382 00005CE9 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38383 00005CED C606[3105]01            	mov	byte [fUmbTiny],1
 38384 00005CF2 1F                      	pop	ds
 38385                                  
 38386 00005CF3 EBDB                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 38387                                  pv30:	
 38388 00005CF5 3C4C                    	cmp	al,'L' ; optL	; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 38389 00005CF7 750B                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 38390                                  
 38391 00005CF9 E86A00                  	call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 38392                                  
 38393 00005CFC E80C00                  	call	parseL
 38394 00005CFF 73CF                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 38395                                  
 38396 00005D01 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 38397 00005D02 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 38398                                  pvE1:	
 38399 00005D04 B80300                  	mov	ax,3 ; PV_InvSwt
 38400                                  				; Unrecognized switch passed
 38401                                  pvErr:
 38402 00005D07 4E                      	dec	si
 38403 00005D08 4E                      	dec	si
 38404 00005D09 F9                      	stc
 38405                                  pvX:	
 38406                                  	;pop	es
 38407                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 38408                                  	;pop	di
 38409 00005D0A C3                      	retn
 38410                                  
 38411                                  ;ParseVar endp
 38412                                  
 38413                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38414                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 38415                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38416                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 38417                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 38418                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 38419                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 38420                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38421                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 38422                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 38423                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 38424                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 38425                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38426                                  
 38427                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38428                                  parseL:
 38429 00005D0B AC                      	lodsb
 38430 00005D0C 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 38431 00005D0E 754A                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 38432                                  
 38433                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38434                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 38435                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 38436                                  
 38437                                  pl10:
 38438 00005D10 E8FD00                  	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 38439 00005D13 724B                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 38440 00005D15 E8C801                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 38441                                  
 38442 00005D18 88C1                    	mov	cl,al	; !*	; Remember the UMB number
 38443 00005D1A E88300                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 38444 00005D1D 7241                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 38445                                  
 38446 00005D1F E84400                  	call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 38447                                  
 38448 00005D22 AC                      	lodsb
 38449 00005D23 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 38450 00005D25 74E9                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 38451                                  
 38452 00005D27 E85200                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 38453 00005D2A 7439                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 38454                                  
 38455 00005D2C E84200                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 38456 00005D2F 7433                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 38457                                  
 38458 00005D31 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 38459 00005D33 742F                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 38460                                  
 38461 00005D35 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 38462 00005D37 7521                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 38463                                  
 38464                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 38465                                  
 38466 00005D39 E8D400                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 38467 00005D3C 721C                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 38468                                  
 38469 00005D3E E83401                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 38470                                  
 38471 00005D41 E88600                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 38472                                  
 38473 00005D44 E81F00                  	call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 38474                                  
 38475 00005D47 AC                      	lodsb
 38476 00005D48 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 38477 00005D4A 74C4                    	je	short pl10		;
 38478                                  
 38479 00005D4C E82D00                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 38480 00005D4F 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 38481                                  
 38482 00005D51 E81D00                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 38483 00005D54 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 38484                                  
 38485 00005D56 3C2F                    	cmp	al,'/' ; SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 38486 00005D58 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 38487                                  plE1:	
 38488 00005D5A B80100                  	mov	ax,1 ; PV_InvArg
 38489                                  				; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 38490 00005D5D 4E                      	dec	si
 38491 00005D5E F9                      	stc
 38492 00005D5F C3                      	retn
 38493                                  plE2:
 38494                                  	; cf = 1 
 38495 00005D60 B80200                  	mov	ax,2 ; PV_BadUMB
 38496                                  				; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 38497                                  	;stc
 38498 00005D63 C3                      	retn
 38499                                  plSwX:
 38500 00005D64 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 38501                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 38502                                  plX:
 38503                                  	; cf = 0
 38504                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 38505 00005D65 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 38506                                  
 38507                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38508                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 38509                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38510                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 38511                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38512                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38513                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 38514                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38515                                  
 38516                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38517                                  incArgc:
 38518                                  	;push	ax
 38519                                  
 38520                                  	;;getdata al,fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 38521                                  	;
 38522                                  	;push	ds		; getdata (macro)
 38523                                  	;			; getdata al, fm_argc
 38524                                  	;mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38525                                  	;mov	al,[fm_argc]	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 38526                                  	;pop	ds
 38527                                  	;
 38528                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 38529                                  	;
 38530                                  	;;putdata fm_argc,al	; And store it right back.
 38531                                  	;
 38532                                  	;push	es		; putdata (macro)
 38533                                  	;			; putdata fm_argc, al
 38534                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38535                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc],al	; and store it right back.
 38536                                  	;pop	es
 38537                                  
 38538                                  	; 16/06/2023
 38539 00005D66 1E                      	push	ds
 38540 00005D67 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38541 00005D6B FE06[3705]              	inc	byte [fm_argc]	; increment fm_argc
 38542 00005D6F 1F                      	pop	ds
 38543                                  
 38544                                  	;pop	ax
 38545 00005D70 C3                      	retn
 38546                                  
 38547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38548                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 38549                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38550                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 38551                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 38552                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38553                                  ; USES:     ZF
 38554                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38555                                  
 38556                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38557                                  isEOL:
 38558                                  	;cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 38559 00005D71 20C0                    	and	al,al
 38560 00005D73 7406                    	jz	short ieX
 38561 00005D75 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh ; CR	; Carriage Return
 38562 00005D77 7402                    	je	short ieX
 38563 00005D79 3C0A                    	cmp	al,0Ah ; LF	; LineFeed
 38564                                  ieX:
 38565 00005D7B C3                      	retn
 38566                                  
 38567                                  
 38568                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38569                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set iff AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 38570                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38571                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 38572                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains space, tab, or equals
 38573                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38574                                  ; USES:     ZF
 38575                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38576                                  
 38577                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38578                                  isWhite:
 38579 00005D7C 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 38580 00005D7E 7406                    	je	short iwX
 38581 00005D80 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 38582 00005D82 7402                    	je	short iwX
 38583 00005D84 3C09                    	cmp	al,09h ; TAB	; Tab
 38584                                  iwX:
 38585 00005D86 C3                      	retn
 38586                                  
 38587                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38588                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 38589                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38590                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 38591                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38592                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38593                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38594                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38595                                  
 38596                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38597                                  unMarkUMB:
 38598                                  	;;pushreg <ax,bx,di,es>
 38599                                  	;push	ax ; ***
 38600                                  	
 38601                                  	;push	bx ; **
 38602                                  	
 38603                                  	;push	di
 38604                                  	;push	es
 38605 00005D87 1E                      	push	ds ; *	
 38606                                  
 38607                                  	;;dataseg es
 38608                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38609                                  
 38610 00005D88 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG] ; *
 38611                                  	
 38612                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0
 38613                                  	;mov	bx,ax
 38614                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 38615                                  	;mov	[bx+UmbUsed],ah ; marks the UMB as unused
 38616 00005D8C 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 38617 00005D8E 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh ; 0	
 38618 00005D90 88BF[5E04]              	mov	[bx+UmbUsed],bh ; 0 ; **
 38619                                  
 38620                                  	;cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 38621                                  	;jnz	short umu10
 38622 00005D94 3806[3405]              	cmp	[UmbLoad],al
 38623 00005D98 7504                    	jne	short umu10
 38624                                  
 38625                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],0
 38626                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],ah	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 38627 00005D9A 883E[3405]              	mov	[UmbLoad],bh ; 0 ; **
 38628                                  umu10:	
 38629 00005D9E 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 38630                                  	;;popreg <es,di,bx,ax>
 38631                                  	;pop	es
 38632                                  	;pop	di
 38633                                  	
 38634                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 38635                                  	
 38636                                  	;pop	ax ; ***
 38637                                  
 38638                                  	;;normseg es
 38639                                  	
 38640 00005D9F C3                      	retn
 38641                                  
 38642                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38643                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 38644                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 38645                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain.  If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 38646                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 38647                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38648                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 38649                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38650                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 38651                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38652                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38653                                  
 38654                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38655                                  stowUMB:
 38656 00005DA0 3C10                    	cmp	al,16 ; MAXUMB
 38657 00005DA2 7202                    	jb	short su10
 38658 00005DA4 F9                      	stc
 38659 00005DA5 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 38660                                  su10:
 38661                                  	;pushreg <bx,di,si,ds,es>
 38662                                  	;dataseg es		; Point ES into appropriate data segment
 38663                                  	;dataseg ds		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 38664                                  
 38665                                  	;push	bx ; **
 38666                                  	
 38667                                  	;push	di
 38668                                  	;push	si
 38669                                  
 38670 00005DA6 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 38671                                  
 38672                                  	;push	es
 38673                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38674 00005DA7 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38675                                  
 38676 00005DAB 803E[3405]FF            	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh ; UNSPECIFIED
 38677                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
