 38678 00005DB0 7503                    	jne	short su20
 38679 00005DB2 A2[3405]                	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 38680                                  su20:	
 38681 00005DB5 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 38682 00005DB7 740F                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 38683                                  
 38684                                  	;mov	bl,al
 38685                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 38686                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 38687 00005DB9 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 38688 00005DBB 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 38689 00005DBD B001                    	mov	al,1
 38690                                  
 38691                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 38692 00005DBF 8687[5E04]              	xchg	[bx+UmbUsed],al
 38693                                  
 38694 00005DC3 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 38695 00005DC5 7401                    	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 38696                                  
 38697 00005DC7 F9                      	stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 38698                                  su30:	
 38699                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,si,di,bx>
 38700                                  	;normseg ds
 38701                                  	;normseg es
 38702                                  	;retn
 38703                                  
 38704                                  	;pop	es
 38705                                  	
 38706 00005DC8 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 38707                                  	
 38708                                  	;pop	si
 38709                                  	;pop	di
 38710                                  	
 38711                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 38712                                  
 38713 00005DC9 C3                      	retn
 38714                                  
 38715                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38716                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 38717                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38718                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 38719                                  ; EXIT:     None
 38720                                  ; ERROR:    None
 38721                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 38722                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38723                                  	
 38724                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38725                                  stowSiz:
 38726                                  	;pushreg <bx,di,es>
 38727                                  	;dataseg es		; Point ES into appropriate data seg
 38728                                  
 38729                                  	;push	bx ; **
 38730                                  	
 38731                                  	;push	di
 38732                                  	;push	es
 38733                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 38734 00005DCA 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 38735 00005DCB 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 38736                                  
 38737 00005DCF 88CB                    	mov	bl,cl		; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 38738 00005DD1 B700                    	mov	bh,0		;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 38739 00005DD3 D0E3                    	shl	bl,1		;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 38740                                  	;mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax
 38741 00005DD5 8987[6E04]              	mov	[bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 38742                                  
 38743 00005DD9 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 38744                                  
 38745                                  	;popreg	<es,di,bx>
 38746                                  	;normseg es		; Return ES to where it was
 38747                                  
 38748                                  	;pop	es
 38749                                  	;pop	di
 38750                                  	
 38751                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 38752                                  
 38753 00005DDA C3                      	retn
 38754                                  
 38755                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38756                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 38757                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 38758                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).  A-F
 38759                                  ; are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 38760                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38761                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 38762                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 38763                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 38764                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 38765                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38766                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 38767                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 38768                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 38769                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38770                                  
 38771                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38772                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6358h
 38773                                  gnradix:
 38774 00005DDB 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 38775                                  
 38776                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38777                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:635Ah
 38778                                  toDigit:
 38779                                  	;cmp	word [gnradix],16
 38780 00005DDD 803E[DB5D]10            	cmp	byte [gnradix],16
 38781 00005DE2 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 38782                                  
 38783 00005DE4 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'
 38784 00005DE7 7209                    	jb	short td10
 38785 00005DE9 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'
 38786 00005DEC 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 38787 00005DEE 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 38788                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 38789 00005DF1 C3                      	retn
 38790                                  td10:
 38791 00005DF2 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'
 38792 00005DF5 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 38793 00005DF7 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'
 38794 00005DFA 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 38795 00005DFC 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 38796                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 38797                                  tdErr:
 38798 00005DFF C3                      	retn
 38799                                  td20:
 38800 00005E00 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 38801                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 38802 00005E03 72FA                    	jb	short tdErr ; cf = 1
 38803 00005E05 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 38804 00005E08 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 38805 00005E0A 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	  ; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 38806                                  ;	clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 38807 00005E0D C3                      	retn
 38808                                  tdE:
 38809 00005E0E F9                      	stc
 38810 00005E0F C3                      	retn
 38811                                  
 38812                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38813                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 38814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38815                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 38816                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 38817                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 38818                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 38819                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38820                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 38821                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 38822                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 38823                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38824                                  
 38825                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38826                                  GetXNum:
 38827                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,ds>
 38828                                  	
 38829                                  	;push	bx ; **
 38830 00005E10 51                      	push	cx ; *
 38831                                  	
 38832                                  	;push	ds
 38833                                  
 38834 00005E11 FC                      	cld
 38835 00005E12 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 38836 00005E14 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 38837 00005E16 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 38838 00005E18 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 38839                                  
 38840                                  	;mov	word [gnradix],10 ; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 38841 00005E1A C606[DB5D]0A            	mov	byte [gnradix],10
 38842                                  
 38843 00005E1F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 38844 00005E22 E8B8FF                  	call	toDigit
 38845 00005E25 722D                    	jc	short gxnE	; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 38846                                  
 38847 00005E27 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 38848 00005E29 7515                    	jnz	short gxn20	; Doesn't have '0x'
 38849 00005E2B 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 38850 00005E2F 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'		; Either 'x'...
 38851 00005E32 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 38852 00005E34 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'		; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 38853 00005E37 7507                    	jne	short gxn20
 38854                                  
 38855                                  gxn10:
 38856                                  	;mov	word [gnradix],16
 38857 00005E39 C606[DB5D]10            	mov	byte [gnradix],16
 38858 00005E3E 46                      	inc	si		; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 38859 00005E3F 46                      	inc	si
 38860                                  
 38861                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 38862                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 38863                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 38864                                  ;        BX    = 0
 38865                                  ;        CH    = 0
 38866                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 38867                                  
 38868                                  gxn20:
 38869 00005E40 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 38870 00005E43 46                      	inc	si
 38871                                  
 38872 00005E44 E896FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 38873 00005E47 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 38874                                  
 38875 00005E49 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 38876 00005E4C 7206                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 38877                                  
 38878 00005E4E 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 38879 00005E50 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 38880                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 38881                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 38882 00005E52 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 38883                                  gxnE:
 38884                                  	; cf = 1
 38885                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 38886                                  	;jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 38887                                  ;gxnQ:
 38888                                  	;dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 38889                                  	;clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 38890                                  gxnX:
 38891                                  	;popreg	<ds,cx,bx>
 38892                                  
 38893                                  	;pop	ds
 38894                                  
 38895 00005E54 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 38896                                  	;pop	bx ; **
 38897                                  
 38898 00005E55 C3                      	retn
 38899                                  gxnQ:
 38900 00005E56 4E                      	dec	si
 38901 00005E57 F8                      	clc
 38902 00005E58 EBFA                    	jmp	short gxnX
 38903                                  
 38904                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38905                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 38906                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38907                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 38908                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 38909                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 38910                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 38911                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38912                                  
 38913                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38914                                  mul32:
 38915 00005E5A 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 38916 00005E5B 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 38917 00005E5D F726[DB5D]              	mul	word [gnradix]	; DX=?,      AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 38918 00005E61 7210                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 38919                                  
 38920 00005E63 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 38921 00005E65 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=0
 38922                                  
 38923 00005E66 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0,      AX=old:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=new:hi
 38924 00005E68 F726[DB5D]              	mul	word [gnradix]	; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=new:hi
 38925 00005E6C 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=carry
 38926 00005E6E 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=carry
 38927 00005E70 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig,   BX=0
 38928 00005E72 C3                      	retn
 38929                                  m32E:
 38930 00005E73 58                      	pop	ax
 38931 00005E74 C3                      	retn
 38932                                  
 38933                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38934                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 38935                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38936                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 38937                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 38938                                  ; ERROR:   None
 38939                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 38940                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38941                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 38942                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 38943                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38944                                  
 38945                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38946                                  toPara:
 38947 00005E75 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 38948                                  
 38949 00005E76 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 38950 00005E78 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 38951 00005E7A 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 38952 00005E7B B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 38953 00005E7D D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 38954 00005E7F 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 38955                                  
 38956 00005E81 59                      	pop	cx
 38957 00005E82 C3                      	retn
 38958                                  
 38959                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38960                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 38961                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38962                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 38963                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 38964                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 38965                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 38966                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38967                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 38968                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around.  In this event, the pointer
 38969                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around.  On most
 38970                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 38971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38972                                  
 38973                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 38974                                  UmbHead:
 38975                                  	;pushreg <si,ds,es>
 38976                                  	
 38977                                  	;push	si
 38978                                  	;push	ds
 38979                                  	;push	es
 38980                                  
 38981 00005E83 B452                    	mov	ah,52h	; DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS
 38982                                  					; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 38983 00005E85 CD21                    	int	21h
 38984                                  			; DOS - 2+ internal - GET LIST OF LISTS
 38985                                  			; Return: ES:BX -> DOS list of lists
 38986                                  
 38987                                  	;mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 38988 00005E87 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:8Ch]
 38989 00005E8B 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 38990                                  	;je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 38991                                  
 38992                                  	;clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 38993                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 38994                                  	; 17/06/2023
 38995 00005E8E F5                      	cmc	; cf = 0 <--> cf = 1
 38996                                  uhE:
 38997                                  	;stc
 38998                                  uhX:	
 38999                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,si>
 39000                                  	
 39001                                  	;pop	es
 39002                                  	;pop	ds
 39003                                  	;pop	si
 39004                                  
 39005 00005E8F C3                      	retn
 39006                                  
 39007                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39008                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF iff ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 39009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39010                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 39011                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 39012                                  ; USES:   Flags
 39013                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39014                                  
 39015                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39016                                  isSysMCB:
 39017                                  	;push	ax
 39018                                  	
 39019                                  	;mov	ax,[es:1]
 39020 00005E90 26A10100                	mov	ax,[es:arena_owner]	; Check the owner...
 39021 00005E94 83F808                  	cmp	ax,8 ; SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 39022 00005E97 7405                    	jz	short ism10
 39023 00005E99 83F809                  	cmp	ax,9 ; JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 39024                                  	;jz	short ism10
 39025                                  	;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 39026 00005E9C 7507                    	jnz	short ismX
 39027                                  ism10:
 39028                                  	;mov	ax,[es:8]
 39029 00005E9E 26A10800                	mov	ax,[es:arena_name]	; Check the name...
 39030 00005EA2 3D5343                  	cmp	ax,'SC' ; cmp ax,4353h
 39031                                  ismX:
 39032                                  	;pop	ax
 39033 00005EA5 C3                      	retn
 39034                                  
 39035                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39036                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 39037                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39038                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 39039                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 39040                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 39041                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39042                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39043                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 39044                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 39045                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 39046                                  ;      ...
 39047                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 39048                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39049                                  
 39050                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39051                                  AddrToUmb:
 39052                                  	;pushreg <cx,dx,es>
 39053                                  	
 39054                                  	;push	cx
 39055                                  	;push	dx
 39056 00005EA6 06                      	push	es
 39057                                  
 39058 00005EA7 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 39059                                  
 39060 00005EA9 E8D7FF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 39061 00005EAC 722B                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 39062                                  
 39063                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 39064 00005EAE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 39065                                  
 39066                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 39067                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 39068                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 39069                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 39070                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 39071                                  
 39072                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39073                                  atu10:
 39074 00005EB0 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 39075                                  ;atu10:
 39076                                  	;mov	ax,es
 39077 00005EB2 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 39078 00005EB4 7326                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 39079                                  
 39080 00005EB6 E8D7FF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 39081 00005EB9 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 39082                                  
 39083 00005EBB 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 39084                                  atu20:
 39085                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39086 00005EBC 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39087                                  	;cmp	al,'Z' ; 5Ah
 39088 00005EC0 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39089 00005EC2 740A                    	je	short atu30	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 39090                                  
 39091                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 39092 00005EC4 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39093                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]	; NextMCB (macro)
 39094 00005EC6 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39095 00005ECB 40                      	inc	ax
 39096                                  	;mov	es,ax ; * ; 17/06/2023
 39097 00005ECC EBE2                    	jmp	short atu10
 39098                                  
 39099                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39100                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 39101                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 39102                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39103                                  
 39104                                  atu30:
 39105 00005ECE 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39106                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 39107 00005ED0 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39108 00005ED5 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 39109 00005ED7 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 39110                                  atuE:
 39111 00005ED9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 39112 00005EDB 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 39113                                  atuX:	
 39114 00005EDC 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 39115                                  	
 39116                                  	;popreg	<es,dx,cx>
 39117                                  
 39118 00005EDE 07                      	pop	es
 39119                                  	;pop	dx
 39120                                  	;pop	cx
 39121                                  	
 39122 00005EDF C3                      	retn
 39123                                  
 39124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39125                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 39126                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 39127                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 39128                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 39129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39130                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 39131                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 39132                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39133                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39135                                  
 39136                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39137                                  convUMB:
 39138                                  	;cmp	word [gnradix],16
 39139 00005EE0 803E[DB5D]10            	cmp	byte [gnradix],16
 39140 00005EE5 7509                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 39141 00005EE7 E8BCFF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 39142 00005EEA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 39143 00005EED 7501                    	jne	short cu10
 39144 00005EEF 40                      	inc	ax ; ax = 0	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 39145                                  cu10:
 39146 00005EF0 C3                      	retn
 39147                                  
 39148                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39149                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 39150                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 39151                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 39152                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39153                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39154                                  ; EXIT:   None
 39155                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39156                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 39157                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39158                                  
 39159                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39160                                  setUMBs:
 39161                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx>
 39162                                  	
 39163                                  	;push	ax
 39164                                  	;push	bx
 39165                                  
 39166 00005EF1 E8B2FD                  	call	fm_link
 39167                                  
 39168 00005EF4 B80058                  	mov	ax,5800h ; DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY
 39169 00005EF7 CD21                    	int	21h
 39170                                  
 39171                                  	;putdata fm_strat,al	; Store the current strategy for later restore
 39172                                  
 39173                                  	;push	es
 39174                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39175                                  	;mov	[es:fm_strat],al ; store the current strategy
 39176                                  	;pop	es
 39177 00005EF9 1E                      	push	ds ; *
 39178 00005EFA 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39179 00005EFE A2[3605]                	mov	[fm_strat],al
 39180                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 39181                                  
 39182 00005F01 83E07F                  	and	ax,007Fh	; 0000.0000.0111.1111 == All that other stuff
 39183 00005F04 50                      	push	ax ; **		; Watch this carefully...
 39184                                  
 39185 00005F05 E80C00                  	call	loadLow		; returns al==0 if load low, al==1 if loadhigh
 39186 00005F08 D0C8                    	ror	al,1		; Shift that to al==0 or al==0x80
 39187                                  
 39188 00005F0A 5B                      	pop	bx ; **		; ...pushed as AX above
 39189                                  	
 39190 00005F0B 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
 39191                                  	
 39192 00005F0C 08C3                    	or	bl,al		; Now we have 0000.0000.?111.1111 in BX;
 39193                                  
 39194 00005F0E B80158                  	mov	ax,5801h ; DOS_SET_STRATEGY
 39195                                  				; with ? ==1 if load highfirst. Perfect!
 39196 00005F11 CD21                    	int	21h
 39197                                  
 39198                                  	;popreg	<bx,ax>
 39199                                  
 39200                                  	;pop	bx
 39201                                  	;pop	ax
 39202                                  
 39203 00005F13 C3                      	retn
 39204                                  
 39205                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39206                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 39207                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39208                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39209                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 39210                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 39211                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39212                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 39213                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39214                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 39215                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 39216                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 39217                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 39218                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39219                                  
 39220                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39221                                  loadLow:
 39222                                  	;push	ds ; *	
 39223                                  	
 39224                                  	;dataseg ds		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 39225                                  	;mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39226                                  
 39227                                  	; * ; ds = [RESSEG] from 'setUMBs') ; 17/06/2023
 39228                                  
 39229 00005F14 A0[3405]                	mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 39230 00005F17 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh ; UNSPECIFIED
 39231 00005F19 7503                    	jne	short ll10
 39232                                  
 39233                                  	;mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 39234 00005F1B F9                      	stc
 39235                                  	;jmp	short llX
 39236 00005F1C EB04                    	jmp	short lly ; 17/06/2023
 39237                                  ll10:
 39238 00005F1E 08C0                    	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 39239 00005F20 7402                    	jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 39240                                  	; cf= 0
 39241                                  
 39242                                  	;mov	al,1
 39243                                  	;clc	
 39244                                  lly:		; 17/06/2023
 39245 00005F22 B001                    	mov	al,1
 39246                                  llX:
 39247                                  	;pop	ds ; *		; Return DS to where it was
 39248                                  	
 39249                                  	;normseg ds		;
 39250                                  	
 39251 00005F24 C3                      	retn
 39252                                  
 39253                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39254                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 39255                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39256                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39257                                  ; EXIT:   None
 39258                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39259                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 39260                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39261                                  
 39262                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39263                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:64D0h
 39264                                  HideUMBs:
 39265                                  	;pushreg <ax,cx,ds,es>
 39266                                  	
 39267                                  	;push	ax
 39268                                  	;push	cx
 39269                                  	;push	ds
 39270                                  	;push	es
 39271                                  
 39272 00005F25 E8EF01                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 39273 00005F28 7236                    	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 39274                                  
 39275 00005F2A E82CFD                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 39276 00005F2D E8C1FF                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 39277                                  
 39278                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 39279                                  	;push	es
 39280                                  	;mov	es,[RESSEG]
 39281                                  	;mov	byte [es:fInHigh], 1
 39282                                  	;			; remember that we're now running high
 39283                                  	;pop	es
 39284 00005F30 1E                      	push	ds
 39285 00005F31 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39286 00005F35 C606[3005]01            	mov	byte [fInHigh], 1
 39287 00005F3A 1F                      	pop	ds
 39288                                  
 39289 00005F3B E82300                  	call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 39290 00005F3E 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh	; UNSPECIFIED
 39291                                  				; If they didn't,
 39292 00005F40 741E                    	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 39293                                  
 39294 00005F42 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 39295                                  
 39296                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 39297                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 39298                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 39299                                  
 39300                                  hus10:
 39301 00005F44 41                      	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 39302 00005F45 83F910                  	cmp	cx,16 ; MAXUMB
 39303 00005F48 730C                    	jae	short hus20
 39304                                  
 39305 00005F4A 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 39306                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39307                                  	;push	es
 39308 00005F4C E8A900                  	call	findumb		; valid range of UMBs)
 39309                                  	;pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 39310 00005F4F 7205                    	jc	short hus20
 39311                                  
 39312 00005F51 E87901                  	call	hideUMB?	; hide what we need to hide.
 39313                                  
 39314 00005F54 EBEE                    	jmp	short hus10
 39315                                  hus20:
 39316 00005F56 E80800                  	call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 39317 00005F59 08C0                    	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 39318 00005F5B 7503                    	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 39319                                  
 39320 00005F5D E8E701                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 39321                                  husX:
 39322                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,cx,ax>
 39323                                  	
 39324                                  	;pop	es
 39325                                  	;pop	ds
 39326                                  	;pop	cx
 39327                                  	;pop	ax
 39328                                  
 39329 00005F60 C3                      	retn
 39330                                  
 39331                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39332                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 39333                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39334                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 39335                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 39336                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39337                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39338                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39339                                  
 39340                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39341                                  GetLoadUMB:
 39342                                  	;getdata al,UmbLoad
 39343                                  
 39344 00005F61 1E                      	push    ds
 39345 00005F62 8E1E[429B]              	mov     ds,[RESSEG]   ; getdata (macro)
 39346 00005F66 A0[3405]                	mov     al,[UmbLoad]
 39347 00005F69 1F                      	pop     ds
 39348                                  
 39349 00005F6A C3                      	retn
 39350                                  
 39351                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39352                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 39353                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39354                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 39355                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 39356                                  ; ERROR:  None
 39357                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 39358                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39359                                  
 39360                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39361                                  GetSize:
 39362                                  	;pushreg <bx,si,ds>
 39363                                  	;push	bx
 39364                                  	;push	si
 39365 00005F6B 1E                      	push	ds
 39366                                  	
 39367                                  	;dataseg ds
 39368 00005F6C 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39369                                  
 39370 00005F70 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 39371                                  	;mov	bx,offset UmbSize
 39372 00005F72 BB[6E04]                	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 39373 00005F75 D0E0                    	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 39374                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 39375                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 39376                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 39377 00005F77 01C3                    	add	bx,ax
 39378 00005F79 8B07                    	mov	ax,[bx]
 39379                                  
 39380                                  	;popreg	<ds,si,bx>
 39381 00005F7B 1F                      	pop	ds
 39382                                  	;pop	si
 39383                                  	;pop	bx
 39384                                  
 39385                                  	;normseg ds
 39386 00005F7C C3                      	retn
 39387                                  
 39388                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39389                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 39390                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39391                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 39392                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 39393                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39394                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39395                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39396                                  
 39397                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39398                                  hideUMB:
 39399                                  	;pushreg <ax,es>
 39400                                  	
 39401                                  	;push	ax
 39402                                  	;push	es
 39403                                  
 39404 00005F7D E87800                  	call	findumb		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 39405 00005F80 7221                    	jc	short huX
 39406                                  
 39407                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 39408                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 39409                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 39410                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 39411                                  
 39412                                  hu10:
 39413 00005F82 E80BFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 39414 00005F85 741C                    	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 39415 00005F87 E82800                  	call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 39416 00005F8A 7503                    	jnz	short hu20
 39417                                  
 39418 00005F8C E82A00                  	call	hideMCB
 39419                                  hu20:
 39420                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39421 00005F8F 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39422                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 39423 00005F93 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39424 00005F95 740C                    	je	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 39425                                  
 39426                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 39427                                  
 39428 00005F97 8CC0                     	mov	ax,es		; NextMCB (macro)
 39429                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 39430 00005F99 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39431 00005F9E 40                      	inc	ax
 39432 00005F9F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39433                                  
 39434 00005FA1 EBDF                    	jmp	short hu10
 39435                                  huX:
 39436                                  	;popreg	<es,ax>
 39437                                  	
 39438                                  	;pop	es
 39439                                  	;pop	ax
 39440                                  
 39441 00005FA3 C3                      	retn
 39442                                  
 39443                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39444                                  ;*** isTiny - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 39445                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39446                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 39447                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if user DIDN'T specify /S
 39448                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39449                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39450                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39451                                  
 39452                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39453                                  isTiny:

 39455

 39458 00005FA6 8E1E[429B]              	mov     ds,[RESSEG]   ; getdata (macro)
 39459 00005FAA A0[3105]                	mov     al,[fUmbTiny]
 39460 00005FAD 1F                      	pop     ds
 39461                                  
 39462 00005FAE 08C0                    	or	al,al
 39463 00005FB0 58                      	pop	ax
 39464 00005FB1 C3                      	retn
 39465                                  
 39466                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39467                                  ;*** isFreeMCB - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 39468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39469                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 39470                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is free, else !ZF
 39471                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39472                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39473                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39474                                  
 39475                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39476                                  isFreeMCB:
 39477                                  	;or	word [es:1],0
 39478 00005FB2 26830E010000            	or	word [es:arena_owner],0
 39479 00005FB8 C3                      	retn
 39480                                  
 39481                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39482                                  ;*** hideMCB - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 39483                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 39485                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as HIDDEN
 39486                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39487                                  ; USES:     None
 39488                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39489

 39495 00005FC0 26C70608004849          	mov	word [es:arena_name+0], 'HI' ; 4948h
 39496 00005FC7 26C7060A004444          	mov	word [es:arena_name+2], 'DD' ; 4444h
 39497 00005FCE 26C7060C00454E          	mov	word [es:arena_name+4], 'EN' ; 4E45h
 39498                                  	;mov	word [es:14],2020h
 39499 00005FD5 26C7060E002020          	mov	word [es:arena_name+6], '  ' ; 2020h 
 39500 00005FDC C3                      	retn

 39503                                  ;*** unHideMCB - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 39504                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 39506                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as FREE
 39507                                  ; ERROR:    None

 39521                                  	;mov	[es:14],ax

 39523                                  	;pop	ax

 39526                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39527                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 39528                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 39529                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39530                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 39531                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 39532                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 39533                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 39534                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39535                                  
 39536                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39537                                  findumb:
 39538                                  	;pushreg <ax,cx,dx>
 39539                                  	
 39540                                  	;push	ax
 39541 00005FF8 51                      	push	cx
 39542 00005FF9 52                      	push	dx
 39543                                  
 39544 00005FFA 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 39545                                  
 39546 00005FFC 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 39547                                  
 39548 00005FFE E882FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 39549                                  
 39550 00006001 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39551 00006003 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 39552                                  
 39553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 39554                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 39555                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 39556                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 39557                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 39558                                  
 39559                                  fu10:	
 39560 00006005 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 39561 00006007 741B                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 39562                                  
 39563 00006009 E884FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 39564 0000600C 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 39565                                  
 39566 0000600E 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 39567                                  fu20:
 39568                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39569 0000600F 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39570                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 39571 00006013 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39572 00006015 740C                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 39573                                  
 39574                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 39575                                  
 39576 00006017 8CC0                     	mov	ax,es		; NextMCB (macro)
 39577                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 39578 00006019 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39579 0000601E 40                      	inc	ax
 39580 0000601F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39581                                  
 39582 00006021 EBE2                    	jmp	short fu10
 39583                                  fuE:
 39584 00006023 F9                      	stc
 39585                                  fuX:
 39586                                  	;popreg	<dx,cx,ax>	; The address is already in ES.
 39587                                  	
 39588 00006024 5A                      	pop	dx
 39589 00006025 59                      	pop	cx
 39590                                  	
 39591                                  	;pop	ax
 39592 00006026 C3                      	retn
 39593                                  
 39594                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39595                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 39596                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39597                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 39598                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 39599                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 39600                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 39601                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39602                                  
 39603                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39604                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6624h
 39605                                  BigFree:
 39606                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx>
 39607                                  	
 39608                                  	;push	bx
 39609 00006027 51                      	push	cx
 39610                                  
 39611 00006028 E8CDFF                  	call	findumb			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 39612 0000602B 7239                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 39613                                  
 39614 0000602D 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 39615 0000602F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 39616                                  
 39617                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 39618                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 39619                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 39620                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 39621                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 39622                                  
 39623                                  bf10:
 39624 00006031 E85CFE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 39625 00006034 7427                    	jz	short bf30
 39626                                  
 39627 00006036 E879FF                  	call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 39628 00006039 750E                    	jnz	short bf20
 39629                                  
 39630                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:3]
 39631 0000603B 263B0E0300              	cmp	cx,[es:arena_size]	; Compare sizes...
 39632 00006040 7F07                    	jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 39633                                  
 39634 00006042 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 39635                                  	;mov	cx,[es:3]
 39636 00006044 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:arena_size]	; and its size.
 39637                                  bf20:
 39638                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39639 00006049 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39640                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'  ; 5Ah
 39641 0000604D 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39642 0000604F 740C                    	je	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 39643                                  
 39644                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 39645                                  
 39646 00006051 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es 
 39647                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 39648 00006053 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:arena_size]
 39649 00006058 40                      	inc	ax
 39650 00006059 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39651                                  
 39652 0000605B EBD4                    	jmp	short bf10
 39653                                  bf30:
 39654 0000605D 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 39655 0000605F 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 39656 00006061 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 39657 00006063 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 39658                                  bfE:
 39659 00006065 F9                      	stc
 39660                                  bfX:
 39661                                  	;popreg	<cx,bx>
 39662                                  
 39663 00006066 59                      	pop	cx
 39664                                  	;pop	bx
 39665                                  
 39666 00006067 C3                      	retn
 39667                                  
 39668                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39669                                  ;*** isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 39670                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39671                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 39672                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if UMB wasn't specified, ZF clear if it was
 39673                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39674                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39675                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39676                                  
 39677                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39678                                  isSpecified:
 39679                                  	;push	ax
 39680                                  
 39681 00006068 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 39682 0000606A 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 39683                                  
 39684                                  	;getdata al,DS:UmbUsed[bx]
 39685                                  
 39686 0000606C 1E                      	push	ds
 39687 0000606D 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 39688 00006071 8A87[5E04]              	mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 39689 00006075 1F                      	pop     ds
 39690                                  
 39691 00006076 08C0                    	or	al,al		; Sets ZF if al==0 (ie, if unspecified)
 39692                                  
 39693                                  	;pop	ax
 39694 00006078 C3                      	retn
 39695                                  
 39696                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39697                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 39698                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39699                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 39700                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 39701                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 39702                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39703                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39704                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 39705                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's onnly 0x10 bytes, that
 39706                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 39707                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 39708                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 39709                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39710                                  
 39711                                  ;MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ 20h
 39712                                  
 39713                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39714                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:667Ah
 39715                                  shrinkMCB:
 39716                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 39717                                  
 39718                                  	;push	bx
 39719 00006079 51                      	push	cx ; *
 39720 0000607A 26                      	psuh	es ; **
 39721                                  
 39722 0000607B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 39723 0000607D 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 39724                                  
 39725 0000607F 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:arena_size]
 39726 00006084 83E920                  	sub	cx,32 ; sub cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE
 39727                                  	;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 39728                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 39729 00006087 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx
 39730 00006089 723E                    	jb	short smE ; cf = 1 (***)
 39731

 39733 0000608B 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:arena_signature]
 39734

 39736                                  	;mov	cx,[es:arena_size] ; *!
 39737

 39750
