 39780                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39781                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 39782                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39783                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 39784                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 39785                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39786                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 39787                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39788                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 39789                                  ;
 39790                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 39791                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 39792                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 39793                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 39794                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 39795                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 39796                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 39797                                  ;       Endif
 39798                                  ;    Endif
 39799                                  ; Endif
 39800                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 39801                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 39802                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 39803                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 39804                                  ;    ENDIF
 39805                                  ; ENDIF
 39806                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39807                                  
 39808                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39809                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:66D7h
 39810                                  hideUMB?:
 39811                                  	;pushreg <bx,dx,es>
 39812                                  
 39813                                  	;push	bx
 39814                                  	;push	dx
 39815                                  	;push	es
 39816                                  
 39817 000060CD 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 39818 000060CF E896FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 39819                                  	;jz	short hu?20
 39820                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39821 000060D2 7432                    	jz	short hu?25 ; *
 39822                                  
 39823 000060D4 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 39824 000060D6 E84EFF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 39825                                  	;jc	short hu?20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 39826                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39827 000060D9 723B                    	jc	short hu?X ; **
 39828                                  
 39829 000060DB 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 39830 000060DC 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 39831 000060DE E88AFE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 39832 000060E1 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 39833                                  
 39834 000060E2 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 39835                                  	;jz	short hu?20	; Skip over all this.
 39836                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39837 000060E4 7530                    	jnz	short hu?X ; **
 39838                                  
 39839 000060E6 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 39840 000060E8 7607                    	jbe	short hu?10
 39841                                  
 39842 000060EA 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 39843 000060EC E898FC                  	call	unMarkUMB
 39844                                  	;jmp	short hu?20 ; ***
 39845                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39846                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=1) ; ***
 39847 000060EF EB15                    	jmp	short hu?25
 39848                                  hu?10:
 39849 000060F1 E8B0FE                  	call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 39850                                  	;jz	short hu?20
 39851                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39852                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=0) ; **
 39853 000060F4 7420                    	jz	short hu?X
 39854                                  
 39855 000060F6 E880FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 39856                                  	;jc	short hu?20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 39857                                  	; 17/06/2023
 39858                                  	; ('isSpecified' would return with ZF=0) ; **
 39859 000060F9 721B                    	jc	short hu?X
 39860                                  
 39861 000060FB 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 39862 000060FD EB09                    	jmp	short hu?30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 39863                                  hu?20:
 39864                                  	;mov	al,cl
 39865 000060FF 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 39866 00006101 E864FF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 39867 00006104 7510                    	jnz	short hu?X ; **	; so leave.
 39868                                  hu?25:	; 17/06/2023 ; *
 39869 00006106 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 39870                                  hu?30:
 39871 00006108 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 39872                                  
 39873 0000610A E870FE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 39874                                  
 39875 0000610D 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 39876 0000610F 7405                    	jz	short hu?X	; So we should leave.
 39877                                  
 39878 00006111 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 39879 00006113 E8C7FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 39880                                  hu?X:
 39881                                  	;popreg	<es,dx,bx>
 39882                                  
 39883                                  	;pop	es
 39884                                  	;pop	dx
 39885                                  	;pop	bx
 39886                                  
 39887 00006116 C3                      	retn
 39888                                  
 39889                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39890                                  ;*** UmbTest - returns with carry set if UMBs are not available, else CF==false
 39891                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39892                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 39893                                  ; EXIT:     Carry is clear if UMBs are available, or set if they are not
 39894                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39895                                  ; USES:     CF (AX,BX,DS,ES pushed 'cause they're used by others)
 39896                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39897                                  
 39898                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39899                                  UmbTest:
 39900                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx,ds,es>
 39901

 39904                                  	;push	ds
 39905                                  	;push	es
 39906                                  
 39907 00006117 E88CFB                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs (if not already linked)
 39908 0000611A E80600                  	call	WalkMem		; Check to see if they're really linked
 39909 0000611D 9C                      	pushf			; And remember what we found out
 39910 0000611E E89CFB                  	call	fm_unlink	; Unlink UMBs (if WE have linked 'em)
 39911 00006121 9D                      	popf			; And restore what we found out.
 39912                                  
 39913                                  	;popreg	<es,ds,bx,ax>
 39914                                  	
 39915                                  	;pop	es
 39916                                  	;pop	ds
 39917                                  	;pop	bx
 39918                                  	;pop	ax
 39919                                  	
 39920 00006122 C3                      	retn
 39921                                  
 39922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39923                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear iff UMBs are linked
 39924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39925                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 39926                                  ; EXIT:     Carry SET if MCB chain stops before 9FFF, CLEAR if stops >= 9FFF.
 39927                                  ; ERROR:    None
 39928                                  ; USES:     Flags
 39929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39930                                  
 39931                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 39932                                  WalkMem:
 39933                                  	;pushreg <ax,bx,es>
 39934                                  	
 39935                                  	;push	ax
 39936                                  	;push	bx
 39937 00006123 06                      	push	es
 39938                                  
 39939 00006124 B452                    	mov	ah,52h ; DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS
 39940                                  				; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 39941 00006126 CD21                    	int	21h
 39942                                  
 39943 00006128 268B47FE                	mov	ax,[es:bx-2]
 39944                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 39945                                  
 39946                                  ; ------------------------------
 39947                                  ; UM10: ES = Current MCB pointer
 39948                                  ; ------------------------------
 39949                                  
 39950                                  um10:	
 39951 0000612C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 39952                                  
 39953                                  	;mov	al,[es:0]
 39954 0000612E 26A00000                	mov	al,[es:arena_signature]
 39955                                  	;cmp	al,'Z' ; 5Ah
 39956 00006132 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 39957 00006134 740A                    	je	short um20	; If signature == 'Z', hay no more.
 39958                                  
 39959                                  	;NextMCB es,bx		; Move to the next MCB
 39960                                  	
 39961                                  	;mov	bx,es
 39962                                  	;;add	bx,[es:3]
 39963                                  	;add	bx,[es:arena_size]
 39964                                  	;inc	bx
 39965                                  	;mov	es,bx
 39966 00006136 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es

 39969                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 39970                                  
 39971 0000613E EBEC                    	jmp	short um10	; And restart the loop.
 39972                                  um20:
 39973 00006140 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39974 00006142 3DFF9F                  	cmp	ax,9FFFh	; This sets CF if ax < 9FFF.
 39975                                  
 39976                                  	;popreg	<es,bx,ax>
 39977 00006145 07                      	pop	es
 39978                                  	;pop	bx
 39979                                  	;pop	ax
 39980                                  
 39981 00006146 C3                      	retn

 39983                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 40009

 40011

 40015                                  	;pop	ds

 40024                                  ;============================================================================
 40025                                  ; LOADHIGH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 40026                                  ;============================================================================
 40027                                  ; 12/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40028                                  
 40029                                  ; This is a new module added to support loading programs into UMBs provided
 40030                                  ; by DOS 5.0. 
 40031                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40032                                  ; Usage:
 40033                                  ;
 40034                                  ; LOADHIGH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] <filespec>
 40035                                  ;
 40036                                  ; <filespec> has to be a filename that is not wildcarded.
 40037                                  
 40038                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40039                                  ;
 40040                                  ;	Revision History
 40041                                  ;	================
 40042                                  ;
 40043                                  ;	M009	SR	08/01/90	Set flags to indicate that we are
 40044                                  ;				loading and high and also remember
 40045                                  ;				current UMB state.
 40046                                  ;
 40047                                  ;	M016	SR	08/09/90	Give special error message on attempt
 40048                                  ;				to loadhigh batch files and invalid
 40049                                  ;				filename on Loadhigh command line.
 40050                                  ;
 40051                                  ;	M039	SR	11/19/90	Bug #4270. Copy all the whitespaces
 40052                                  ;				after the program name also as part
 40053                                  ;				of the command line being passed to
 40054                                  ;				the program to be invoked.
 40055                                  ;
 40056                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40057                                  
 40058                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40059                                  ;
 40060                                  ;	include highload.inc		; Grab code for ParseVar and such
 40061                                  
 40062                                  iCmdLine	equ	81h		; PSP:81h points to command-line
 40063                                  
 40064                                  ;
 40065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40066                                  
 40067                                  ;****	LoadHigh -- Main routine for Loadhigh command
 40068                                  ;
 40069                                  ;	ENTRY	Command line tail is at PSP:iCmdLine terminated by 0dh
 40070                                  ;		CS = DS = SS = TRANGROUP
 40071                                  ;
 40072                                  ;	EXIT	None
 40073                                  ;
 40074                                  ;	USED	ax, bx, cx, dx, si, di, es
 40075                                  ;
 40076                                  ;	ERROR EXITS
 40077                                  ;		Message pointers are setup at the error locations and then
 40078                                  ;	we jump back to CERROR which is the transient error recycle point.
 40079                                  ;	Apart from parse errors, the other errors handled are too many
 40080                                  ;	switches anf invalid filenames.
 40081                                  ;
 40082                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40083                                  ;		The allocation strategy and the state of the arena chain are
 40084                                  ;	put in the requested state according to the given options. If a 
 40085                                  ;	filename is also given, it is executed as well.
 40086                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40087                                  
 40088                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40089                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5927h
 40090                                  
 40091                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40092                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:683Fh
 40093                                  LoadHigh:
 40094 00006164 1E                      	push	ds
 40095 00006165 07                      	pop	es
 40096                                  	
 40097                                  	; 16/06/2023
 40098                                  	;call	SkipLhDelims	; MSDOS 5.0 !
 40099                                  
 40100                                  ;Get command tail to be passed to the program. This includes any whitespace
 40101                                  ;chars between the program name and its parameters as well.
 40102                                  ;On return, ds:si points at the start of the command tail.
 40103                                  
 40104                                  	; 16/06/2023
 40105                                  	;push	si		; MSDOS 5.0 !
 40106 00006166 E81300                  	call	ParseLhCmd
 40107                                  	;pop	si		; MSDOS 5.0 !	
 40108 00006169 720E                    	jc	short LhErr
 40109                                  	
 40110 0000616B E86500                  	call	SetupCmdLine		;setup pgm's command line
 40111                                  
 40112 0000616E E88700                  	call	SetupPath		;setup path for file
 40113 00006171 7206                    	jc	short LhErr		;file not found
 40114                                  
 40115                                  ;Set allocation strategy to HighFirst and link in UMBs for exec. This will
 40116                                  ;be reset after return from the Exec
 40117                                  ;We will also set a resident flag to indicate that UMBs were activated for
 40118                                  ;the Exec. On return from the Exec, this flag will be used to deactivate UMBs
 40119                                  
 40120 00006173 E8AFFD                  	call	HideUMBs		;prepare upper-memory for load
 40121                                  
 40122 00006176 E90DCB                  	jmp	LH_EXECUTE		;go and exec file ;M051
 40123                                  
 40124                                  LhErr:
 40125                                  ;The error message has been setup at this stage
 40126                                  
 40127 00006179 E95DCB                  	jmp	cerror			;print error message and recycle 
 40128                                  
 40129                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40130                                  					
 40131                                  ;*** 	ParseLhCmd - parses any command-line options
 40132                                  ;
 40133                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 40134                                  ;
 40135                                  ;	EXIT	Carry clear -- command line parsed successfully
 40136                                  ;		Carry set -- appropriate error message setup
 40137                                  ;
 40138                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 40139                                  ;
 40140                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40141                                  ;		Options set up (see highvar.inc)
 40142                                  ;		Filename to be executed setup
 40143                                  ;
 40144                                  ;	ParseLhCmd calls InitVar to initialize data filled in by ParseVar,
 40145                                  ;	then calls ParseVar itself to actually parse the commmand-line.  On
 40146                                  ;	return from ParseVar, DS:SI will point to the beginning of the child
 40147                                  ;	module's name on the command-line; thus it calls LhCopyFilename to
 40148                                  ;	prepare the command-line for that program.
 40149                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40150                                  
 40151                                  ; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40152                                  %if 0
 40153                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40154                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5944h
 40155                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 40156                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40157                                  ParseLhCmd:
 40158                                  	;mov	si,81h
 40159                                  	mov	si,iCmdLine	;ds:si points at command line
 40160                                  
 40161                                  	mov	word [COMSW],0
 40162                                  	mov	di,Parse_LoadHi
 40163                                  	xor	cx,cx
 40164                                  	call	Parse_With_Msg
 40165                                  
 40166                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40167                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 40168                                  	;jz	short PLhCmd2
 40169                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 40170                                  	;jnz	short PLhCmd1
 40171                                  	; 11/06/2023
 40172                                  	inc	ax ; cmp ax,-1
 40173                                  	jz	short PLhCmd2 ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 40174                                  	dec	ax ; cmp ax,0
 40175                                  	jnz	short PLhCmd1 ; 1 -> 0
 40176                                  	; ax = 0
 40177                                  
 40178                                  	mov	bx,dx
 40179                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40180                                  	;call	LhCopyFilename
 40181                                  	;; 13/04/2023
 40182                                  	;;;jc	short PLhCmd2  ; !!! jmp short PLhCmd2 !!!
 40183                                  	;;jmp	short PLhCmd2
 40184                                  	;retn
 40185                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40186                                  	jmp	short LhCopyFilename
 40187                                  PLhCmd1:
 40188                                  	stc
 40189                                  PLhCmd2:
 40190                                  	retn
 40191                                  %endif
 40192                                  
 40193                                  	; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40194                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:6857h
 40195                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40196                                  ParseLhCmd:
 40197                                  	;assume	ds:TRANGROUP, es:TRANGROUP
 40198                                  	
 40199                                  	;mov	si,81h
 40200 0000617C BE8100                  	mov	si,iCmdLine	;ds:si points at command line
 40201                                  
 40202                                  	; es = ds (from 'LoadHigh') 
 40203                                  	;push	es		;Store ES 'cause we're gonna change it:
 40204                                  
 40205                                  	;push	ds
 40206                                  	;pop	es		;Make sure es:si points to cmd line as well
 40207                                  
 40208 0000617F E8ACFA                  	call	InitVar		;Initialize data for ParseVar
 40209                                  
 40210 00006182 E84AFB                  	call	ParseVar	;And parse the command line
 40211                                  
 40212                                  	;pop	es		;Restore ES now; we're done with it.
 40213                                  
 40214 00006185 7317                    	jnc	short plcC	;If no error, continue on our way.
 40215                                  
 40216 00006187 83F802                  	cmp	ax,2 ; PV_BadUMB
 40217                                  				;Bad UMB passed?
 40218 0000618A 7505                    	jne	short plc10
 40219                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhBadUMB_Ptr
 40220 0000618C BA[AF91]                	mov	dx,LhBadUMB_Ptr
 40221 0000618F F9                      	stc
 40222 00006190 C3                      	retn
 40223                                  plc10:	
 40224                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhInvSwt_Ptr
 40225 00006191 BA[AC91]                	mov	dx,LhInvSwt_Ptr
 40226 00006194 83F803                  	cmp	ax,3 ; PV_InvSwt
 40227                                  				;Unrecognized switch passed?
 40228 00006197 7403                    	je	short plc20
 40229                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:LhInvArg_Ptr
 40230 00006199 BA[A691]                	mov	dx,LhInvArg_Ptr

 40273                                  ;***	LhCopyFilename -- copy filename from command line to buffer
 40274                                  ;
 40275                                  ;	ENTRY	ds:si points at primary argument (filename)
 40276                                  ;
 40277                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set -- filename has wildcards. In this event, DX will
 40278                                  ;				already contain an appropriate error number.
 40279                                  ;		Carry clear -- filename has been copied as needed; DS:SI
 40280                                  ;				points to first character (most likely space)
 40281                                  ;				after filename.
 40282                                  ;
 40283                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 40284                                  ;
 40285                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40286                                  ;		ExecPath contains the filename
 40287                                  ;
 40288                                  ; If there are any wildcards in the filename, then we have an error
 40289                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40290                                  
 40291                                  ; 16/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40292                                  %if 0
 40293                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40294                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5984h
 40295                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 40296                                  LhCopyFilename:
 40297                                  	push	ds
 40298                                  	push	si
 40299                                  	push	di
 40300                                  	lds	si,[bx+4]
 40301                                  	mov	di,EXECPATH
 40302                                  lhcpfn1:
 40303                                  	lodsb
 40304                                  	cmp	al,2Ah ; '*'
 40305                                  	jz	short lhfilerr
 40306                                  	cmp	al,3Fh ; '?'
 40307                                  	jz	short lhfilerr
 40308                                  	stosb
 40309                                  	or	al,al
 40310                                  	jnz	short lhcpfn1
 40311                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40312                                  	; cf = 0
 40313                                  	;clc
 40314                                  lhfilerr2:
 40315                                  	pop	di
 40316                                  	pop	si
 40317                                  	pop	ds
 40318                                  	retn
 40319                                  lhfilerr:
 40320                                  	mov	dx,LhInvFil_Ptr
 40321                                  	stc
 40322                                  	jmp	short lhfilerr2
 40323                                  
 40324                                  %endif
 40325

 40357

 40359                                  	;;jz	@f
 40360                                  	;je	short lhcpfn2	
 40361

 40363 000061BD 41                      	inc	cx			;And remember that we did one more
 40364                                  	;jmp	short @b
 40365 000061BE EBE3                    	jmp	short lhcpfn1
 40366                                  ;@@:

 40557                                  ;***	SetupPath -- Do path search for the file to be executed
 40558                                  ;
 40559                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 40560                                  ;
 40561                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set if file not found or not executable file
 40562                                  ;
 40563                                  ;	EFFECTS
 40564                                  ;		ExecPath contains the full path of the file to be executed
 40565                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40566                                  
 40567                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 40568                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5A0Fh
 40569                                  
 40570                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40571                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:68E3h
 40572                                  SetupPath:
 40573                                  
 40574                                  ;Juggle around the argv pointers to make argv[1] into argv[0]. This is 
 40575                                  ;because the path search routine that we are about to invoke expects the
 40576                                  ;filename to search for to be argv[0].
 40577                                  ;
 40578                                  ;If our new argv[0] starts with a switcharacter, it's an option... skip right
 40579                                  ;over it by doing the whole move again (smaller, of course, this time).
 40580                                  
 40581                                  
 40582                                  	;mov	ax,arg.argvcnt		;total number of arguments
 40583                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40584                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 40585 000061F8 A1[5EA1]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 40586                                  
 40587 000061FB 48                      	dec	ax			;less one - skip "LoadHigh"
 40588                                  	;mov	bx,SIZE Argv_ele
 40589 000061FC BB0B00                  	mov	bx,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 40590                                  	;mov	bx,11
 40591 000061FF F7E3                    	mul	bx			;dx:ax = size of argument lists
 40592                                  
 40593                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS 4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40594                                  	; --------------------------------------
 40595                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40596                                  
 40597                                  	;getdata cl,fm_argc		;CL = number of arguments to skip
 40598 00006201 1E                      	push	ds              ; getdata (macro)
 40599 00006202 8E1E[429B]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 40600 00006206 8A0E[3705]              	mov	cl,[fm_argc]
 40601 0000620A 1F                      	pop	ds
 40602                                  	
 40603 0000620B FEC1                    	inc	cl			;Skip one arg, to get over "lh"
 40604                                  
 40605                                  ;Move argv[1]..argv[n] to argv[0]..argv[n-1]. Here, AX == the overall size
 40606                                  ;of the argument lists.
 40607                                  
 40608                                  argloop:
 40609 0000620D E31B                    	jcxz	argdone			;If we've finished copying args, leave.
 40610                                  
 40611 0000620F 49                      	dec	cx			;One less time we'll go through this.
 40612                                  
 40613 00006210 50                      	push	ax			;Copy ( size of remaining list ) bytes
 40614 00006211 51                      	push	cx			;And remember how many args there were
 40615                                  
 40616                                  	; --------------------------------------
 40617                                  
 40618                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40619 00006212 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			;size to move
 40620                                  
 40621                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:Arg	;Copy TO argv[0]
 40622                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGV ;mov di,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv] ; mov di,[ARG]
 40623 00006214 BF[9E9E]                	mov	di,ARG	
 40624 00006217 89FE                    	mov	si,di			;
 40625                                  	;add	si,SIZE Argv_ele	;Copy FROM argv[1]
 40626 00006219 83C60B                  	add	si,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 40627                                  	
 40628                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40629                                  	;mov	cx,ax
 40630                                  
 40631 0000621C FC                      	cld
 40632 0000621D F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;Move the argument list
 40633                                  	
 40634                                  	;dec	arg.argvcnt		;Fake one less argument, and
 40635                                  	;dec	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 40636 0000621F FF0E[5EA1]              	dec	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 40637                                  
 40638                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS 4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40639                                  	; --------------------------------------
 40640                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40641                                  	
 40642                                  	;sub	ax,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11	;there's one argument we don't copy.
 40643                                  
 40644 00006223 59                      	pop	cx
 40645 00006224 58                      	pop	ax			;Restore the size of the arg list
 40646                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40647                                  	;jmp	short argloop
 40648                                  	
 40649                                  	; 17/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 40650 00006225 83E80B                  	sub	ax,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 40651 00006228 77E3                    	ja	short argloop
 40652                                  	; --------------------------------------
 40653                                  	
 40654                                  ; Done moving... argv[0] is now the child program's name, and [1] its first arg
 40655                                  
 40656                                  	; 17/06/2023
 40657                                  argdone:
 40658 0000622A E8C3D2                  	call	path_search		;look in the path
 40659                                  
 40660                                  ;ax = 0, no file found
 40661                                  ;ax < 4, batch file found -- cant be executed
 40662                                  ;ax = 4,8 => .com or .exe file found
 40663                                  
 40664 0000622D 09C0                    	or	ax,ax			;any file found?
 40665 0000622F 740B                    	jz	short no_exec_file	;no, error
 40666                                  
 40667 00006231 83F804                  	cmp	ax,4			;executable file?
 40668                                  	;jl	short no_exec_bat	;no, indicate fail ; M016
 40669                                  	;clc
 40670                                  	;retn
 40671                                  	; 14/04/2023
 40672 00006234 7201                    	jb	short no_exec_bat
 40673 00006236 C3                      	retn 
 40674                                  
 40675                                  no_exec_bat:
 40676 00006237 BA[9D91]                	mov	dx,NoExecBat_Ptr	;Setup message ptr ; M016
 40677 0000623A EB06                    	jmp	short lhsp_errret	;return error; M016
 40678                                  
 40679                                  no_exec_file:
 40680 0000623C B80200                  	mov	ax,ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 2
 40681 0000623F E8AAFF                  	call	LhSetupErrMsg		;setup error message
 40682                                  lhsp_errret:				; M016
 40683 00006242 F9                      	stc
 40684 00006243 C3                      	retn

 43593                                  ; PARSE BLOCK FOR CHCP
 43594                                  
 43595                                  ; The following parse control block can be used for any command which
 43596                                  ; needs only one optional three digit decimal parameter for operands.
 43597                                  ; Returns verified result in PARSE1_OUTPUT. Currently used for the
 43598                                  ; CHCP internal command.
 43599                                  
 43600                                  CHCP_MINVAL	EQU	100			;AN000;
 43601                                  CHCP_MAXVAL	EQU	999			;AN000;
 43602

 43610 0000951D 00                      	db	0				;AN000;  no keywords
 43611

 43744                                  ; PARSE BLOCK FOR DIR
 43745                                  
 43746                                  ; The following parse control block is used for the DIR internal command.
 43747                                  ; This command has one optional file specification and several optional
 43748                                  ; switches. Switches, switch values, and the filespec are returned in 
 43749                                  ; PARSE1_OUTPUT.
 43750                                  ;
 43751                                  ; Switches are /a[value], /-a, /o[value], /-o, /s, /-s, /?, /b, /-b,
 43752                                  ; /w, /-w, /p, and /-p. The string values for /a and /o are optional,
 43753                                  ; do not require colons, and are not checked against a value list.
 43754                                  ;
 43755                                  ; Switch /h has been removed from the DIR command	;M008
 43756                                  ; Switch /? is no longer handled internally		;M008
 43757                                  ;
 43758                                  ; A list of pointers to all the switch synonyms is provided here to
 43759                                  ; help identify which switch has been matched.
 43760                                  
 43761                                  	; 15/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 43762                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:8815h
 43763

 44193                                  ;TITLE	COMMAND Transient Uninitialized DATA
 44194                                  
 44195                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 44196                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 44197                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 44198                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 44199                                  ;cycle to command cycle.

 44201                                  ;No constant data values should be stored here.
